div1.sense: to twist, twirl or whirl about, Ar.:—metaph. to make dizzy, distract, Aesch.: —Pass. to whirl about, Aesch.

div1.head: στροβιλίζω
div1.sense: to twist about, Anth.

div1.head: στροβιλοειδής
div1.sense: conical, Strab.

div1.head: στροβιλός
div1.sense: spinning, whirling, Anth.

div1.head: στρόβιλος
div1.sense: anything twisted or whirled: a top, Plat.
a whirlpool, whirlwind, Luc.
a whirling dance, pirouette, Ar.

div1.head: στρόβος
div1.sense: a twisting or whirling round, of the effect of a whirlwind, Aesch.

div1.head: στρογγύλλω
div1.sense: to twirl, spin, Anth.

div1.head: στρογγύλος
div1.sense: round, spherical, Hdt., Ar., etc.; λίθοι στρ. pebbles, Xen.
circular, Plat.
round, compactly formed, Xen.
of ships, στρ. ναῦς, στρ. πλοῖον, a merchant-ship, from its round shape, as opp. to the long narrow ship-of-war (μακρὰ ναῦς) , Hdt., Thuc., etc.
metaph. of phrases, well-rounded, compact, pithy, terse, Ar., Plat.:—adv., στρογγυλώτατα as tersely as possible, Arist.

div1.head: στρογγυλότης
div1.sense: roundness, Plat.

div1.head: στρομβηδόν
div1.sense: like a top, whirling, Anth.

div1.head: στρόμβος
div1.sense: a body rounded or spun round: hence,
a top, Lat. turbo, Il.
a whirlwind, Aesch.
a snail, Theocr.

div1.head: στρούθειον
div1.sense: στρούθειον μῆλον, ου, τό, a kind of quince, Anth.

div1.head: στρουθοκάμηλος
div1.sense: an ostrich, from its camel-like neck, Strab.

div1.head: στρουθός
div1.sense: the sparrow, Il., etc.

ὁ μέγας στρ. the large bird, i. e. the ostrich, Struthio, Xen.: also called στρουθὸς κατάγαιος (i. e. the bird that runs on the ground, does not fly), Hdt.; also simply στρουθός, like στρουθοκάμηλος, Ar.

div1.head: στρουθοφάγος
div1.sense: feeding on birds, Strab.

div1.head: στροφαῖος
div1.sense: epith. of Hermes, standing as porter at the door-hinges, with a play on the sense of twisty, shifty, Ar.

div1.head: στροφάλιγξ
div1.sense: a whirl, eddy, Hom.:—metaph., στρ. μάχης Anth.

div1.head: στροφαλίζω
div1.sense: ἠλάκατα στρ. to turn the spindle, Od.

div1.head: στροφάς
div1.sense: turning round, Ἄρκτου στροφάδες κέλευθοι the Bearʼs revolving path, Soph.
Στροφάδες (sc. νῆσοι) , αἱ, the drifting isles, a group not far from Zacynthus, supposed to have been once floating.

div1.head: στροφεῖον
div1.sense: a twisted noose, cord, Xen.
a windlass, capstan, on which a cable runs, Luc.

div1.head: στροφεύς
div1.sense: the socket in which the pivot of a door (ὁ στρόφιγξ) moved, Ar.

div1.head: στροφέω
div1.sense: to have the colic (v. στρόφος II), Ar.

div1.head: στροφή
div1.sense: a turning, e.g. of a horse, Xen.; ἐν στροφαῖσιν ὀμμάτων with rolling of the eyes, Eur.
a twist, such as wrestlers make to elude their adversary, Plat.:—metaph. a trick, dodge, Ar.
the turning of the Chorus as they danced from right to left of the ὀρχήστρα· the strain sung during this evolution, the strophe, to which the ἀντιστροφή answers.

div1.head: στρόφιγξ
div1.sense: the pivot, axle or pin on which a body turns, Eur.
στρόφιγγες were pivots working in sockets, at top and bottom of a door, which served instead of hinges, Plut.
metaph., στρ. γλώττης, of a well-hung tongue, Ar.

div1.head: στρόφιον
div1.sense: a band worn by women round the breast, Ar.
a headband worn by priests, Plut.

div1.head: στρόφις
div1.sense: a twisting, slippery fellow, Ar.

div1.head: στροφοδινέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to wheel eddying round, of vultures wheeling round their nest, Aesch.

div1.head: στρόφος
div1.sense: a twisted band or cord, used as a sword-belt, Od.: generally, a cord, rope, Hdt.
= στρόφιον, a maiden-zone, Aesch.
a swathing-cloth, swaddling-band, Hhymn.
a twisting of the bowels, colic, Lat. tormina, Ar.

div1.head: Στρυμονίας
div1.sense: (sc. ἄνεμος) , a wind blowing from the Strymon, i. e. a NNE. wind, Hdt.

div1.head: Στρυμών
div1.sense: the Strymon, a river of Thrace, Hes., Hdt.:—adj. Στρυμόνιος, η, ον of the Strymon, Aesch., Eur.; and Στρυμονικός, ή, όν, Strab.

div1.head: στρυφνός
div1.sense: of a taste which draws up the mouth, rough, harsh, astringent, Xen., Anth.
metaph. of temper or manner, harsh, austere, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: στρυφνότης
div1.sense: a rough, harsh taste: metaph. harshness of temper, Plut.

div1.head: στρῶμα
div1.sense: anything spread or laid out for lying or sitting upon, a mattress, bed, Lat. stragulum, vestis stragula, Theogn.:—in pl. the bedclothes, the coverings of a dinner-couch, Ar., etc.
a horsecloth, horse-trappings, Xen.

div1.head: στρωματόδεσμον
div1.sense: a leathern or linen sack in which slaves had to tie up the bedclothes (στρώματα) , Xen., Aeschin.

div1.head: στρωματοφύλαξ
div1.sense: one who has the care of the bedding, Plut.

div1.head: στρωμνή
div1.sense: a bed spread or prepared; generally, a bed, couch, Pind., Aesch., etc.: a mattress, bedding, Xen.; στρ. ἄφθιτος, of the golden fleece, Pind.

div1.head: στρώτης
div1.sense: one that gets couches ready, Plut.

div1.head: στρωτός
div1.sense: spread, laid, covered, Hes., Eur.; στρωτὰ φάρη bed clothes, Soph.

div1.head: στρωφάω
div1.sense: Frequent. of στρέφω, as τρωπάω of τρέπω, to turn constantly, στρ. ἠλάκατα to keep turning the spindle, i. e. spin, Od.:—Pass. to keep turning, so as to face the enemy, Il.: to roam about, wander, Il.; στρ. ἀνὰ τὴν πόλιν Hdt.; hence, like Lat. versari in loco, to move freely in a place, live there, Il.; ἐν λέχει στρωφώμενος, i. e. claiming a husbandʼs rights, Aesch.

div1.head: στυγάνωρ
div1.sense: hating a man or the male sex, Aesch.

div1.head: στυγερός
div1.sense: poet. adj. hated, abominated, loathed, or hateful, abominable, loathsome, Hom., Trag.:—c. dat. bearing hatred or malice towards one, στυγερὸς δέ οἱ ἔπλετο θυμῷ Il.
hateful, wretched, miserable, Soph., Ar.
adv. -ρῶς, to oneʼs sorrow, miserably, Hom., Soph.

div1.head: στυγερώπης
div1.sense: of hateful look, horrible, Hes.

div1.head: στυγέω
div1.sense: to hate, abominate, abhor, stronger than μισέω, Hom., Trag.:—c. inf. to hate or fear to do a thing, Il., Soph.:—Pass. to be abhorred, detested, Aesch.; τί δʼ ἐστι πρός γʼ ἐμοῦ στυγούμενον; what is the horrid thing that I have done? Soph.
in aor1, to make hateful, Od.

div1.head: στύγημα
div1.sense: an abomination, Eur.

div1.head: στυγητός
div1.sense: hated, abominated, hateful, Aesch., NTest.

div1.head: Στύγιος
div1.sense: Stygian, Aesch., Soph.
= στυγητός, hateful, abominable, Eur.

div1.head: στυγνάζω
div1.sense: to look gloomy, be sorrowful, NTest.; of weather, to be gloomy, lowering, NTest.

div1.head: στυγνός
div1.sense: hated, abhorred, hateful, Aesch., Soph.:—c. dat. hateful or hostile to one, Aesch., Soph.
gloomy, sullen, Lat. tristis, Aesch., Eur.; ὁρᾶν στυγνός gloomy to behold, Xen.;— στυγνὸς εἴκων yielding sullenly, with an ill grace, Soph.; neut. as adv., Soph.

div1.head: στυγνότης
div1.sense: gloominess, sullenness, Plut.

div1.head: στυγνόω
div1.sense: to make gloomy:—Pass. to be gloomy, Anth.

div1.head: στυγόδεμνος
div1.sense: hating marriage, Anth.

div1.head: στύγος
div1.sense: hatred, as expressed in looks, sullenness, gloom, Aesch.
an object of hatred, an abomination, Aesch.; of persons, δεσπότου στ. thy hated lord, Aesch.; στύγη θεῶν, of the Erinyes, Aesch.:— a deed of horror, Aesch.

div1.head: στυλίσκος
div1.sense: a staff or rod, Strab.

div1.head: στυλίς
div1.sense: a mast to carry a sail at the stern, as in a yawl, Plut.

div1.head: στυλοπινάκιον
div1.sense: a pillar with figures on it, Anth.

div1.head: στῦλος
div1.sense: a pillar, as a support or bearing, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: στυλόω
div1.sense: to prop with pillars; metaph. in Mid., ζωὴν στυλώσασθαι to support oneʼs life (by means of children), Anth.

div1.head: Στύμφαλος
div1.sense: a city and mountain of Arcadia, Il.:—adj. Στυμφάλιος, η, ον, Ionic -ήλιος, η, ον, Hdt., etc.; fem. Στυμφᾱλίς, ίδος, Strab.

div1.head: Στύξ
div1.sense: the Styx, i. e. the hateful, a river of the nether world, by which the gods in Homer swore their most sacred oaths, Il.

div1.head: στυππεῖον
div1.sense: the coarse fibre of flax or hemp, tow, oakum, Lat. stuppa, Hdt., Xen., etc.

div1.head: στυππειοπώλης
div1.sense: a dealer in oakum, Ar.

div1.head: στυπτηρία
div1.sense: an astringent earth, alum or vitriol, Hdt.

div1.head: στυράκινος
div1.sense: made of the wood of the tree στύραξ, Strab.

div1.head: στύραξ
div1.sense: storax, a fragrant gum, Arist.
ἡ στ., the tree producing this gum, Hdt.

div1.head: στύραξ2
div1.sense: the spike at the lower end of a spear-shaft, Xen., Plat.

div1.head: στυφελιγμός
div1.sense: ill-usage, abuse, Ar.

div1.head: στυφελίζω
div1.sense: to strike hard, smite, Il.; of the wind, to drive away clouds, Il.; ἐξ ἑδέων στυφελίξαι to thrust him from his seat, Il.
generally, to treat roughly, misuse, maltreat, Hom.

div1.head: στυφελός
div1.sense: hard, rough, Aesch.
metaph. harsh, severe, cruel, Aesch.

div1.head: στυφοκόπος
div1.sense: striking with a stick; used, like ὀρτυγοκόπος, of a game, in which they put quails in a ring, and hit them with little sticks; if a quail ran out of the ring, it was beaten, Ar.

div1.head: στύφω
div1.sense: to draw together: Pass., χείλεα στυφθείς having his lips drawn up by the taste, Anth.

div1.head: στωϊκός
div1.sense: of a colonnade or piazza:— hence, Stoic, of or belonging to the Stoics (because Zeno taught in the στοὰ Ποικίλη) , NTest.; cf. Στοϊκός.

div1.head: στωμυλία
div1.sense: wordiness, Ar.: small talk, Anth.

div1.head: στωμυλιοσυλλεκτάδης
div1.sense: a gossip-gleaner, Ar.

div1.head: στωμύλλω
div1.etym: from στωμύλος, as στρογγύλλω from στρογγύλος
div1.sense: to be talkative, to chatter, babble, Ar.:—so as Dep. στωμύλλομαι, fut. στωμυλοῦμαι, aor1 ἐστωμυλάμην, Ar.

div1.head: στωμύλος
div1.sense: mouthy, wordy, talkative, chattering, glib, Ar., Theocr.; τὰ στ. ταῦτα this nonsense, Anth.

div1.head: συαγρεσία
div1.sense: a boar-hunt, Anth.

div1.head: Συβαρίζω
div1.sense: to live like a Sybarite, Ar.

div1.head: Σύβαρις
div1.sense: Sybaris, a city of Magna Graecia, on a river of the same name, noted for luxury, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: Συβαρίτης
div1.sense: a Sybarite, Hdt., Ar.:—fem. Συβαρῖτις, ιδος, Ar.; and as adj., Theocr.

div1.head: Συβαριτικός
div1.sense: of Sybaris: λόγοι Σ. a class of fables among the Greeks, Ar.

div1.head: συβόσιον
div1.sense: a herd of swine, Hom.

div1.head: Σύβοτα
div1.sense: swine-pastures, name of some islets near Corcyra, Thuc.

div1.head: συβώτης
div1.sense: a swineherd, Od., Hdt.

div1.head: σύγγαμος
div1.sense: united in wedlock, married, ἄλλῳ to another, Eur.:—generally, connected by marriage, Eur.
ξύγγαμός σοι Ζεύς sharing thy marriage-bed, of Amphitryon, Eur.: pl. the rival wives of one man, Eur.

div1.head: συγγείτων
div1.sense: bordering, neighbouring, Eur.

div1.head: συγγένεια
div1.sense: sameness of descent or family, relationship, kin, Eur., etc.: c. gen. kin, relationship with or to another, ἡ ξ. τοῦ θεοῦ Plat.; also, ἡ πρὸς τοὺς παῖδας σ. Isocr.
ties of kindred, family connexion, influence, Plat.
oneʼs kin, kinsfolk, kinsmen, Eur.; in pl. families, Dem.

div1.head: συγγενής
div1.sense: born with, congenital, natural, in-born, Pind., Aesch.; συγγενεῖς μῆνες the months of my natural life, Soph.:—so in adv., συγγενῶς δύστηνος miserable from my birth, Eur.

of the same kin, descent or family with another, akin to him, τινι Hdt., Attic:—absol. akin, cognate, Trag., etc.:—as Subst. a kinsman, relative, τινος of another, Ar., Plat.:—in pl., οἱ συγγενεῖς kinsfolk, kinsmen, Hdt., etc.:— τὸ συγγενές, συγγένεια, Aesch., etc.; εἰ τούτῳ προσήκει Λαΐῳ τι σ. if this man had any connexion with Laius, Soph.
metaph. akin, cognate, of like kind, Ar., Plat.
at the Persian court, συγγενής was a title bestowed by the king as a mark of honour (like Cousin), Xen.

div1.head: συγγενικός
div1.sense: congenital, hereditary, Plut.
of or for kinsmen, σ. φιλία between kinsfolk, Arist.: —adv. -κῶς, like kinsfolk, Dem.

div1.head: συγγέρων
div1.sense: a co-mate in old age, Babr.

div1.head: συγγεωργέω
div1.sense: to be a fellow-labourer, Isae.

div1.head: συγγέωργος
div1.sense: a fellow-labourer, Ar.

div1.head: συγγηθέω
div1.sense: to rejoice with, τινί Eur.

div1.head: συγγηράσκω
div1.sense: to grow old together with, τινί Hdt.; absol., Aesch.

div1.head: σύγγηρος
div1.sense: growing old together, Anth.

div1.head: συγγίγνομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to be with any one, hold converse or communication with, associate or keep company with, τινί Hdt., Attic; so, also, σ. ἐς λόγους τινί Ar.
of disciples or pupils, to hold converse with a master, consult him, Ar., etc.
to come to assist, τινί or πρός τινα Aesch.; absol., Soph.
to come together, meet, Hdt., etc.; οἱ συγγιγνόμενοι comrades, Xen.

div1.head: συγγιγνώσκω
div1.sense: to think with, agree with, τινί Xen.; c. acc., τὴν ἁμαρτίαν ξυνέγνωσαν shared the error, Thuc.:—absol. to consent, agree, Hdt., Thuc.; so in Mid., Hdt.
σ. ἑαυτῷ to be conscious, καὶ αὐτοὶ ξυνέγνωσαν σφίσιν ὡς ἠδικηκότες Lys.:—so in Mid., συνεγινώσκετο ἑωυτῷ οὐκέτι εἶναι δυνατός Hdt.
to allow, acknowledge, own, confess, τι Hdt., Attic; c. acc. et inf., Hdt.; c. part., ξυγγνοῖμεν ἂν ἡμαρτηκότες Soph.:—absol. to confess oneʼs error, in Act. and Mid., Soph.
to have a fellow-feeling with another: and so, to make allowance for him, excuse, pardon, forgive, τινί Soph., etc.; σ. τινὶ τὴν ἁμαρτίαν, Lat. ignoscere alicui culpam, Eur.; also c. gen. rei, Plut.

div1.head: συγγνώμη
div1.sense: acknowledgment, confession, συγγνώμην ἔχειν, ὅτι . . to acknowledge that . . , Hdt.
a fellow-feeling with another, a lenient judgment, allowance, Ar., NTest.

pardon, forgiveness, συγγνώμην ἔχειν to pardon, τινί Hdt., Attic; τινός for a thing, Hdt., Attic:—opp. to συγγνώμης τυγχάνειν, to obtain forgiveness, Xen., etc.; ξυγγνώμην λήψονται, will be pardoned, Thuc.
of acts, συγγνώμην ἔχει admit of excuse, are excusable, Soph.; ἔχειν τι ξυγγνώμης Thuc.

div1.head: συγγνωμονικός
div1.sense: inclined to pardon, indulgent, Arist.
of things, pardonable, Arist.

div1.head: συγγνώμων
div1.sense: disposed to pardon, indulgent, Xen.; σ. εἶναί τινος to be disposed to forgive a thing, Eur.
pass. pardoned, deserving pardon or indulgence, allowable, Thuc.

div1.head: συγγνωστέος
div1.sense: one must pardon, indulge, τινί Plat.

div1.head: συγγνωστός
div1.sense: to be pardoned, pardonable, allowable, Eur., etc.:— συγγνωστόν or συγγνωστά ἐστι, c. inf., Eur.

div1.head: συγγομφόω
div1.sense: to fasten together with nails, Plut.

div1.head: σύγγονος
div1.sense: poet. adj. = συγγενής, born with, congenital, inborn, natural, Pind., Aesch.
connected by blood, akin, Lat. cognatus, Pind., Eur.:— as Subst. a brother, sister, Eur.; σύγγονοι kinsfolk, cousins, Pind.

div1.head: σύγγραμμα
div1.sense: a writing, a written paper, Hdt., Plat., etc.:— a written composition, book, work, Xen., etc.; esp. a prose work, treatise, a written speech, Xen., Isocr.
a clause of a law, Aeschin.
a physicianʼs prescription, Xen.

div1.head: συγγραφεύς
div1.sense: one who collects and writes down historic facts, an historian, Xen.: generally, an author, a prose-writer, Ar., Plat.
συγγραφεῖς, οἱ, at Athens (in the 21st year of Pelop. war) commissioners appointed to draw up measures for altering the constitution, Thuc.

div1.head: συγγραφή
div1.sense: a writing or noting down, Hdt.
that which is written, a writing, book: a history, narrative, Thuc., etc.
a written contract, a covenant, bond, Lat. syngrapha, Thuc.; συγγ. ναυτικαί a bond to secure money lent on bottomry, Dem.; ἀνδριάντα ἐκδεδωκὼς κατὰ συγγραφήν having contracted for its execution, Dem.

div1.head: συγγραφικός
div1.sense: given to writing, esp. in prose, Luc. adv., συγγραφικῶς ἐρεῖν to speak like a book, i. e. with great precision, Plat.

div1.head: συγγράφω
div1.sense: to write or note down, Lat. conscribere, Xen.;—so in Mid. to have a thing written down, take care that it is written down, Hdt.
to describe, Hdt.
to compose a writing or a work in writing, Lat. conscribere, πόλεμον ξ. to write the history of the war, Thuc.:—esp. to write in prose, Plat.
to compose a speech to be delivered by another, Isocr., Plat.:—Mid. to get speeches composed, Plat.

to compile, draw up, τοὺς πατρίους νόμους Xen.:—Mid., συγγράφεσθαί τι to draw up a contract or bond, Xen.; συγγράφεσθαι εἰρήνην πρός τινα to make a treaty of peace with another, Isocr.; absol. to sign a treaty, Thuc.:— πατέρες συγγεγραμμένοι the Rom. Patres conscripti, Plut.
to draw up a form of motion to be submitted to vote, Xen.: so in Mid., Plat.
to paint by contract, Ar.

div1.head: συγγυμνάζω
div1.sense: to exercise together:—Pass. to exercise oneself with or together, Plat.

div1.head: συγγυμναστής
div1.sense: a companion in bodily exercises, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: συγκαθαγίζω
div1.sense: to burn up together, Plut.

div1.head: συγκαθαιρέω
div1.sense: to put down together, to join in putting down, τὸν βάρβαρον Thuc.
to accomplish a thing with any one, τί τινι Hdt.

div1.head: συγκαθαρμόζω
div1.sense: to join in composing the limbs of a dead man, to join in preparing for burial, Soph.

div1.head: συγκαθέζομαι
div1.sense: to sit down together, Plat.

div1.head: συγκαθείργω
div1.sense: to shut up with another, τινά τινι Xen., etc.:—Pass. to be shut up with, τινί Aeschin.

div1.head: συγκαθέλκω
div1.sense: to drag down together:—fut. pass. συγκαθελκυσθήσεται Aesch.

div1.head: συγκαθεύδω
div1.sense: to sleep with, τινί Aesch.

div1.head: συγκάθημαι
div1.sense: to be seated or sit with or by the side of, Hdt., Eur.: of a number of persons, to sit together, sit in conclave, Ar., Thuc.

div1.head: συγκαθιερόω
div1.sense: to join in dedicating, Plut.

div1.head: συγκαθίζω
div1.sense: to make to sit together:—Mid. or Pass. to sit in conclave, meet for deliberation, Xen.
intr., = Mid. to sit with one, Luc.

div1.head: συγκαθίημι
div1.sense: to let down with or together, to deposit together, Eur.:— σ. ἑαυτόν to let oneself down, lower oneself, εἴς τι Plat.; and absol. (sub. ἑαυτόν) to stoop, condescend, accommodate oneself to others, c. dat., Plat.

div1.head: συγκαθίστημι
div1.sense: to bring into place together, ap. Dem.
to join in setting up, Lat. constituere, τὴν τυραννίδα Aesch., etc.:—of settling disturbed countries, Thuc.:— to help in arranging, managing, treating, Eur.

div1.head: συγκαίω
div1.sense: set on fire with or at once, burn up, Lat. comburere, Plat.

div1.head: συγκακοπαθέω
div1.sense: to partake in sufferings, NTest.

div1.head: συγκακουχέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to endure adversity with another, τινι NTest.

div1.head: συγκαλέω
div1.sense: to call to council, convoke, convene, Il., Hdt., Attic:—so in Mid., Hdt., NTest.
to invite with others to a feast, Xen.

div1.head: συγκαλυπτέος
div1.sense: to be veiled, concealed, Aesch.

div1.head: συγκαλυπτός
div1.sense: wrapped up, Aesch.

div1.head: συγκαλύπτω
div1.sense: to cover or veil completely, Od., Eur.: Pass., συγκεκαλυμμένη muffled up, Plut.:— Mid. to wrap oneself up, cover oneʼs face, Xen.

div1.head: συγκάμνω
div1.sense: to labour or suffer with, sympathise with, τινί Aesch., Eur.
to work, toil or travail with another, τινί Soph., Eur.: absol. to join in labour, Soph.

div1.head: συγκαμπή
div1.sense: a bight, joint, Xen.

div1.head: συγκάμπτω
div1.sense: to bend together, bend the knee, Plat.: Pass., συγκεκαμμένῳ τῷ σκέλει, of a person mounting a horse, Xen.: of the action of sitting down, ξυγκαμφθεὶς κάθημαι Plat.

div1.head: συγκασιγνήτη
div1.sense: an own sister, Eur.

div1.head: σύγκασις
div1.sense: an own brother or sister, Eur.

div1.head: συγκαταβαίνω
div1.sense: to go or come down with, τινί Eur.
to go down together, esp. to the sea-side, Thuc.
to come down to oneʼs aid, Aesch.
to come down to, agree to, Polyb.

div1.head: συγκαταβάλλω
div1.sense: to throw down along with, ἑαυτόν τινι Plut.

div1.head: συγκαταγηράσκω
div1.sense: to grow old together with, τινί Hdt.

div1.head: συγκατάγω
div1.sense: to join in bringing back, τὸν δῆμον Aeschin.

div1.head: συγκαταδιώκω
div1.sense: to pursue with or together, Thuc.

div1.head: συγκαταδουλόω
div1.sense: to join in enslaving, τινά τινι Thuc.; so in Mid., Thuc.

div1.head: συγκαταδύνω
div1.sense: to sink or set together with, Theocr.

div1.head: συγκατάδυσις
div1.sense: a sinking together, Strab.

div1.head: συγκαταζεύγνυμι
div1.sense: to yoke together, join in marriage, τινά τινι Plut.:—Pass., ἄτῃ συγκατέζευκται has become a yoke-fellow with misery, Soph.

div1.head: συγκαταθάπτω
div1.sense: to bury along with, Hdt.

div1.head: συγκατάθεσις
div1.sense: approval, agreement, concord, NTest.
submission, Plut.

div1.head: συγκαταθέω
div1.sense: to make an inroad with another, Xen.

div1.head: συγκαταθνῄσκω
div1.sense: to die along with, τινί Mosch.

div1.head: συγκαταίθω
div1.sense: to burn together, Soph.

div1.head: συγκαταινέω
div1.sense: to agree with, favour, τινί Xen.
c. acc. rei, to sanction, approve, Plut.

div1.head: συγκαταίρω
div1.sense: to come to land together, Plut.

div1.head: συγκατακαίω
div1.sense: to burn together or also, τὰς σκηνάς Xen.:—Pass. to be burnt with, τινί Hdt.

div1.head: συγκατάκειμαι
div1.sense: Pass. to lie with or together, Plat.

div1.head: συγκατακλείω
div1.sense: to shut in or enclose with or together, Hdt.

div1.head: συγκατακλίνω
div1.sense: to make to lie with: — Pass. to lie together, Ar.
Pass., also, to lie on the same couch with another at table, Ar.

div1.head: συγκατακόπτω
div1.sense: to cut up together:—Pass., Plut.

div1.head: συγκατακτάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to join with another in acquiring, σ. Φιλίππῳ τὴν ἀρχήν Dem.

div1.head: συγκατακτείνω
div1.sense: to slay together, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: συγκαταλαμβάνω
div1.sense: to seize, take possession of together, Xen.: to occupy at the same time, in a military sense, Thuc.

div1.head: συγκαταλείπω
div1.sense: to leave together, σ. φρουράν to leave a joint garrison in a place, Thuc.

div1.head: συγκαταλύω
div1.sense: to join or help in undoing or putting down, τὸν δῆμον Thuc., etc.

div1.head: συγκαταμείγνυμι
div1.sense: to mix in with, mingle, blend with, Χάριτας Μούσαις συγκαταμιγνύς Eur.:—Pass. to be absorbed in a thing, Xen.

div1.head: συγκαταμύω
div1.sense: to be quite closed up, Anth.

div1.head: συγκαταναυμαχέω
div1.sense: to assist in conquering by sea, τινά Aeschin.

div1.head: συγκατανέμω
div1.sense: to assign also:—Mid. to divide jointly among themselves, τὴν γῆν Thuc.

div1.head: συγκατανεύω
div1.sense: to consent to a thing, τινί Polyb.

div1.head: συγκαταπίμπλημι
div1.sense: to infect likewise, Antipho.

div1.head: συγκαταπλέκω
div1.sense: to intertwine or intermix with, τί τινι Plut.

div1.head: συγκαταπράσσω
div1.sense: to join in accomplishing, Act. and Mid., Dem.

div1.head: συγκαταρρίπτω
div1.sense: to throw down together, Luc.

div1.head: συγκατασκάπτω
div1.sense: to demolish with another or altogether, Eur.

div1.head: συγκατασκεδάννυμι
div1.sense: Mid. to pour over at the same time, Xen.

div1.head: συγκατασκευάζω
div1.sense: to help in establishing or framing, Thuc., etc.; σ. τὸν πόλεμον to join in promoting the war, Dem.

div1.head: συγκατασκηνόω
div1.sense: to bring into one dwelling with others, Xen.

div1.head: συγκατασκήπτω
div1.sense: to dart down together, Plut.

div1.head: συγκατασπάω
div1.sense: to pull down with oneself, Luc.:—Pass., τὰ φρούρια τὰ εἰς τὴν Σύρων ἐπικράτειαν συγκατασπασθέντα which were at the same time brought under their dominion, Xen.
to gulp down together, Luc.

div1.head: συγκαταστασιάζω
div1.sense: to help in stirring up, Plut.

div1.head: συγκαταστρέφω
div1.sense: to bring to an end together, Plut.
Mid. to conquer together or at the same time, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: συγκατατάσσω
div1.sense: to arrange or draw up together, Xen.

div1.head: συγκατατίθημι
div1.sense: to deposit together or at the same time: Mid., σ. τινι τὴν αὐτὴν δόξαν to deliver the same opinion with another, Plat.:—then, with dat. only, to agree with, assent to, Philipp. ap. Dem.

div1.head: συγκατατρώγω
div1.sense: to eat at the same time, Plut.

div1.head: συγκαταφλέγω
div1.sense: to burn with or together, Luc.

div1.head: συγκαταψεύδομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to join in a lie against, τινός Aeschin.

div1.head: συγκαταψηφίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to condemn with or together, Plut.
Pass. to be reckoned along with others, NTest.

div1.head: συγκατεργάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to help or assist any one in accomplishing a work, τί τινι Hdt., Eur.: c. dat. only, to cooperate with, Hdt.
to help to conquer a country, Plut.
to join in murdering, Eur.

div1.head: συγκατέρχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. with aor. and perf. act., to come back together, return from exile together, Lys., etc.

div1.head: συγκατεσθίω
div1.sense: to eat up, devour with or together, Plut.

div1.head: συγκατεύχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to join in praying for a thing, Soph.

div1.head: συγκατηγορέω
div1.sense: to join in accusing, τινός Dem.

div1.head: συγκατοικέω
div1.sense: to dwell with one, τινί Soph.

div1.head: συγκατοικίζω
div1.sense: to colonise jointly, join in colonising, Hdt., Thuc.
to plant in a place along with others, Eur.
metaph. to establish jointly, Thuc.

div1.head: συγκατοικτίζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to lament with or together, Soph.

div1.head: συγκατορθόω
div1.sense: to help in righting, Isocr.

div1.head: συγκατορύσσω
div1.sense: to bury with, τί τινι Plut.

div1.head: συγκαττύω
div1.sense: to patch up, cobble, of leather-workers: Pass., θώραξ ἐκ δερμάτων συγκεκαττυμένος Luc.

div1.head: σύγκειμαι
div1.sense: Pass. to lie together, Soph.
as Pass. of συντίθημι, to be composed or compounded, ἔκ τινων of certain parts, Plat., etc.
of written works, to be composed, Thuc., Plat., etc.
to be contrived, concocted, Eur., etc.
to be agreed on by two parties, Thuc.: in part. agreed on, arranged, αἱ συγκείμεναι ἡμέραι Hdt.; κατὰ τὰ συγκείμενα according to the terms agreed on, Hdt.; ἐκ τῶν ξυγκειμένων Thuc.
impers. σύγκειται, it has been or is agreed on, Hdt., Thuc., etc.; so, συγκειμένου σφι, c. inf., since they had agreed to . . , Hdt.

div1.head: συγκεκροτημένως
div1.etym: adverb from perf. pass. part. of συγκροτέω
div1.sense: in a finished way, Luc.

div1.head: συγκελεύω
div1.sense: to join in ordering, Eur., Thuc.

div1.head: συγκεντέω
div1.sense: to pierce together, to stab at once, Lat. telis confodere, Hdt.:—Pass., ἔμελλε συγκεντηθήσεσθαι Hdt.

div1.head: συγκεράννυμι
div1.sense: to mix up with, commingle or blend with, temper by mixing with, τί τινι Plat.
to mix together, commingle, πολλά Plat.; ἐξ ἀμφοτέρων ξ. to make a mixture of both, Plat.
to attemper, compose, NTest.
Pass. to be commingled, blended together, Aesch., Eur., etc.
of friendships, to be formed by close union, Hdt.:—Mid., συγκεράσασθαι φιλίαν to form a close friendship, Hdt.
of persons, to be closely attached to, τινι Xen.: to become involved in misfortune, Soph., etc.; οἴκτῳ συγκεκραμένη deeply affected by . . , Soph.

div1.head: συγκεραυνόω
div1.sense: to strike with or as with a thunderbolt, shiver in pieces, Eur.

div1.head: συγκεφαλαιόω
div1.sense: to bring together under one head, to sum up, Xen.:—Pass. to be brought under one head, summed up, Aeschin.; of business, to be summarily done, Xen.

div1.head: συγκεχυμένως
div1.etym: adverb from perf. pass. part. of συγχέω
div1.sense: confusedly, indiscriminately, Arist.

div1.head: συγκινδυνεύω
div1.sense: to incur danger along with, τινί Thuc., etc.;—absol. to be partners in danger, Xen., Dem., etc.

div1.head: συγκινέω
div1.sense: to stir up together, NTest.

div1.head: συγκλαίω
div1.sense: to weep with, τινί Anth.

div1.head: συγκλάω
div1.sense: to break off:—Pass. to be cramped, Plat.

div1.head: σύγκλεισις
div1.sense: a shutting up, closing up (of a line of battle), Thuc.
a narrow pass, defile, Plut.

div1.head: συγκλείω
div1.sense: to shut or coop up, hem in, enclose, Hdt.; ἐς τόπον Thuc.; ξυνέκλῃε διὰ μέσου shut off and intercepted them, Thuc.:— Pass., λίμνη συγκεκληιμένη οὔρεσι Hdt.; συγκεκλῃμένη muffled, Eur.
to set together to fight as in the lists, Eur.
to shut close, to close, ὄμμα Eur.; τὰς πύλας Thuc.: absol., σύγκλειε shut the doors, Ar.
σ. τὰς ἀσπίδας to lock their shields, Xen.: absol. to close up the ranks of an army, Thuc.: Pass., τὸ οὐ ξυγκλῃσθέν the part that was not closed up, of a gap in the line, Thuc.
Pass. to be well linked, Eur.

div1.head: συγκλέπτω
div1.sense: to steal along with, Antipho.

div1.head: συγκληρονόμος
div1.sense: a joint-heir with, τινός NTest.

div1.head: σύγκληρος
div1.sense: having portions that join, bordering, neighbouring, Eur.

div1.head: συγκληρόω
div1.sense: to embrace in one lot, choose by lot, Plut.
to assign by the same lot, τί τινι Dem.: to couple with one, τινά τινι Aeschin.

div1.head: συγκλητικός
div1.sense: of senatorial rank, Lat. senatorius, Plut.

div1.head: σύγκλητος
div1.sense: called together, summoned, Soph.
σ. ἐκκλησία at Athens, an assembly specially summoned by the στρατηγός (opp. to the ordinary meetings, αἱ κυρίαι) , Decret. ap. Dem.:—generally, σύγκλητος (sc. ἐκκλησία) , a legislative body, Arist.

div1.head: συγκλινίαι
div1.sense: the meeting-line at the foot of two mountain slopes, Plut.

div1.head: συγκλίνω
div1.sense: to lay together:—Pass. to lie with another, c. dat., Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: συγκλονέω
div1.sense: to dash together, confound utterly, Il.

div1.head: σύγκλυς
div1.sense: washed together by the waves; metaph., ἄνθρωποι σύγκλυδες a promiscuous crowd, a mob, rabble, Lat. colluvies hominum, Thuc.; so σύγκλυδες alone, Plat.

div1.head: συγκοιμάομαι
div1.sense: to sleep with, lie with another, c. dat., Hdt., Trag.

div1.head: συγκοίμημα
div1.sense: partner of oneʼs bed, in pl., Eur.

div1.head: συγκοίμησις
div1.sense: a sleeping together, Plat.

div1.head: συγκοιμίζω
div1.sense: to join in wedlock, τινά τινι Ar.

div1.head: συγκοινόομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to communicate, impart, τί τινι Thuc.

div1.head: συγκοινωνέω
div1.sense: to have a joint share of a thing, c. gen., Dem.
c. dat. to take part in, have fellowship with, NTest.

div1.head: συγκοινωνός
div1.sense: partaking jointly of a thing, c. gen., NTest.

div1.head: σύγκοιτος
div1.sense: a bedfellow, partner, Pind.

div1.head: συγκολλάω
div1.sense: to glue or cement together, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: συγκολλητής
div1.sense: one who glues together, a fabricator, Ar.

div1.head: σύγκολλος
div1.sense: glued together: adv., συγκόλλως ἔχειν to fit exactly, Aesch.

div1.head: συγκομιδή
div1.sense: a gathering in of harvest, Thuc., Xen.
in pass. sense, a being gathered together, crowding into a place, Thuc.

div1.head: συγκομίζω
div1.sense: to carry or bring together, collect, Hdt.:—Mid., with perf. pass., to bring together to oneself, collect, Hdt., Xen.; σ. πρὸς ἑαυτόν to claim as oneʼs own, Xen.:—Pass. to be heaped together, Hdt.; metaph., ταῦτα συγκομίζεται are gained both at once, Soph.
of the harvest, to gather in, store up, house it, in Act. and Mid., Xen.:—Pass., of the harvest, ὀργᾷ συγκομίζεσθαι it is ripe for carrying, Hdt.
to help in burying, Soph.

div1.head: συγκοπή
div1.sense: a cutting short: in Gramm. syncope, i. e. a cutting a word short by striking out one or more letters, Plut.

div1.head: συγκόπτω
div1.sense: to break up, cut up, Hdt., Xen.
to thrash soundly, pound well, Xen.;—Pass., perf. inf. συγκεκόφθαι Ar.; part. συγκεκομμένος Eur.

div1.head: συγκοσμέω
div1.sense: to confer honour on, to be an ornament to, Xen.

div1.head: συγκουφίζω
div1.sense: to help to lighten, help to keep above water, Luc.

div1.head: σύγκρασις
div1.sense: a mixing together, commixture, blending, tempering, Thuc., Plat., etc.

div1.head: συγκρατέω
div1.sense: to keep troops together, Plut.

div1.head: σύγκρατος
div1.sense: mixed together, closely united, Eur.

div1.head: συγκρίνω
div1.sense: to compound, Plat.
to compare, τι πρός τι Arist., etc.: to measure, estimate, Anth.

div1.head: σύγκρισις
div1.sense: a compounding, Plat., etc.
a comparing, comparison, Arist., etc.

div1.head: συγκριτέος
div1.sense: one must compare, Arist.

div1.head: συγκροτέω
div1.sense: to strike together; σ. τὼ χεῖρε to clap the hands for joy, Xen.; but also to smite them together in grief, Luc.:—Pass. to be applauded, Xen.
to hammer or weld together, Ar.: hence, to weld a number of men into one body, i. e. organise them, Dem., etc.:—perf. pass. part. συγκεκροτημένος well-trained, in good discipline, Xen., Dem.

div1.head: σύγκρουσις
div1.sense: collision: a conflict, Plut.

div1.head: συγκρούω
div1.sense: to strike together, Lat. collido, σ. τὼ χεῖρε to clap the hands, Ar.
metaph. to bring into collision, Dem.; σ. τινὰς ἀλλήλοις to wear out by collision, Thuc.
intr. to clash together, come into collision, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: συγκρύπτω
div1.sense: to cover up or completely, Eur.:— to conceal utterly, Eur., Xen., etc.

div1.head: συγκτάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to win or gain along with another, c. dat., Thuc.; τὴν ὅλην χώραν συγκτήσασθαι to have gained joint possession of it, Arist.

div1.head: συγκτίζω
div1.sense: to join with another in founding or colonising, Hdt., Thuc.
Pass., perf. part. συνεκτισμένος well-cultivated.

div1.head: συγκτίστης
div1.sense: a joint-founder or coloniser, Hdt.

div1.head: συγκυβευτής
div1.sense: a fellow-gamester, Aeschin.

div1.head: συγκυβεύω
div1.sense: to play at dice with, τινί Hdt.

div1.head: συγκυκάω
div1.sense: to confound utterly, Ar.

div1.head: συγκυλινδέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to roll about or wallow together, Xen.

div1.head: συγκυνηγός
div1.note: Doric and Attic συγ-κυνᾱγός, οῦ, ὁ
div1.sense: a fellow-hunter, Eur.; fem. a fellow-huntress, Eur.

div1.head: συγκύπτω
div1.sense: to bend forwards, stoop and lay heads together, Ar.:—metaph., συγκύψαντες ποιοῦσι they do it in concert, in conspiracy, Hdt.; ἐς ἓν συγκεκυφέναι to be acting in concert, Ar.:—generally, to draw together, of the wings of an army, Xen.

div1.head: συγκυρέω
div1.sense: to come together by chance, Il., Hdt.: to meet with an accident, συγκύρσαι τύχῃ Soph.; εἰς ἓν μοίρας ξυνέκυρσας art involved in one and the same fate, Eur.
c. part., like τυγχάνω, συνεκύρησε παραπεσοῦσα νηῦς fell in the way by chance, Hdt.
of events and accidents, like συμβαίνω, to happen, occur, Hdt., Eur.: —impers., c. inf., συνεκύρησε γενέσθαι it came to pass that . . , Hdt.:—so, in Pass., τὸ ἐς Λακεδαιμονίους συγκεκυρημένον Hdt.
of places, to be contiguous to, τινί Polyb.

div1.head: συγκυρία
div1.sense: coincidence, κατὰ συγκυρίαν by chance, NTest.

div1.head: σύγκωλος
div1.sense: with limbs close together, Xen.

div1.head: συγκωμάζω
div1.sense: to march together in a κῶμος or band of revellers, Pind.

div1.head: σύγκωμος
div1.sense: a fellow-reveller, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: συγκωμῳδέω
div1.sense: to satirise as in a comedy, Luc.

div1.head: συγχαίρω
div1.sense: to rejoice with, take part in joy, Aesch., Ar.; τινί with another, Arist.
to wish one joy, congratulate, σ. τινὶ τῶν γεγενημένων to wish one joy of the events, Dem.

div1.head: συγχειμάζω
div1.sense: Mid. to go through the winters with one, Ar.

div1.head: συγχειρουργέω
div1.sense: to put hand to a thing together, to accomplish, Isae.

div1.head: συγχέω
div1.sense: to pour together, commingle, confound, Il., Dem., etc.:—Pass. to be in confusion, Il.
like συγχώννυμι, to make ruinous, destroy, obliterate, demolish, Hdt., Eur.
of the mind, to confound, trouble, Hom., Hdt., etc.:—Pass., Eur.
to confound, make of none effect, frustrate, Il., Hdt., Attic

div1.head: συγχορευτής
div1.sense: a companion in a dance, Xen.

div1.head: συγχορεύω
div1.sense: to join in the dance, Ar.:— to be of the same chorus, Arist.

div1.head: συγχορηγέω
div1.sense: to furnish as supplies, Plut.
to contribute towards a thing, c. dat., Plut.

div1.head: συγχορηγός
div1.sense: a fellow-choragus: generally, sharing with a partner in the expense, Dem.

div1.head: σύγχορτος
div1.sense: with the grass joining, i. e. bordering upon, c. gen., Eur.; Φαρσαλίας σύγχορτα πεδία i. e. the marches or boundaries of Pharsalia, Eur.

div1.head: συγχράομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to make joint use of, avail oneself of, c. dat., Polyb.: generally to have dealings with, τινι NTest.
to borrow jointly, τί τινος something from another, Polyb.

div1.head: σύγχροος
div1.sense: of like colour or look, Polyb.

div1.head: συγχύνω
div1.sense: to confound, NTest.

div1.head: σύγχυσις
div1.sense: a commixture, confusion, Eur.; σ. ἔχειν to be confounded, Eur.
of contracts and treaties, a violation, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: συγχωνεύω
div1.sense: to melt down, Dem.

div1.head: συγχώννυμι
div1.sense: to heap all together, to heap with earth, cover with a mound, bank up, Hdt.
to make into ruinous heaps, demolish, Hdt.
generally, to confound, Aesch.

div1.head: συγχωρέω
div1.sense: to come together, meet, πέτραι συγχωροῦσαι the Symplegades, Eur.; συγχωρεῖν λόγοις to meet in argument, Eur.

to make way, give place, yield or defer to, Lat. concedere, τινί Ar., etc.; Συρηκοσίοισι τῆς ἡγεμονίης συγχ. to make concessions to them about the command, Hdt.; in bad sense, to be in collusion with, connive at, τοῖς πονηροῖς Dem.; ξ. πρός τινας to come to terms with them, Thuc.

to accede or agree, assent to, acquiesce in anotherʼs opinion, Hdt., Attic:—absol. to agree, acquiesce, consent, assent, Soph.; τὸ συγκεχωρηκὸς τῆς εὐσεβείας a yielding, unexacting temper of piety, Dem.
c. acc. rei, to concede, give up, yield, Hdt., Attic:—Pass., τὰ συγχωρηθέντα χρήματα Dem.
to concede or grant in argument, Plat.; c. acc. et inf. to grant that, Plat.
impers. συγχωρεῖ, it is agreed, it may be done, ὅπῃ ἂν ξυγχωρῇ as may be agreed, Thuc.

div1.head: συγχώρημα
div1.sense: a concession, Plut.

div1.head: συγχωρητέος
div1.sense: to be conceded, Luc.
neut., συγχωρητέον one must concede, Plat.: so in pl. συγχωρητέα, Soph.

div1.head: σύδην
div1.sense: impetuously, hurriedly, Aesch.

div1.head: σύειος
div1.sense: of swine, Lat. suillus, Xen., Luc.

div1.head: συζῶ
div1.sense: to live with another, c. dat., Dem., etc.; c. dat. rei, σ. φιλοπραγμοσύνῃ to pass oneʼs life in meddling, Dem.:—absol. to live together, Arist.

div1.head: συζεύγνυμι
div1.sense: to yoke together, couple or pair together, Hdt., Zen.: esp. in marriage, Eur., etc.:— Mid. to yoke for oneself, Xen.:—Pass. to be yoked or coupled with, τινί Eur.: absol., συζυγέντες ὁμιλοῦσι they live in close familiarity, Xen.

div1.head: σύζευξις
div1.sense: a being yoked together, esp. of wedded union, Plat.:—of things, close union, combination, Plat.

div1.head: συζητέω
div1.sense: to search or examine together with another, c. dat., Plat.
σ. τινί or πρός τινα to dispute with a person, NTest.

div1.head: συζητητής
div1.sense: a joint inquirer: a disputer, NTest.

div1.head: συζοφόω
div1.sense: to darken utterly, Anth.

div1.head: συζυγία
div1.sense: = σύζευξις, Eur.
a yoke of animals, a pair, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: συζύγιος
div1.sense: joined, united, Eur.

div1.head: σύζυγος
div1.sense: yoked together, paired, σ. ὁμαυλίαι wedded union, Aesch.
as fem. Subst. a wife, Eur.; masc. a yoke-fellow, comrade, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: σύζυξ
div1.etym: = σύζυγος, of a wedded pair, Eur.

div1.head: συζωοποιέω
div1.sense: to quicken together with, τινά τινι NTest.

div1.head: συκάζω
div1.sense: to pluck ripe figs, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: συκάμινον
div1.sense: the fruit of the συκάμινος, a mulberry, Lat. morum, Arist.

div1.head: συκάμινος
div1.sense: the mulberry-tree, Lat. morus, Theophr.
= συκόμορος, NTest.

div1.head: συκῆ
div1.sense: the fig-tree, Lat. ficus (the fruit being σῦκον) , Od.
= σῦκον I, a fig, Ar.

div1.head: συκίζω
div1.sense: to fatten with figs, Anth.

div1.head: σύκινος
div1.sense: of the fig-tree, σ. ξύλον fig wood, Ar.:—the wood of the fig was spongy and useless (Horaceʼs inutile lignum), Plat.:—hence,
metaph., σύκινοι ἄνδρες worthless, good-for-nothing fellows, Theocr.; σ. σύζυγος a false, treacherous comrade, with a play on συκοφαντικός, Ar.

div1.head: συκίς
div1.sense: a slip or cutting from a fig-tree, a young fig-tree, Ar.

div1.head: συκολογέω
div1.sense: to gather figs, Ar.

div1.head: συκόμορον
div1.sense: the fruit of the συκόμορος, Strab.

div1.head: συκόμορος
div1.sense: the fig-mulberry, an Egyptian kind that bears its fruit on the branches, called also συκάμινος ἡ Αἰγυπτία, Theophr.

div1.head: σῦκον
div1.sense: the fruit of the συκῆ, a fig, Lat. ficus, Od., etc.: proverb., σῦκα αἰτεῖν, i. e. to be dainty, Ar.
a wart on the eyelid, Ar.

div1.head: συκόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be fed with figs, Anth.

div1.head: συκοτραγέω
div1.sense: to eat figs, Theophr.

div1.head: συκοφαντέω
div1.sense: c. acc. pers. to accuse falsely, slander, calumniate, Ar., Plat.:— Pass. to be falsely accused, Xen., etc.
c. acc. rei, to misrepresent, Dem.:—but also, to extort by false accusations, Lys., NTest.
absol. to deal in false accusations, Ar., Plat.: generally, to deal falsely, to give false counsel, Dem.

div1.head: συκοφάντημα
div1.sense: a sycophantʼs trick, false accusation, calumny, Aeschin.

div1.head: συκοφάντης
div1.sense: a false accuser, slanderer, Ar., etc.; (never used in the modern sense of sycophant, i. e. κόλαξ) :—generally, a false adviser, Dem. (Commonly derived from σῦκον, φαίνω, one who informed against persons exporting figs from Attica: better perh. a fig-shewer, i. e. one who brings figs to light by shaking the tree (the figs having been hidden in the thick foliage); and then, metaph., one who makes rich men yield up their fruit by false accusations).

div1.head: συκοφαντία
div1.sense: false accusation, slander, calumny, Xen., etc.
a sophism, Arist.

div1.head: συκοφαντίας
div1.sense: the Sycophant-wind (cf. καικίας) Ar.

div1.head: συκοφαντικός
div1.sense: slanderous, calumnious, Dem.: adv. -κῶς, Isocr.

div1.head: συκόφασις
div1.etym: used metri grat. for συκοφαντία, Anth.

div1.head: συκοφορέω
div1.sense: to carry figs, Anth.

div1.head: συκοφόρος
div1.sense: fig-bearing, Strab.

div1.head: συλαγωγέω
div1.sense: to carry off as booty, lead captive, NTest.

div1.head: συλάω
div1.sense: to strip off, esp. to strip off the arms of a slain enemy: c. acc. pers. et rei, to strip off from another, strip him of his arms, Il., Eur.:—Pass., c. acc. rei, to be stript, robbed, deprived of a thing, Trag.
c. acc. pers. only, to strip a man of his arms, to strip bare, pillage, plunder, Il., Hdt., etc.
c. acc. rei only, to strip off, τεύχεα ἐσύλα Il.:—also to take off or out, ἐσύλα τόξον took out the bow [from its case], Il.; σύλα πῶμα φαρέτρης took the lid off the quiver, Il.
to carry off, seize as spoil or booty, Hdt., Attic:—Pass. to be carried off as spoil, Hdt.; to be taken away, Eur.; c. gen. rei, τίς σε συλᾷ πάτρας; who carries thee away from this country? Eur.

div1.head: συλεύω
div1.etym: Epic for συλάω, used in pres. and imperf.
div1.sense: to despoil of arms, Il.: also, to despoil secretly, to trick, cheat, Il.

div1.head: συλέω
div1.sense: συλάω:—Mid. to steal for oneself, κηρίον ἐκ σίμβλων συλεύμενος (Doric for -ούμενος) Theocr.

div1.head: σύλη
div1.sense: the right of seizing the ship or cargo of a foreign merchant, to cover losses received through him: generally, the right of seizure, right of reprisal, mostly in pl. σῦλαι or σῦλα; σύλας διδόναι τινὶ κατά τινος Dem.; ὅπου σῦλαι μὴ ὦσιν Ἀθηναίοις where the Athenians have [to fear] no right of seizure, ap. Dem.; σῦλα ποιεῖσθαι to exercise this right, Lys.

div1.head: συλήτειρα
div1.sense: a robber, Eur.

div1.head: συλλαβή
div1.sense: that which holds together, Aesch.
Pass. that which is held together, of several letters taken together, so as to form one sound, a syllable, Aesch., Plat., etc.

div1.head: συλλαβίζω
div1.sense: to join letters into syllables, to pronounce letters together, Luc.

div1.head: συλλαγχάνω
div1.sense: to be chosen by lot with others, Plut.

div1.head: συλλαλέω
div1.sense: to talk or converse with another, NTest.

div1.head: συλλαμβάνω
div1.sense: to collect, gather together, esp. to rally scattered troops, Hdt., Xen., etc.
simply, to take with one, take up and carry off, Soph., Ar.: to buy up, Ar.
to put together, close the mouth of a corpse, Plat.; σ. αὐτοῦ τὸ στόμα to shut his mouth, Ar.
in speaking, to comprehend, comprise, Hdt., Plat.

to lay hold of, seize, grasp, c. acc., Hdt., Soph.; c. gen., σ. τῶν σχοινίων to lay hold of them, Ar.; absol. in part., ξυλλαβών quickly, in a hurry, Ar.:—also in Mid., c. gen., ξυλλαβέσθαι τοῦ ξύλου Ar.
to apprehend, arrest, Hdt., Attic:— Pass., πρὶν ξυλληφθῆναι before they were arrested, Thuc.
of the mind, to comprehend, understand, Hdt., Pind.
to receive at the same time, enjoy together, Hdt.
of females, to conceive, Luc.
c. dat. pers. to take part with, assist, Hdt., Attic:—absol. to assist, Aesch., etc.
c. dat. pers. et c. gen. rei, to take part with one in a thing, Eur., Ar.:—so in Mid., συνελάβετο τοῦ στρατεύματος Hdt.; νόσου συλλαβέσθαι Soph.: to contribute towards a thing, Thuc.

div1.head: συλλέγω
div1.sense: to collect, gather, Il., Hdt., Attic: —σ. μέλη to compile, scrape together tunes, Ar.; σ. ὕβρεις αὐτοῦ to compile a list of them, Dem.:—Mid. to collect for oneself, for oneʼs own use, Il., etc.
σ. σθένος to collect oneʼs powers, make a rally, Eur.:—Pass. to be collected, of the mind, Plat.
Pass. to come together, become customary, Xen.
of persons, to call together, Eur.:—so in Mid., Od., etc.: —Pass. to come together, assemble, Hdt., Attic
to collect, get together, στασιώτας Hdt.; σ. στρατόν to levy an army, Lat. conscribere, Thuc.

div1.head: σύλλεκτρος
div1.sense: partner of the bed, Eur.

div1.head: συλλήβδην
div1.sense: adv. collectively, in sum, in short, Theogn., Aesch., etc.

div1.head: συλλήγω
div1.sense: to finish together with, c. dat., Anth.

div1.head: συλληπτέος
div1.sense: one must seize together, Eur.

div1.head: συλληπτέος2
div1.sense: to be seized, Luc.

div1.head: συλλήπτωρ
div1.sense: a partner, accomplice, assistant, Aesch.; τινός in a thing, Eur., etc.

div1.head: σύλληψις
div1.sense: a taking together: a seizing, arresting, ποιεῖσθαι ξύλληψιν to arrest, Thuc.
conception, Plut.

div1.head: συλλογή
div1.sense: a gathering, collecting, Thuc.: metaph., ἐν γενείου ξυλλογῇ τριχώματος in the first harvest of a beard, i. e. in early manhood, Aesch.
a levying of soldiers, Lat. conscriptio, Xen.
a summary, recapitulation, Dem.
(from Pass.) an assembly, meeting, Hdt., Lys.

div1.head: συλλογίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to collect and bring at once before the mind, to compute fully, sum up, Hdt., Dem.
to collect or conclude from premisses, Lat. colligere, Plat., Dem.
to conclude by way of syllogism, Arist.:—perf. in pass. sense, συλλελογισμένα logically concluded, Arist.

div1.head: συλλογιμαῖος
div1.sense: collected from divers places, Luc.

div1.head: συλλογισμός
div1.sense: computation, Plat.
a conclusion, inference from premisses, Plat.

div1.head: συλλογιστέος
div1.sense: to be concluded, Plat.
neut. συλλογιστέον one must compute or conclude, Arist.

div1.head: συλλογιστικός
div1.sense: of or for concluding, syllogistic, Arist.:—adv. -κῶς, Arist.

div1.head: σύλλογος
div1.sense: an assembly, Hdt., Attic; σύλλογον ποιεῖσθαι to convene an assembly, opp. to διαλύειν, Hdt., etc.:— a muster of forces, Xen.
metaph. collectedness, presence of mind, Eur.

div1.head: συλλούομαι
div1.sense: Mid. or Pass. to bathe together, Plut.

div1.head: συλλοχίζω
div1.sense: to incorporate soldiers, Plut.

div1.head: συλλοχίτης
div1.sense: a soldier of the same λόχος, Hdt.

div1.head: συλλυπέω
div1.sense: to hurt or mortify together, σ. τινα αὑτῷ to make him share oneʼs grief, Arist.
Pass., fut. -λυπηθήσομαι and in mid. form -λυπήσομαι: — to sympathise or condole with, τινί Hdt., Attic

div1.head: συλλυσσάομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to go mad with, τινι, Anth.

div1.head: συλλύω
div1.sense: to help in loosing, Eur.:— to help to solve a difficulty or end a quarrel, Soph.
to rest under the same roof, Aesch.; cf. καταλύω.

div1.head: συλόνυξ
div1.sense: paring the nails, Anth.

div1.head: συμβαίνω
div1.sense: Pass., to stand with the feet together, opp. to διαβαίνειν, Xen.
to stand with, so as to assist, Soph.; σ. κακοῖς, i. e. increase them, Eur.
to meet, τινί Xen.; συμβέβηκεν οὐδαμοῦ has never come in my way, has had naught to do with me, Eur.
metaph. to come together, come to an agreement, come to terms, Lat. convenire, τινί with another, Hdt., Attic; c. inf., σ. ὑπήκοοι εἶναι Thuc.; Pass., of the terms, to be agreed on, Thuc.
of things, to coincide or correspond with, c. dat., Hdt., Attic:—absol., Trag., etc.
to fall to oneʼs lot, c. dat. pers., Eur., Dem.

of events, to come to pass, happen, Lat. contingere, Aesch., Plat., etc.:—impers., συνέβη μοι, c. inf., it happened to me to do a thing, Hdt., etc.; also c. acc. it happened that I did, Hdt., Thuc., etc.: ξυμβαίνει c. inf. it happens to be, i. e. it is so and so, Plat.: —τὸ συμβεβηκός a chance event, contingency, Dem.; so, τὰ συμβαίνοντα Xen.; τὰ συμβάντα Xen.
joined with Adverbs or Adjectives, to turn out in a certain way, ὀρθῶς συνέβαινε Hdt.; κακῶς, καλῶς ξυμβῆναι Xen., etc.
of consequences, to result, follow, Thuc.: so, of logical conclusions, Plat.

div1.head: συμβακχεύω
div1.sense: to join in the feast of Bacchus or Bacchic revelry, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: σύμβακχος
div1.sense: joining in Bacchic revelry, Eur.

div1.head: συμβάλλω
div1.sense: to throw together, dash together, Il., Eur., etc.: to unite their streams, of rivers, Il.: —so in Mid., Hdt.
to throw together, collect, Xen.
intr. to come together, meet, Aesch., Soph., Xen.
to close the eyes, in sleep or death, Aesch.; but, ποῖον ὄμμα συμβαλῶ; how shall I meet her eyes with mine? Eur.
generally, to join, unite, σ. σχοινία to twist ropes, Ar.; ξ. δεξιάς to join hands, Eur.; σ. λόγους Eur.:—Pass., κριθὰς ἵπποις συμβεβλημένας barley thrown in heaps before them, Xen.

σ. συμβόλαιά τινι or πρός τινα to make a contract with a person, to lend him money on bond, Dem.; συμβόλαιον εἰς τἀνδράποδα συμβεβλημένον money lent on the security of the slaves, Dem.; absol., in same sense, Plat.

to contribute, lend, Xen.:—so in Mid., Hdt., etc.; τὸ μὴ ἀγανακτεῖν ἄλλα πολλὰ συμβάλλεται many circumstances contribute to my feeling no vexation, Plat.; συμβάλλεσθαι εἰς or πρός τι to contribute towards, Hdt., Attic; c. gen. partit., ξυμβάλλεται πολλὰ τοῦδε δείματος many things contribute [their share] of this fear, i. e. join in causing it, Eur.
συμβάλλεσθαι γνώμας to add oneʼs opinion to that of others, Hdt.

συμβάλλειν λόγους to converse, and συμβάλλειν, absol., like Lat. conferre for conferre sermonem, σ. πρός τινα NTest.:—so in Mid., συμβάλλεσθαι λόγους Xen.; συμβάλλεσθαί τι to have something to say, Plat., etc.
to bring men together in hostile sense, to set them together, match them, Il., etc.:—Mid. to join in fight.
intr. to come together, engage, Il.: to come to blows, τινί with another, Hdt., Aesch.
σ. μάχην, Lat. committere pugnam, Eur.; ἔχθραν σ. τινί Eur.;— metaph., συμβαλεῖν ἔπη κακά to bandy reproaches, Soph.
Mid. to fall in with one, meet him by chance, c. dat., Hom., who uses Epic aor2 ξύμβλητο and fut. συμβλήσομαι solely in this sense.
to put together, and in Pass. to correspond, tally, Aesch.
to compare, τί τινι Hdt.; ἓν πρὸς ἕν Hdt.; τι πρός τι Plat.:—Pass., τὸ Βαβυλώνιον τάλαντον συμβαλλόμενον πρὸς τὸ Εὐβοεικόν the Babyl. talent being compared with, reduced to, the Euboic, Hdt.
in Mid. to put together, reckon, compute, Hdt.
to compare oneʼs own opinion with facts, and so to conclude, infer, conjecture, interpret, Pind., Soph., etc.:—so in Mid. to make out, understand, Hdt.
in Mid. to agree upon, fix, settle, Xen.

div1.head: σύμβαμα
div1.sense: a chance, casualty, Luc.

div1.head: συμβασείω
div1.sense: II, to wish to make a league or covenant with another, τινί Thuc.

div1.head: συμβασιλεύω
div1.sense: to rule or reign together with, τινί Luc.

div1.head: σύμβασις
div1.sense: an agreement, arrangement, treaty, Hdt., Eur.; δὸς ξύμβασιν τέκνοις make them friends, Eur.

div1.head: συμβατικός
div1.sense: tending to agreement, conciliatory, ξυμβ. λόγοι Thuc.; οὐδὲν πράξαντες ξυμβατικόν having effected nothing towards an agreement, Thuc.:—adv., -κῶς ἔχειν to be inclined to agreement, Plut.

div1.head: συμβελής
div1.sense: hit by several arrows at once, Polyb.

div1.head: συμβιάζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be forced together, to be reduced or extorted by force, Dem.

div1.head: συμβιβάζω
div1.sense: to bring together: Pass. to be joined or knit together, framed, NTest.
metaph. to bring together, reconcile, Hdt.; σ. τινά τινι to reconcile one to another, Thuc.
to put together, compare, examine, Plat.
to prove logically, Arist., NTest.
to teach, instruct, NTest.

div1.head: συμβιβαστικός
div1.sense: leading to reconciliation, Plut.

div1.head: σύμβιος
div1.sense: a companion, partner, Arist.: a husband or wife, Anth.

div1.head: συμβιόω
div1.sense: to live with another, c. dat., Dem.; in pl. to live together, ὡς κοινῇ συμβιωσόμενοι Plat.

div1.head: συμβιωτέος
div1.sense: one must live with, τινί Arist.

div1.head: συμβλητός
div1.sense: comparable, capable of being compared, absol. or c. dat., Arist.

div1.head: συμβοάω
div1.sense: to shout together with, τινί Xen.
c. acc. to call on others at once, Xen.

div1.head: συμβοήθεια
div1.sense: joint aid or assistance, Thuc.

div1.head: συμβοηθέω
div1.sense: to render joint aid, join in assisting, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: συμβόλαιον
div1.sense: like σύμβολον, a mark or sign to conclude from, a token, Hdt.: a symptom, Soph.

at Athens, a contract, covenant, bond, in acknowledgment of a loan, Oratt.; in pl., of a single contract, Plat., etc.; τὰ Ἀθήναζε καὶ τὰ Ἀθήνηθεν συμβ. a bond for money lent on freights to and from Athens, Dem.
generally, an engagement, Eur.
intercourse, Plut.

div1.head: συμβόλαιος
div1.sense: of or concerning contracts, Thuc.

div1.head: συμβολέω
div1.sense: to meet or fall in with, τινί Aesch.

div1.head: συμβολή
div1.sense: a coming together, meeting, joining, Xen.: the juncture of two parts, the end, Lat. commissura, Hdt., Plat.
in hostile sense, an encounter, engagement, battle, Hdt., Aesch.
= συμβόλαιον II, a contract, covenant, Arist.; in Ar. Ach. there is a play on signfs. II and III, encounter and accounts, charge and charges.
in pl., συμβολαί were contributions for a common meal, πίνειν ἀπὸ συμβολῶν, like de symbolis esse in Terent., Attic; the entertainment itself, a picnic, Xen.

div1.head: συμβολικός
div1.sense: signifying by a sign or symbol, symbolical, figurative, Luc.

div1.head: σύμβολον
div1.sense: a sign or token by which one infers a thing, Trag.; λαμπάδος τὸ σύμβολον the token of the beacon-fire, Aesch.:—often in pl., of marks on the body, Eur.; of omens, Aesch.
a pledge or pawn, on which money was advanced, Lys.
in pl. tallies, Lat. tesserae hospitales, i.e. the halves of a bone or coin, which two persons broke between them, each keeping one piece, Hdt., Eur., etc.
at Athens, a ticket, counter, Lat. tessera, such as were given to the dicasts, on presenting which they received their fee, Dem.
a permit or licence to reside, given to aliens, Ar.; a ticket given by each person who joined in a picnic, to be presented for payment at the end (cf. συμβολή IV), Ar.
in Eccl. the distinctive mark of Christians, a confession of faith, a creed, Lat. symbolum.

in legal phrase, σύμβολα were covenants between two states for protection of commerce, Dem., etc.; σύμβολα ποιεῖσθαι πρὸς πόλιν to make a commercial treaty with a state, τὰ σ. συγχέειν to violate such treaty, Dem.

div1.head: σύμβολος
div1.sense: an augury, omen, Aesch., Xen.

div1.head: συμβούλευμα
div1.sense: advice given, Xen., Arist.

div1.head: συμβουλευτέος
div1.sense: to be given as advice, Thuc.
-τέον, one must advise, τινί Isocr.

div1.head: συμβουλευτικός
div1.sense: of or for advising, deliberative, of orators, Arist.

div1.head: συμβουλεύω
div1.sense: to advise, counsel, Lat. consulere alicui, c. dat. pers. et inf., to advise one to do a thing, Hdt., Thuc., etc.
without the inf., σ. τινί τι Hdt., Plat.; σ. τι to recommend a measure, Hdt., Attic:—Pass., τὰ συμβουλευόμενα the advice given, Xen.
absol. to advise, give advice, Soph.; ὁ συμβουλεύων or -εύσας, an adviser, Lat. auctor sententiae, Arist.
Mid. to consult with a person, i. e. ask his advice, Lat. consulere aliquem, c. dat., Hdt., etc.: absol. to consult, deliberate, Xen.

div1.head: συμβουλή
div1.sense: counsel, consultation, deliberation, debate, Plat.

div1.head: συμβουλία
div1.sense: advice or counsel given, Hdt., Xen.; in pl. counsels, Xen.

div1.head: συμβούλιον
div1.sense: counsel, NTest.
a council, Plut.

div1.head: συμβούλομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to will or to wish with another, c. dat., Eur.
to agree with, τινι Plat.:—absol. to consent, Plat.

div1.head: σύμβουλος
div1.sense: an adviser, counsellor, Hdt., Soph., etc.; as fem., Xen.:—c. gen. pers. oneʼs adviser, Aesch., etc.; also, σ. τινι Ar., etc.:—but c. gen. rei, σ. λόγου τοῦδέ μοι γένεσθε be my counsellors in this matter, Aesch.; also, περί or ὑπέρ τινος Aesch., Isocr.:— ξύμβουλός εἰμι συμβουλεύω, to advise, c. inf., Aesch.

div1.head: συμβύω
div1.sense: to cram or huddle together, Ar.

div1.head: σύμβωμος
div1.sense: worshipped on a common altar, Strab.

div1.head: συμμαθητής
div1.sense: a fellow-disciple, Plat.

div1.head: συμμαίνομαι
div1.sense: Pass., to be mad together, join in madness, τινι with one, Luc.

div1.head: συμμανθάνω
div1.sense: to learn along with another, c. dat., Xen.: absol. to share in the knowledge of a thing, Soph.; ὁ συμμαθών one that is accustomed to a thing, Xen.

div1.head: συμμάρπτω
div1.sense: to seize or grasp together, Hom.

div1.head: συμμαρτυρέω
div1.sense: to bear witness with or in support of another, c. dat., Soph., Thuc.; τι to a fact, Solon., Xen.; also, σ. τινι πάντα ὡς ἀληθῆ λέγει Xen.

div1.head: σύμμαρτυς
div1.sense: a fellow-witness, Soph.

div1.head: συμμαστιγόω
div1.sense: to whip or lash along with or together, Luc.

div1.head: συμμαχέω
div1.sense: to be an ally, to be in alliance, Aesch., Thuc.:—generally, to help, aid, succour, τινί Soph., etc.:—Pass. to be assisted, Luc.

div1.head: συμμαχία
div1.sense: an alliance offensive and defensive (opp. to an ἐπιμαχία, defensive), Hdt., etc.: συμμαχίαν ποιεῖσθαι πρός τινα Hdt.; τινί Thuc.
generally, the duty of an ally, Aesch.
= τὸ συμμαχικόν, the body of allies, Hdt., Thuc.: also, the country of oneʼs allies, Thuc.
an allied or auxiliary force, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: συμμαχικός
div1.sense: of or for alliance, θεοὶ ξ. the gods invoked at the making of an alliance, Thuc.
τὸ συμμαχικόν, the auxiliaries, allied forces, Hdt., Thuc.
a treaty of alliance, Thuc.: τὰ -κά matters respecting alliances, Xen.
adv. -κῶς, like an ally, Isocr.

div1.head: συμμαχίς
div1.sense: allied, Thuc., Xen.; ξ. πόλις an allied state, Thuc.; also ἡ σ. (without πόλις) Thuc.
= τὸ ξυμμαχικόν, the body of allies, Thuc.

div1.head: συμμάχομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to fight along with others, to be an ally, auxiliary, Xen.: generally, to help, succour, τινι Xen.; τὸ οἰκὸς ἐμοὶ συμμάχεται probability is on my side, Hdt.

div1.head: σύμμαχος
div1.sense: fighting along with, allied with, τινι Hdt., Attic: as Subst. an ally, and in pl. allies, Hdt., Attic
of things, συμμάχῳ δορί Aesch.; νόμος σύμμαχος τῷ θέλοντι Hdt.; c. gen. rei, ἀρετὴ τῶν ἔργων σύμμαχος Xen.

div1.head: συμμεθέπω
div1.sense: to sway jointly, Anth.

div1.head: συμμεθίστημι
div1.sense: to help in changing, 3rd sg. συμμεθιστᾷ (from -ιστάω) Strab.
Pass., with aor2 et perf. act., to change places along with another, Plut.

div1.head: συμμελετάω
div1.sense: to exercise or practise with or together, Anth.

div1.head: συμμένω
div1.sense: to hold together, keep together, Thuc., etc.: of treaties or agreements, to hold, continue, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: συμμερίζω
div1.sense: to distribute in shares: Mid. to take share in or with, c. dat., NTest.

div1.head: συμμεσουράνησις
div1.sense: a being in the same meridian, Strab.

div1.head: συμμεταβάλλω
div1.sense: to change along with other things, τί τινι Anth., Plut.:—Pass. to change sides and take part with, τινί Aeschin.
intr. in Act. to change with or together, Arist.

div1.head: συμμετακοσμέω
div1.sense: Mid.-Pass. to change oneʼs habits along with another, c. dat., Plut.

div1.head: συμμεταπίπτω
div1.sense: to change along with others, c. dat., Aeschin.

div1.head: συμμεταφέρω
div1.sense: Pass. to be borne off together, Plut.

div1.head: συμμεταχειρίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to take charge of a thing with others, Isae.

div1.head: συμμετέχω
div1.sense: to partake of a thing with others, take part in it with others, c. dat. pers. et gen. rei, Eur.; with gen. rei only, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: συμμετεωρίζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be raised together, Strab.

div1.head: συμμετοικέω
div1.sense: to emigrate along with another, c. dat., Plut.

div1.head: συμμέτοχος
div1.sense: partaking with another in a thing, the partner of another, NTest.

div1.head: συμμετρέω
div1.sense: to measure by comparison with another thing:—Pass.,
ἦμαρ συμμετρούμενον χρόνῳ this day measured by calculation of time, Soph.
absol. to be commensurate with, Soph.
οἷς ὁ βίος ξυνεμετρήθη who had their life measured out, Thuc.
Mid. to measure for oneself, compute exactly, Hdt.; ξυνεμετρήσαντο τὸ τεῖχος ταῖς ἐπιβολαῖς τῶν πλίνθων calculated its height by counting the courses of bricks, Thuc.

div1.head: συμμέτρησις
div1.sense: commeasurement, Thuc.

div1.head: συμμετρία
div1.sense: commensurability, Arist.
symmetry, due proportion, Plat., etc.

div1.head: σύμμετρος
div1.sense: commensurate with another thing, Eur.: exactly fitting, Aesch.; τῷδε τἀνδρὶ ξ. being of like age with, Soph.; ποίᾳ σύμμετρος τύχῃ; coincident with what chance? i. e. in the very nick of time, Soph.; v. infr. III. 2.
commensurable, Arist.
in measure with, proportionable, exactly suitable, Isocr., etc.
absol. in right measure, in due proportion, symmetrical, opp. to ὑπερβάλλων and ἐλλείπων, Plat., etc.
generally, fitting, meet, due, Aesch.;— σύμμετρος ὡς κλύειν within fit distance for hearing, Soph.
adv. -τρως, Isocr., etc.
in due time, Eur.

div1.head: συμμητιάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to take counsel with or together, Il.

div1.head: συμμηχανάομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to help to provide or procure, Xen.
to form plans with another, c. dat., Plut.

div1.head: σύμμιγα
div1.sense: promiscuously with others, c. dat., Hdt.

div1.head: συμμιγής
div1.sense: commingled, promiscuous, Soph., Eur., etc.
c. dat. commingled with, Aesch.

div1.head: συμμείγνυμι
div1.etym: Mid., fut. -μίξομαι also in pass. sense
div1.sense: to mix together, commingle, Hhymn.; to mix one thing with another, τί τινι Hdt., Attic; c. acc. only, συμμίξαντες τὰ στρατόπεδα having combined them, Hdt.:—Pass., of a river, to be mingled with another river, c. dat., Il.: to join forces, of two armies, Thuc.:—metaph., οὐδείς ἐστι τῷ κακὸν οὐ συνεμίχθη there is none who has not misery as an ingredient in his nature, Hdt.; συμμιγέντων τούτων πάντων when all these things happened together, Hdt.
to unite, θεοὺς γυναιξί Hhymn.:—Pass. to have intercourse with, c. dat., Hdt., Aesch.
metaph., σ. τινὰ τύχᾳ to make him acquainted with fortune, Pind.; πρῆγμα συμμῖξαί τινι to communicate a matter to another, Hdt.

intr. in Act. to have intercourse with, to associate or communicate with others, c. dat., Theogn., Hdt., etc.; σ. πρός τινα to join him, Xen.:—generally, to meet for conversation or traffic, Hdt.; σ. τινί to converse with, Hdt., Eur.
in hostile sense, to meet in close fight, come to blows, engage, τινί with one, Hdt., etc.
generally, to meet, Xen.

div1.head: σύμμικτος
div1.sense: commingled, promiscuous, Hes., Soph.: esp. of troops, irregular, Hdt., Thuc. adv. -τως, Strab.

div1.head: συμμιμητής
div1.sense: a joint-imitator, NTest.

div1.head: συμμιμνήσκομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to bear in mind with, Dem.

div1.head: σύμμιξις
div1.sense: commixture, τινος πρός τι Plat.
intercourse, Plut.

div1.head: συμμισέω
div1.sense: to join with in hating, Polyb.

div1.head: συμμορία
div1.sense: a co-partnership or company: at Athens, after 377 B. C., the 1200 wealthiest citizens were divided into 20 συμμορίαι or companies, 2 in each tribe (φυλή) ; each being called on in its turn to discharge extraordinary expenses, Xen., Dem.

div1.head: σύμμορος
div1.sense: united for purposes of taxation, Thuc.

div1.head: συμμορφόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be conformed to, τινι NTest.

div1.head: σύμμορφος
div1.sense: conformed to, c. gen., NTest.

div1.head: συμμοχθέω
div1.sense: to share in toil with, τινί Eur.

div1.head: συμμυέω
div1.sense: to initiate together, Plut.

div1.head: συμμύω
div1.sense: to be shut up, to close, be closed, of wounds, Il.; συμμεμυκώς with closed eyes, Plat.

div1.head: συμπάθεια
div1.sense: fellow-feeling, sympathy, Arist.

div1.head: συμπαθέω
div1.sense: to sympathise, Isocr., etc.

div1.head: συμπαθής
div1.sense: sympathizing with, τινί Arist.: absol. sympathetic, Arist.

div1.head: συμπαιανίζω
div1.sense: to sing paeans with, τινί Dem.

div1.head: συμπαιδεύω
div1.sense: to teach together, educate at the same time, Xen.: Pass. to be educated with others, Isocr.

div1.head: συμπαίζω
div1.sense: to play or sport with another, c. dat., Soph.; absol., Hdt.; c. acc. cogn., μετʼ ἐμοῦ σύμπαιζε τὴν ἑορτήν keep the feast together with me, Ar.

div1.head: συμπαιστής
div1.sense: a playmate, playfellow, Plat.:— fem. συμπαίστρια, ἡ, Ar.

div1.head: συμπαίω
div1.sense: to dash against, τί τινι Soph.
intr. to dash together, Eur.

div1.head: συμπανηγυρίζω
div1.sense: to attend a solemn assembly with another, c. dat., Plut.

div1.head: συμπαραβύω
div1.sense: to cram in along with, τινά τινι Luc.

div1.head: συμπαραγγέλλω
div1.sense: to help in canvassing for an office, c. dat., Plut.

div1.head: συμπαραγίγνομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to be ready at the same time, of fruit ripening, Hdt.
to stand by another, to come in to assist, Thuc.

div1.head: συμπαραδηλόω
div1.sense: to shew incidentally at the same time, Strab.

div1.head: συμπαραθέω
div1.sense: to run along together, Dem.

div1.head: συμπαραινέω
div1.sense: to join in recommending, τί τινι Ar.: to join in approving, τι Ar.

div1.head: συμπαρακαθίζω
div1.sense: to make to sit beside: so in Mid., Dem.
Mid. also to sit close beside, Plat.

div1.head: συμπαρακαλέω
div1.sense: to invite together or at the same time, Xen., Plat.
to ask for at the same time, τι ἀπό τινος Xen.

div1.head: συμπαρακελεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to join in exciting, Isocr.

div1.head: συμπαρακολουθέω
div1.sense: to follow in a parallel line with, keep up with, τινί Isocr., etc.: absol., Xen.

div1.head: συμπαρακομίζω
div1.sense: to carry along the coast with one, of a commander, Thuc.; Pass. of the ships, Thuc.

div1.head: συμπαρακύπτω
div1.sense: to bend oneself along with, Luc.

div1.head: συμπαραλαμβάνω
div1.sense: to take along with one, take in as an adjunct, Plat.

div1.head: συμπαραμένω
div1.sense: to stay along with or among others, c. dat., Thuc.

div1.head: συμπαραμείγνυμι
div1.sense: to mix in together, Ar.

div1.head: συμπαρανεύω
div1.sense: to express assent also, Arist.

div1.head: συμπαρανήχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to swim beside together, Luc.

div1.head: συμπαραπέμπω
div1.sense: to escort along with others, τὴν παραπομπήν Aeschin.; τὴν ὄψιν σ. τινί to follow him with oneʼs eyes, Plut.

div1.head: συμπαραπόλλυμαι
div1.sense: to perish along with or besides, Dem.

div1.head: συμπαρασκευάζω
div1.sense: to assist in getting ready or bringing about, Xen., Dem.

div1.head: συμπαραστατέω
div1.sense: to stand by so as to assist, c. dat., Aesch.; absol., Ar.

div1.head: συμπαραστάτης
div1.sense: one who stands by to aid, a joint helper or assistant, Soph., Ar.

div1.head: συμπαρατάσσομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be set in array with others, fight along with them, c. dat., Isocr.

div1.head: συμπαρατηρέω
div1.sense: to keep watch together, Dem.

div1.head: συμπαρατίθημι
div1.sense: to place alongside of others, Polyb.

div1.head: συμπαρατρέφω
div1.sense: to bring up or keep at the same time, of dogs and other animals, Xen.

div1.head: συμπαρατρέχω
div1.sense: to run along with, Plut.

div1.head: συμπαραφέρω
div1.sense: to carry along together: — Pass. to rush along together, Xen.

div1.head: συμπάρειμι
div1.sense: to be present also or at the same time, Xen., etc.
to stand by, to come to help, τινι Xen., Dem.

div1.head: συμπάρειμι
div1.sense: to go beside also or together, 3 sg. imperf. συμπαρῄει, Xen., Aeschin.

div1.head: συμπαρεισέρχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to go in along with, Luc.

div1.head: συμπαρέπομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to go along with, accompany, c. dat., Xen., etc.

div1.head: συμπαρέχω
div1.sense: to assist in causing, φόβον τινί Xen.; in procuring, ἀσφάλειάν τινι Xen.

div1.head: συμπαρίπταμαι
div1.sense: Dep. to fly along with, Luc.

div1.head: συμπαρίστημι
div1.sense: to place beside one also, Pind.
Pass., c. aor2 et perf. act., to stand beside, assist, τινι Soph.

div1.head: συμπαροξύνω
div1.sense: to provoke with or together, Xen.

div1.head: συμπαρορμάω
div1.sense: to urge on with or together, Plut.

div1.head: σύμπειρος
div1.sense: acquainted with, τινι Pind.

div1.head: συμπείρω
div1.sense: to pierce through together, Plut.

div1.head: συμπέμπω
div1.sense: to send with or at the same time, Hdt., Attic
to help in conducting, Lys.

div1.head: συμπενθέω
div1.sense: trans. to join in mourning for a thing, τι Isocr.
intr. to mourn together with, τινί Aesch.; absol., Eur.

div1.head: συμπένομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to be poor along with another in a thing, τινί τινος Plat.

div1.head: συμπεραίνω
div1.sense: to join or assist in accomplishing, Eur.:—Mid., συμπεραίνεσθαί τινι ἔχθραν to join fully in enmity with another, Dem.
to decide or conclude absolutely, σ. φροντίδα to make up oneʼs mind, Eur.; κλῇθρα μοχλοῖς σ. to make the doors doubly sure by bars, Eur.:—Pass. to be quite finished, Xen.

div1.head: συμπέρασμα
div1.sense: a conclusion, Arist.

div1.head: συμπερασματικός
div1.sense: conclusive: adv. -κῶς, Arist.

div1.head: συμπέρθω
div1.sense: to destroy with or together, Eur.

div1.head: συμπεριάγω
div1.sense: to carry about with or together, Xen.:—Pass. to go round with or together, Xen.:— Mid. to lead about with oneself, Xen.

div1.head: συμπεριαγωγός
div1.sense: an assistant in converting others, Plat.

div1.head: συμπερίειμι
div1.sense: to go round with another, c. dat., Xen.

div1.head: συμπεριθέω
div1.sense: to run about together, Luc.

div1.head: συμπεριλαμβάνω
div1.sense: to comprehend in a treaty with others, Philipp. ap. Dem.
Mid. to take part together in a thing, c. gen., Luc.

div1.head: συμπερινοστέω
div1.sense: to go round together with, follow along with, τινί Luc.

div1.head: συμπεριπατέω
div1.sense: to walk round or about with, τινί Plat.: absol., οἱ συμπεριπατοῦντες their companions in walking round, Arist.

div1.head: συμπεριπλοκή
div1.sense: inter-connexion, Luc.

div1.head: συμπεριποιέω
div1.sense: to help in procuring, Polyb.

div1.head: συμπεριτρέχω
div1.sense: to run round together, Luc.

div1.head: συμπεριφέρω
div1.sense: to carry round along with or together, Plat.
Pass. to be carried round together, Plat.
συμπεριφέρεσθαί τινι to have intercourse with one, Polyb.: to adapt oneself to circumstances, c. dat., Aeschin.
to be well acquainted with things, Polyb.

div1.head: συμπεριφθείρομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to go about with any one to oneʼs own ruin, Luc.

div1.head: συμπερονάω
div1.sense: to pin together, Plut.

div1.head: συμπέτομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to fly with or together, Luc.

div1.head: συμπήγνυμι
div1.sense: to put together, construct, frame, Pind., Eur., etc.:—Mid. to construct for oneself, Luc.
to make solid, congeal, condense, Il.

div1.head: σύμπηκτος
div1.sense: put together, constructed, framed, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: συμπιέζω
div1.sense: to press or squeeze together, to grasp closely, Plat.:—Pass. to be squeezed up, Xen.

div1.head: συμπίνω
div1.sense: to drink together, join in a drinking bout, Hdt., Ar., etc.

div1.head: συμπίπτω
div1.sense: to fall together, meet in battle, come to blows, Lat. concurrere, Hom., Hdt.: σ. ἐς νείκεα Hdt.: to encounter, κλύδωνι Eur.; νηί Thuc.
generally, to fall in with, meet with accidents, misfortunes, c. dat., Hdt., Soph.
of ailments, events, to fall upon, happen to, c. dat. pers., Aesch., Isocr.; also ἔς τινα Hdt.
absol. to happen or fall out at the same time, concur, Hdt.
c. part, like τυγχάνω, τόδε συνέπεσε γενόμενον Hdt.
impers., συνέπεσε, it happened, fell out, came to pass, c. inf., Hdt.; ξυνέπεσεν εἰς τοῦτο ἀνάγκης ὥστε . . matters came to such a pass that . . , Thuc.; or c. acc. et inf., Thuc.
to coincide, agree or be in accordance with, τινί Hdt.: absol. to agree exactly, Hdt.; ἐμοὶ σὺ συμπέπτωκας ἐς ταὐτὸν λόγου have come to exactly the same point with me, Eur.
to fall together, i. e. fall in, collapse, of a house, Lat. concidere, Eur., Thuc.; σῶμα συμπεσόν a frame having collapsed from disease, Plat.
συμπίτνω poet. for συμπίπτω, when the penult. is to be short
to fall or dash together, of waves, Aesch.
to concur, Aesch.; c. dat., Eur.

div1.head: συμπλανάομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to wander about with, Polyb.

div1.head: συμπλάσσω
div1.sense: to mould or fashion together, γαίης of clay, Hes.:—Pass., Ar.
of speakers and writers, ξυνομολογοῦντες καὶ ξ. by agreeing on an hypothesis and a fiction, Plat.
metaph. to feign or fabricate together, Dem.

div1.head: συμπλαταγέω
div1.sense: to sound by striking together, σ. χερσί to clap with the hands, Il.

div1.head: συμπλείονες
div1.sense: several together, Lat. complures, Arist.

div1.head: συμπλέκω
div1.sense: to twine or plait together, Plat.; τινί with a thing, Theocr.; συμπλέκοντες τὼ χεῖρε εἰς τοὐπίσω joining their hands behind them, Thuc.
Pass. to be twined together, entwined, entangled, Eur.; ἴχνη συμπεπλεγμένα tracks entangled, crossing in different directions, Xen.

of persons wrestling, to be locked together with another, c. dat., Hdt.: generally, to be engaged in close fight, Dem.: of a ship, to be entangled with her opponent, Hdt.:—then, metaph. to be entangled in, τῇ Σκυθῶν ἐρημίᾳ συμπλακῆναι Ar.; συμπεπλέγμεθα ξένῳ we are entangled or engaged with him, Eur.; of war, to be engaged in, Dem.
intr. in Act., = Pass., Eur.

div1.head: σύμπλεος
div1.sense: quite full, Xen.

div1.head: συμπλέω
div1.sense: to sail in company with, τινί Hdt., etc.; absol., Thuc.

div1.head: συμπληγάς
div1.sense: striking or dashing together, ξυμπληγάδες πέτραι the justling rocks, i. e. the Κυάνεαι νῆσοι, which were supposed to close in on all who sailed between them, Eur.; also Ξυμπληγάδες (without πέτραι) Eur.; also in sg., Eur.

div1.head: συμπλήγδην
div1.sense: with clapping of hands, Theocr.

div1.head: συμπληθύνω
div1.sense: to multiply or increase together, Xen.

div1.head: συμπληθύω
div1.sense: to help to fill or increase, Hdt.

div1.head: συμπληρόω
div1.sense: to help to fill, σ. τοῖσι Ἀθηναίοισι τὰς νέας to help them in manning the ships, Hdt.
to fill up, ξ. ἑξήκοντα ναῦς to man them fully, Thuc.

div1.head: συμπλοϊκός
div1.sense: sailing with or together, συμπλ. φιλία friendship of shipmates, Arist.

div1.head: συμπλοκή
div1.sense: an intertwining, complication, Plat.
a close struggle or engagement, Plat.

div1.head: σύμπλοος
div1.sense: sailing with one in a ship, a shipmate, Hdt.; c. dat. pers., Eur.:—poet. of ships, Anth.
metaph. a partner or comrade in a thing, c. gen., Soph.

div1.head: συμπνέω
div1.sense: to breathe together with, τινί Anth.: metaph., ἐμπαίοις τύχαισι σ. to go along with the sudden blasts of fortune, to yield or bow to them, Aesch.
absol. to agree together, conspire, Dem.

div1.head: συμπνίγω
div1.sense: to throttle, choke, press closely, NTest.

div1.head: σύμπνοος
div1.sense: animated by one breath, in accord with, τινι Anth.

div1.head: συμποδίζω
div1.sense: to tie the feet together, bind hand and foot, Ar.:—Pass. to be entangled in a net, Xen.
metaph. to entangle, Lat. impedire, Plat.

div1.head: συμποιέω
div1.sense: to help in doing a thing, Isae.

div1.head: συμποιμαίνω
div1.sense: Mid.Pass. to feed together, Eur.

div1.head: συμπολεμέω
div1.sense: to join in war, Thuc., Xen., etc.; τινί with one, Xen.

div1.head: συμπολίζω
div1.sense: to unite into one city:—Pass., Strab.

div1.head: συμπολιορκέω
div1.sense: to join in besieging, to besiege jointly, Hdt., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: συμπολιτεία
div1.sense: a federal union of states, a confederacy, league, Polyb.

div1.head: συμπολιτεύω
div1.sense: to live as fellow-citizens or members of one state, τισί with others, Thuc.:—Mid., οἱ συμπολιτευόμενοι oneʼs fellow-citizens, Isocr.

div1.head: συμπολίτης
div1.sense: a fellow-citizen, Eur.

div1.head: σύμπολλοι
div1.sense: many together, Plat.

div1.head: συμπομπεύω
div1.sense: to accompany in a procession, to escort, Aeschin.

div1.head: συμπονέω
div1.sense: to work with or together, to take part in labouring, τινί with one, Aesch., Soph., etc.: also, σ. κακοῖς to take part in evils, Eur.:—absol. to labour or suffer together, Soph., etc.

div1.head: συμπονηρεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to join others in villainy, c. dat. pers., Isocr.

div1.head: συμπορεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep.: to go or journey together, Eur.; τινι with one, Xen., etc.
to come together, of the Senate, Polyb.

div1.head: συμπορθέω
div1.sense: to help to destroy, c. dat. pers., Eur.; οἱ συμπεπορθημένοι involved in like ruin, Strab.

div1.head: συμπορίζω
div1.sense: to help in procuring, Thuc.:— Mid. to do so for oneself, Thuc.

div1.head: συμποσία
div1.sense: a drinking together, Pind.

div1.head: συμποσιαρχέω
div1.sense: to be a συμποσίαρχος, Arist.

div1.head: συμποσίαρχος
div1.sense: the president of a drinking-party, toastmaster, Lat. magister bibendi, Xen., etc.

div1.head: συμπόσιον
div1.sense: a drinking-party, symposium, Theogn., Hdt., etc.
the room in which such parties were given, drinking-room, Luc.

div1.head: συμπότης
div1.sense: a fellow-drinker, boon-companion, Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: συμποτικός
div1.sense: of or for a συμπόσιον, convivial, jolly, Ar.; σ. ἁρμονίαι airs suited for drinking songs, Plat.:— συμποτικός a jolly fellow, Ar.:—comp. -ώτερος, Sup. -ώτατος, Luc.

div1.head: συμπραγματεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to assist in transacting business, c. dat. pers., Plut.

div1.head: σύμπας
div1.sense: all together, all at once, all in a body, Hom., Hdt., Attic; in Attic, the Art. is often added in the case of Numerals, πέντʼ ἦσαν οἱ ξύμπαντες Soph.
with collective nouns, the whole, ὁ σ. στρατός Hdt.; στρατὸς σ. Soph.; ξύμπασα πόλις the state as a whole, Thuc.; ξ. γνώμη the general scope (of a speech), Thuc.
τὸ σύμπαν the whole together, the sum of the matter, Hdt.; τὸ ξύμπαν εἰπεῖν Thuc.
τὸ σύμπαν, as adv. altogether, on the whole, in general, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: συμπάσχω
div1.sense: to suffer together, be affected by the same thing, Plat.
to have a fellow-feeling, sympathise, feel sympathy, Plat.

div1.head: συμπατάσσω
div1.sense: to strike with or together, Eur.

div1.head: συμπατέω
div1.sense: to tread together, trample under foot, Babr.:—Pass. to be trampled under foot, Aeschin.

div1.head: συμπεδάω
div1.sense: to bind together:—metaph. of frost, to benumb, Xen.

div1.head: συμπείθω
div1.sense: to join or assist in persuading, Xen.;—also, σ. τοῦ μὴ ἀθυμεῖν to help in persuading against despair, Thuc.:—Pass. to allow oneself to be persuaded at the same time, Aeschin.

div1.head: συμπράκτωρ
div1.sense: a helper, assistant, Hdt., Xen.: c. gen. rei, σ. ὁδοῦ a companion in travel, Soph.

div1.head: συμπράσσω
div1.sense: to join or help in doing, τί τινι Aesch., Eur., etc.; σ. τινὶ τἀγαθά to assist one in procuring what is good, Arist.: —c. acc. rei only, Soph.; σ. εἰρήνην to help in negotiating peace, Xen.; c. dat. pers. only, to act with, cooperate with, τινί Thuc., etc.
absol. to lend aid, cooperate, Soph., Xen., etc.; οἱ ξυμπράσσοντες the confederates, Thuc.
intr., σὺν κακῶς πράσσοντι συμπράσσειν κακῶς to share in anotherʼs woe, Eur.
Mid. to assist in avenging, συνεπρήξαντο Μενέλεῳ τῆς Ἑλένης ἁρπαγάς Hdt.

div1.head: συμπρεπής
div1.sense: befitting, Aesch.

div1.head: συμπρέπω
div1.sense: to befit, beseem, Pind.

div1.head: συμπρεσβευτής
div1.sense: a fellow-ambassador, Aeschin.

div1.head: συμπρεσβεύω
