div1.sense: to be a fellow-ambassador, be joined or associated with on an embassy, Dem., Aeschin.: Mid. to join in sending an embassy, Thuc.

div1.head: σύμπρεσβυς
div1.etym: = συμπρεσβευτής, but only in pl., Thuc., Dem., etc.

div1.head: συμπρεσβύτερος
div1.sense: a fellow-presbyter, NTest.

div1.head: συμπρίασθαι
div1.etym: aor2 inf., no pres. in use, cf πρίασθαι
div1.sense: to buy together, buy up, Arist.

div1.head: συμπροάγω
div1.sense: to lead forward together: intr. to move forward with or together, Plut.

div1.head: συμπρόεδρος
div1.sense: a joint-president, Aeschin.

div1.head: συμπροθυμέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to have equal desire with, share in eagerness with, τινι Thuc.: absol., Xen.
c. acc. rei, to join zealously in promoting, Xen.
c. dat. rei, to take zealous part in, Luc.
c. inf. to share in the desire that . . , Thuc., Xen., etc.

div1.head: συμπροξενέω
div1.sense: to help in furnishing with means, Eur.

div1.head: συμπροπέμπω
div1.sense: to join in escorting, Hdt., Ar., etc.; σ. τινὰ ναυσίν Thuc.

div1.head: συμπροσψαύω
div1.sense: to clash against, τινί Aesop.

div1.head: συμπτύσσω
div1.sense: to fold together, fold up and lay by, Soph.

div1.head: σύμπτωμα
div1.sense: a chance, casualty, Arist.: in bad sense, a mishap, mischance, Thuc.

div1.head: σύμπτωσις
div1.sense: a collapsing, Strab.
a meeting, Polyb.: in hostile sense, an attack, Polyb.

div1.head: σύμπυκνος
div1.sense: pressed together, compressed, Xen.

div1.head: συμπυνθάνομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to inquire about with another, τί τινι Eur.

div1.head: συμπυρόω
div1.sense: to burn up with or together, Eur.

div1.head: συμφανής
div1.sense: manifest at the same time, quite manifest, Arist.

div1.head: συμφερόντως
div1.etym: adverb from part. pres. of συμφέρω
div1.sense: profitably, Isocr.

div1.head: συμφερτός
div1.sense: united, banded together, Il.

div1.head: συμφέρω
div1.sense: Act.,
to bring together, gather, collect, Hdt., Thuc., etc.
to contribute, Aesch., Eur.
to bring into conflict, Aesch.
to bear along with or together, Xen.:—of sufferings and labours, to bear jointly, help to bear, Soph., Eur.: to bear with, excuse, Aesch.
intr. to confer a benefit, be useful or profitable, Hdt., Attic
impers. it is of use, is profitable, expedient, c. inf., Aesch., etc.

part. συμφέρων, ουσα, ον, useful, expedient, fitting, Soph., etc.:—in neut. as Subst., συμφέρον, οντος, τό, use, profit, advantage, expediency, Lat. utile, Soph., Thuc., etc.:—also in pl., τὰ συμφέροντα Soph., etc.; also in aor. part., τό τῳ ξυνενεγκόν Thuc.
intr., also,
to work with, agree with, assist, τινί Soph., Eur., etc.: — to bear with, give way, τινί Soph.
to fit, suit, τινί Ar., Xen.
of events, to happen, take place, turn out, c. inf., Hdt.
Pass. συμφέρομαι, fut. συνοίσομαι: aor1 -ηνέχθην, Ionic -είχθην: perf. -ενήνεγμαι:— to come together, to meet in battle, engage, Lat. congredi, Il., Thuc.: simply, to meet, Plat.
to come to terms, be of one mind or to agree with, τινι Hdt.: —absol. to agree together, be of one mind, concur, come to terms, Hdt., Soph., etc.
c. dat. rei, to adapt oneself to, acquiesce in, Plat.;—also, συμφέρεται ὡυτὸς εἶναι is found to be one and the same, Hdt.; οὐ συμφέρεται περί τινος does not agree with their story, Hdt.
of events, to happen, turn out, occur, come to pass, Hdt., Ar., etc.
impers. it happens, falls out, Hdt.

div1.head: συμφεύγω
div1.sense: to flee along with, τινί Hdt., Eur., etc.; σὺν φεύγουσι συμφεύγειν Eur.
to be banished along with or together, ξυνέφυγε τὴν φυγὴν ταύτην shared in this banishment, Plat.

div1.head: σύμφημι
div1.sense: to assent, approve, or agree fully, Aesch., etc.
c. acc. rei, to concede, agree to, grant, Plat., Xen.; absol., ξύμφημί σοι I grant you, Plat.; ξύμφαθι ἢ ἄπειπε say yes or no, Plat.
c. acc. et inf. to agree that . . , Soph., Plat.
c. inf. fut. to promise, Xen.

div1.head: συμφθέγγομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to sound with, accord with, τινι Plut.

div1.head: συμφθείρω
div1.sense: to destroy together or altogether, Eur., Luc.

div1.head: συμφθίνω
div1.sense: to decay along with, poet. aor2 pass. συνέφθιτο, Anth.

div1.head: σύμφθογγος
div1.sense: sounding together, in concert, Aesch.

div1.head: συμφιλέω
div1.sense: to love mutually, Soph.

div1.head: συμφιλοκαλέω
div1.sense: to be candidate for an honour along with another, Plut.

div1.head: συμφιλονικέω
div1.sense: to take part in a dispute with, side with, τινί Plat., etc.
absol. to join in a disputation, Plut.

div1.head: συμφιλοσοφέω
div1.sense: to join in philosophic study, Arist.

div1.head: συμφιλοτιμέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to join in zealous efforts, Plut.

div1.head: συμφλέγω
div1.sense: to burn to cinders, Eur., Theocr.

div1.head: συμφοβέω
div1.sense: to frighten at the same time: — Pass. to be afraid at the same time, Thuc.

div1.head: συμφοιτάω
div1.sense: to go regularly to a place together, Hdt.: esp. to go to school together, Ar., Dem., etc.; τινί with one, Luc.

div1.head: συμφοίτησις
div1.sense: a going to school together, Aeschin.

div1.head: συμφοιτητής
div1.sense: a school-fellow, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: συμφονεύω
div1.sense: to join another in killing, c. dat., Eur.

div1.head: συμφορά
div1.sense: an event, circumstance, chance, hap, Hdt., Attic; αἱ ξ. τῶν βουλευμάτων the results, issues of the counsels, Soph.; ξυμφορᾶς ἵνʼ ἕσταμεν in what a hazardous state we are, Soph.
esp. a mishap, mischance, misfortune, Hdt., Attic; συμφορῇ χρῆσθαι to be unfortunate, Hdt.
in good sense, good luck, a happy issue, Trag.

div1.head: συμφορεύς
div1.sense: a Lacedaemonian officer, a sort of aide-de-camp, Xen.

div1.head: συμφορέω
div1.sense: to bring together, to gather, collect, heap up, Hdt., Thuc., etc.:—Pass. to be collected, Plat.

div1.head: συμφόρησις
div1.sense: a bringing together, Plut.

div1.head: συμφορητός
div1.sense: brought together, collected, σ. δεῖπνον, σ. ἑστίασις a meal to which each guest contributes, Lat. coena collatitia, Arist.

div1.head: σύμφορος
div1.sense: happening with, accompanying, λιμὸς ἀεργῷ σύμφορος ἀνδρί hunger is the sluggardʼs companion, Hes.; c. gen., πενίης σύμφορα Hes.

useful, profitable, expedient, suitable, good, c. dat., Hes., Thuc.:— σύμφορόν ἐστι συμφέρει, c. inf., Hdt.; Πλούτῳ συμφορώτατον Ar.:— τὰ σύμφορα what is expedient, Soph., Thuc., etc.; τὸ ὑμέτερον ξ. your plea of expediency, Thuc.:—adv., συμφόρως ἔχειν to be expedient, Xen.; comp. συμφορώτερον, Thuc.; Sup. -ώτατα, Eur., etc.
rarely of persons, ξυμφορώτατοι προσπολεμῆσαι most convenient to make war upon, Thuc.

div1.head: συμφράδμων
div1.sense: one who joins in considering, a counsellor, Il.
in accord with, c. gen., Anth.

div1.head: συμφράζομαι
div1.sense: Mid.:— to join in considering, to take counsel with, c. dat., Od.
τίς τοι συμφράσσατο βουλάς; who imparted his counsels to thee? Od.
to contrive, Hes., Soph.
Act. to mention at the same time, Strab.

div1.head: συμφράσσω
div1.sense: to press or pack closely together, Hdt., Xen.
absol. of troops, to close their ranks, form in close order, Xen.
to block up, close, Xen.

div1.head: συμφρονέω
div1.sense: to be of one mind with, to agree, Polyb.
to consider well, ἃ δέον ἦν ποιεῖν Plut.
to collect oneself, Plut.

div1.head: συμφροντίζω
div1.sense: to have a joint care for, τινός Luc.

div1.head: σύμφρουρος
div1.sense: watching with, μέλαθρον σύμφρουρον ἐμοί the chamber that keeps watch with me, i. e. in which I lie sleepless, Soph.

div1.head: σύμφρων
div1.sense: of one mind, brotherly, Aesch.:— favouring, propitious, Aesch.

div1.head: συμφυγάς
div1.sense: a fellow-exile, Eur., Thuc.

div1.head: συμφυής
div1.sense: born with one, congenital, natural, Plat., etc.
adapted by nature, Plut.
attached, adhering, τινί to a thing, Anth.

div1.head: συμφύλαξ
div1.sense: a fellow-watchman or guard, Thuc., Plat., Xen., etc.

div1.head: συμφυλάσσω
div1.sense: to keep guard along with others, Hdt.: to guard with others, τι Xen.

div1.head: συμφυλέτης
div1.sense: of the same φυλή, Lat. contribulis: generally, a fellow-countryman, NTest.

div1.head: σύμφυλος
div1.sense: of the same stock or race, οἱ σύμφυλοι his congeners, Babr.

div1.head: σύμφυρτος
div1.sense: commingled, confounded, Eur.

div1.head: συμφύρω
div1.sense: to knead together: beat black and blue, Theocr.:—Pass., Eur.; ψυχὴ συμπέφυρται μετὰ τοῦ κακοῦ Plat.

div1.head: συμφυσάω
div1.sense: to blow together:—hence, like Lat. conflare, to beat up, contrive, Ar.
Pass., of the wind, to blow at the same time, Plut.

div1.head: συμφυτεύω
div1.sense: to plant along with or together: metaph. to have a hand in contriving, Soph.:—Pass. to be implanted also, Xen.

div1.head: σύμφυτος
div1.sense: born with one, congenital, innate, natural, inborn, inbred, Pind., Plat.; σ. αἰών our natural age, i. e. old age, Aesch.; νεικέων σ. τέκτων the natural author of strife, i. e. cause of strife natural to the race, Aesch.; ἐς τὸ σ. according to oneʼs nature, Eur.
c. dat. natural to, Lys.

div1.head: συμφύω
div1.sense: to make to grow together, Plat.
Pass., with perf. act. συμπέφῡκα, aor2 συνέφῡν:— to grow together, Plat., Xen.
to grow to or into, σ. ἀλλήλοις Plat.
to grow up with one, to become natural, Arist.

div1.head: συμφωνέω
div1.sense: to agree in sound, be in harmony, Plat.
metaph. to agree with, hold the same opinions with, τινί Plat.
to make an agreement or bargain with any one, πρός τινα Xen.; σ. τινί δηναρίου to agree with one for a denarius, NTest.: Pass., συνεφωνήθη ὑμῖν it was agreed between you, NTest.
to conspire, Arist.

div1.head: συμφωνία
div1.sense: concord or unison of sound, Plat.
metaph. harmony, agreement, Plat.

div1.head: σύμφωνος
div1.sense: agreeing in sound, in unison, Hhymn., Ar.: generally, echoing to cries, Soph.
metaph. harmonious, friendly, Pind., Soph.; σ. τινι in harmony or agreement with, Plat.

div1.head: συμψαύω
div1.sense: to touch one another, Xen.

div1.head: συμψάω
div1.sense: to sweep away, of a rapid river, Hdt.

div1.head: συμψηφίζω
div1.sense: to reckon together, count up, NTest.

div1.head: σύμψηφος
div1.sense: voting with, τινι Plat., etc.; σ. τινί τινος voting with one for a thing, Plat.:—absol. voting together, of the same opinion, Dem.

div1.head: συμψοφέω
div1.sense: to make a noise together, Polyb.

div1.head: σύμψυχος
div1.sense: of one mind, at unity, NTest.

div1.head: συνάγγελος
div1.sense: a fellow messenger or ambassador, Hdt.

div1.head: συναγγία
div1.sense: a confined space, Babr.

div1.head: συναγείρω
div1.sense: to gather together, assemble, Il., Hdt.:—esp. to collect an army, Hdt.:—Pass. to gather together, come together, assemble, Il.; συναγρόμενοι, Epic syncop. aor2 pass. part., those assembled, an assembly, Il.
to collect the means of living, Od.; and in Mid. to collect for oneself, Od.
metaph., σ. ἑαυτόν to collect oneself, Plat.:—so in Pass., Plat.

div1.head: συνάγνυμι
div1.sense: to break together, break to pieces, shiver, shatter, Hom.

div1.head: συναγορεύω
div1.etym: the fut. in use is συνερῶ
div1.sense: to join in advocating, advocate the same thing with, τί τινι Thuc., Xen.
to join in advising another, τινί Lys.
σ. τινί to speak with or in behalf of a person, support him, advocate his cause, Thuc.: so, c. dat. rei, σ. τινὸς σωτηρίᾳ Dem.

div1.head: συναγρεύω
div1.sense: to join in the chase, Anth.

div1.head: συνάγω
div1.sense: to bring together, gather together, collect, convene, Hom., Hdt., Attic
in hostile sense, to join battle, begin the battle-strife, Il.:—also like συμβάλλω, to match two warriors one against the other, Aesch.:—hence intr., σ. εἰς μέσσον to engage in fight, Theocr.
to bring together, join in one, unite, Hhymn. ( i.e., h. Merc.), Aesch.;— σ. γάμους to contract a marriage, Xen.
to receive into oneʼs house, NTest.
to gather together stores, crops, etc., Xen., etc.
to draw together, so as to make the extremities meet, Hdt., Thuc.: also to draw together, narrow, contract, Hdt.
to contract the brows, Ar.; σ. τὰ ὦτα to prick the ears, of dogs, Xen.
to collect from premises, i. e. to conclude, infer, Lat. colligere, Arist.

div1.head: συναγωγεύς
div1.sense: one who brings together, a convener, Lys.
one who unites, Plat.

div1.head: συναγωγή
div1.sense: a bringing together, uniting, Plat.
a place of assembly, synagogue, NTest.
σ. πολέμου a levying of war, Thuc.
a gathering in of harvest, Polyb.
a drawing together, contracting, σ. στρατιᾶς a forming an army in column, Plat.; σ. τοῦ προσώπου a pursing up or wrinkling of the face, Isocr.
a collection of writings, Arist.
a conclusion, inference, Arist.

div1.head: συναγωγός
div1.sense: bringing together, uniting, Plat.

div1.head: συναγωνιάω
div1.sense: to share in the anxiety, Polyb.

div1.head: συναγωνίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to contend along with, to share in a contest, τινι with one, Thuc., etc.:—generally, ξ. τινι to share in the fortunes of another, Thuc.
to help, succour, τινι Dem.
absol. to fight on the same side, Thuc.

div1.head: συναγωνιστής
div1.sense: one who shares with another in a contest, a fellow-combatant, coadjutor, Plat., etc.; τινός for a thing, Aeschin., Dem.

div1.head: συνάδελφος
div1.sense: one that has a brother or sister, Xen.

div1.head: συναδικέω
div1.sense: to join in wrong or injury, τινί with another, Thuc., Xen.; absol., Thuc., Xen.:— Pass. to be wronged alike, Dem.

div1.head: συνᾴδω
div1.sense: to sing with or together, Aeschin.; σ. ᾠδάν Ar.
generally, to be in accord with, τινί Soph., Plat.
trans. to celebrate together, τινά Theocr.

div1.head: συναείρω
div1.sense: to raise up together, Il.
to bind or yoke together, Il.; —Mid., συναείρεται ἵππους Il.

div1.head: συναθλέω
div1.sense: to strive together, τινί for a thing, NTest.
to strive or labour with others, τισί NTest.

div1.head: συναθροίζω
div1.sense: to gather together, assemble, of soldiers, Xen., Plat., etc.
of things, in Pass., τὸ κεφάλαιον τούτων ξυνηθροισμένων the sum of these collected amounts, Plat.
of a single person, οὐ ξυνήθροισται στρατῷ has not joined the main army, Eur.

div1.head: συναθροισμός
div1.sense: a collection, union, Babr.

div1.head: συναθύρω
div1.sense: to play with, τινί Mosch.

div1.head: συναΐγδην
div1.sense: pressing violently together, Hes.

div1.head: σύναιμος
div1.sense: of common blood, kindred, Soph., Eur.
as Subst. a kinsman, kinswoman, esp. a brother, sister, Soph.
Ζεὺς ξ. as presiding over kindred, Soph.; νεῖκος ξ. strife between kinsmen, Soph.

div1.head: συναινέω
div1.sense: to join in praising, Aesch.
to consent, absol., Aesch., Soph., etc.; σ. τινί to agree with a person, Hdt.
c. acc. rei, to agree to, promise, Soph., Xen., etc.: to grant at once, Xen.
c. inf. to agree or consent to do, Xen.

div1.head: συναίνυμαι
div1.sense: Dep. to take up, Il.

div1.head: συναιρέω
div1.sense: to grasp or seize together, to seize at once, Od., Thuc.
to bring together, bring into small compass; in speaking, ξυνελὼν λέγω briefly, in a word, Thuc.; ὡς συνελόντι εἰπεῖν Xen.; so, συνελόντι alone, Dem.
to make away with, crush, ὀφρῦς σύνελεν λίθος Il.:—metaph. to make an end of, τὸν πόλεμον Plut.:—Pass., Thuc.
to help to take or conquer, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: συναίρω
div1.sense: to take up together, Arist., Plut.; σ. λόγον μετά τινος to balance accounts with another, NTest.
Mid. to take part in a thing, c. gen., Thuc.
c. acc. rei, to help in bearing, Thuc., Dem.; also to engage in a thing, undertake it, Aesch., Eur.
τῶν σκελῶν σ. to catch by both legs, Plut.
Pass., συναίρεσθαι εἰς τὸ αὐτό to be joined together, unite, Xen.
to contribute, assist, Dem.

div1.head: συναισθάνομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to perceive also or at the same time, Arist.

div1.head: συναιτιάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to accuse along with, Plut.

div1.head: συναίτιος
div1.sense: c. gen. rei et dat. pers. being the cause of a thing jointly with another, σ. τινι ἀθανασίας helping him towards immortality, Isocr.; σ. τινος γενέσθαι τινί to share in the guilt of a thing with another, Isocr.
c. gen. rei only, being joint-cause of, accessory to, contributing to, Dem., etc.:—as Subst., ἡ ξυναιτία φόνου accomplice in murder, Aesch.:—absol., οὐκ αἰτίων, ἀλλʼ ἴσως ξυναιτίων Plat.

div1.head: συναιχμάζω
div1.sense: to fight with or together, Anth.

div1.head: συναιχμάλωτος
div1.sense: a fellow-prisoner, NTest.

div1.head: συναιωρέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be held suspended together with, c. dat., Plat.

div1.head: συνακμάζω
div1.sense: to bloom at the same time, Anth.

div1.head: συνακολασταίνω
div1.sense: to live dissolutely with another, Plut.

div1.head: συνακολουθέω
div1.sense: to follow closely, to accompany, τινί Ar., Thuc.
σ. λόγῳ to follow an argument completely, Plat.

div1.head: συνακοντίζω
div1.sense: to throw a javelin along with or at once, Antipho.
to shoot down, τινά Polyb.

div1.head: συνακούω
div1.sense: to hear along with or at the same time, Xen.; σ. ἀλλήλων to hear each other, Xen.

div1.head: συνακροάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to be a fellow-hearer, Plat.

div1.head: συνακτέος
div1.sense: one must bring together, Plat.
one must conclude, Arist.

div1.head: συνακτικός
div1.sense: able to bring together, τὸ σ. power of accumulation in oratory, Luc.

div1.head: συναλαλάζω
div1.sense: to cry aloud together, Polyb.
c. acc. to greet aloud, Eur.

div1.head: συναλγέω
div1.sense: to share in suffering, sympathise, Soph.:—absol., οἱ ξυναλγοῦντες those who are partners in sorrow, Soph.
c. dat. rei, to sympathise, shew sympathy at or in, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: συναλγηδών
div1.sense: joint grief:—in pl., = αἱ συναλγοῦσαι, partners in pain, Eur.

div1.head: συναλείφω
div1.sense: to smear or gloss over, Arist.

div1.head: συναλίζω
div1.sense: to bring together, collect, Hdt.:—Pass. to come together, assemble, Hdt., Xen., etc.; of a single person, to associate with others, NTest.

div1.head: συναλλαγή
div1.sense: an interchange of words for purposes of conciliation, Soph., Eur.: absol. a reconciliation, making of peace, Thuc.: pl. a treaty of peace, Xen.
generally, commerce, intercourse, Eur.

intervention, δαιμόνων ξυναλλαγαῖς by special interventions of the deities, Soph.; νόσου ξυναλλαγῇ by intervention of disease, Soph.: generally, the issue of intervention, a contingency, incident, Soph.; ὀλεθρίαισι συναλλ. with destructive issues, Soph.

div1.head: συνάλλαγμα
div1.sense: a mutual agreement, covenant, contract, Dem., etc.: in pl. dealings between men, Arist.

div1.head: συνάλλαξις
div1.sense: exchange, Plat.

div1.head: συναλλάσσω
div1.sense: to bring into intercourse with, associate with, τινά τινι Aesch.:—Pass. to have intercourse with, τινί Soph., Eur.
to reconcile, τινά τινι Thuc.:—Pass. and Mid. to be reconciled, to make a league or alliance with, πρός τινα Thuc., Xen.; absol. to make peace, Thuc., Xen.
intr. to have dealings with another, Soph., Eur.
to enter into engagements or contracts, Dem., Arist.

div1.head: συνάλλομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to leap together, Luc.

div1.head: συναλοάω
div1.sense: to thresh out together, to grind to powder, crush, shiver, Theocr.

div1.head: συναλύω
div1.sense: to wander about with another, c. dat., Plut.

div1.head: συνάμα
div1.sense: together, Anth., Luc.; τινί with one, Theocr.

div1.head: συναμιλλάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to contend or struggle together, Eur.

div1.head: συναμπέχω
div1.sense: to cover up closely, to wrap up, Aesch.:—Mid., τί συναμπίσχει κόρας; why dost veil thine eyes? Eur.

div1.head: συναμφότεροι
div1.sense: both together, Theogn., Hdt., Attic:—sg. in collective sense, τὸ ξ. συναμφότεροι, Plat.; τοῦτο συναμφότερον this united power, Dem.

div1.head: συνάμφω
div1.sense: both together, Plat., etc.

div1.head: συναναβαίνω
div1.sense: to go up with or together into central Asia, Hdt., Xen.; τινί with one, Xen.

div1.head: συναναβοάω
div1.sense: to cry out together, Xen.

div1.head: συναναγκάζω
div1.sense: to join or assist in compelling, Isocr., Dem.:—Pass. to be compelled at the same time, Dem.
to execute by force also, Isocr.:— Pass., ὅρκοι συνηναγκασμένοι extorted oaths, Eur.

div1.head: συναναγράφω
div1.sense: to register or record together:— Pass., συναναγραφῆναι ἐν τοῖς συμμάχοις Aeschin.

div1.head: συνανάγω
div1.sense: to carry back together:—Pass. to retire together, Polyb.
Pass. also, to go to sea together, Dem.

div1.head: συναναδίδωμι
div1.sense: to give back along with, Luc.

div1.head: συναναζεύγνυμι
div1.sense: to set out along with, Plut.

div1.head: συναναιρέω
div1.sense: to destroy together with, τινά τινι Polyb.
to destroy altogether or utterly, Isocr.:—Pass., Thuc.
to give the same answer, Plat.

div1.head: συνανάκειμαι
div1.sense: Pass. to recline together at table, NTest.

div1.head: συνανακεράννυμαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be mixed up with, τινι Luc.

div1.head: συναναλίσκω
div1.sense: to expend together or in company, Dem.
to help by spending money, Xen.

div1.head: συναναμείγνυμι
div1.sense: to mix up together: Pass. to be associated with others, c. dat., Luc.

div1.head: συναναπαύομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to take rest with others, NTest.

div1.head: συναναπείθω
div1.sense: to assist in persuading, τινὰ ποιεῖν τι Thuc., etc.

div1.head: συναναπέμπω
div1.sense: to send up together, Plut.

div1.head: συναναπλέκω
div1.sense: to entwine together with, τί τινι Luc.

div1.head: συναναπράσσω
div1.sense: to join in exacting payment, Xen.

div1.head: συναναρριπτέω
div1.sense: to throw up together, Luc.

div1.head: συνανασκάπτω
div1.sense: to dig up besides, Strab.

div1.head: συνανασπάω
div1.sense: to draw up together, Luc.

div1.head: συνανάσσω
div1.sense: to rule with, Anth.

div1.head: συναναστρέφω
div1.sense: to turn back together, intr., Plut.
Pass. and Mid. to live along with or among others, c. dat., Plut.

div1.head: συνανατήκω
div1.sense: to melt with or together, Plut.

div1.head: συνανατίθημι
div1.sense: to dedicate along with, Luc.

div1.head: συνανατολή
div1.sense: a rising together, Strab.

div1.head: συνανατρέχω
div1.sense: to run up with, Plut.

div1.head: συναναφθέγγομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to cry out or speak together, Plut.

div1.head: συναναφύρω
div1.sense: to knead up together:—Pass to wallow together, Luc.

div1.head: συναναχρέμπτομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to cough up together, Luc.

div1.head: συνανίστημι
div1.sense: to make to stand up or rise together, Xen.: to assist in restoring, Xen.
Pass. with aor2 act., to rise at the same time, Xen.; τινι with one, Xen.

div1.head: συναντάω
div1.sense: to meet face to face, of two persons, Od.; of many persons, to meet together, assemble, Philipp. ap. Dem.
like ἀντάω, to meet with, meet, τινί Eur., Ar.; so in Mid., Il.:—c. acc. cogn., συναντᾶν συνάντησιν Eur.
c. dat. rei, to come in contact with, φόνῳ Eur.
to befal, of accidents, etc., τινί Plut., NTest.

div1.head: συνάντησις
div1.sense: a meeting, Eur.

div1.head: συναντλέω
div1.sense: to drain along with, σ. πόνους τινί to join him in bearing all his sufferings, Lat. una exhaurire labores, Eur.

div1.head: συνάντομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to fall in with, meet, absol. or c. dat., Hom., etc.; in hostile sense, to meet in battle, Il.: metaph., φόρμιγγι σ. to approach (i. e. use) the lyre, Pind.

div1.head: συνανύτω
div1.sense: συνανύτω, to come to an end with, c. dat., Aesch.
συνανύω to arrive together, Plut.

div1.head: συναξιόω
div1.sense: to join in requiring, Xen.

div1.head: συναπάγω
div1.sense: to lead away with another, c. dat., Xen.; absol., Xen.
Pass. to be led away likewise, NTest.
to accommodate oneself to a thing, c. dat., NTest.

div1.head: συναπαίρω
div1.sense: intr. to sail or march away together, Luc.

div1.head: συναπαρτίζω
div1.sense: to correspond exactly with, lie over against, τινί Strab.

div1.head: συνάπας
div1.sense: all together, mostly in pl., Hdt., etc.:—in sg., with collective Nouns, τὸ συνάπαν στράτευμα Hdt.

div1.head: συναπειλέω
div1.sense: to threaten at the same time, Luc.

div1.head: συναπεργάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to help in completing, Plat.

div1.head: συναπεχθάνομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to become an enemy together, Plut.

div1.head: συναποβαίνω
div1.sense: to disembark together with, τινί Hdt.

div1.head: συναπογράφομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to enter oneʼs name together with others, as a candidate, Plut.

div1.head: συναποδημέω
div1.sense: to be abroad together, Arist.

div1.head: συναπόδημοι
div1.sense: those who live abroad together, Arist.

div1.head: συναποδιδράσκω
div1.sense: to run away along with, ξυναποδρᾶναί τινι (aor2 inf.), Ar.

div1.head: συναποδοκιμάζω
div1.sense: to join in reprobating, τι, Xen.

div1.head: συναποθνῄσκω
div1.sense: to die together with another, c. dat., Hdt.: absol. to die with one, Plat.

div1.head: συναποικίζω
div1.sense: to go as colonists together, Luc.

div1.head: συναποκάμνω
div1.sense: to cease from weariness together, Eur.

div1.head: συναποκτείνω
div1.sense: to kill together, Aeschin.

div1.head: συναπολαμβάνω
div1.sense: to receive in common or at once, Xen.

div1.head: συναπολάμπω
div1.sense: to shine forth together, Luc.

div1.head: συναπόλλυμι
div1.sense: to destroy together, σ. τοὺς φίλους to destroy oneʼs friends as well as oneself, Thuc.; σ. τὰ χρήματα to lose the money also, Dem.:—Pass. to perish together, Thuc.; τινι with one, Hdt.

div1.head: συναπολογέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to join in defending, Dem.

div1.head: συναπομαραίνομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to fade away and die together, Xen.

div1.head: συναπονεύω
div1.sense: to bend away together, τοῖς σώμασιν αὐτοῖς ἴσα τῇ δόξῃ ξυναπονεύοντες swerving with their bodies in sympathy with their thought, Thuc.

div1.head: συναποπέμπω
div1.sense: to send off together, Xen.

div1.head: συναπορρήγνυμι
div1.sense: to break together, Plut.

div1.head: συναποσβέννυμι
div1.sense: to put out with or together, τί τινι Anth.:—Pass., with aor2 act. -έσβην, perf. -έσβηκα, to be put out together, Plut.

div1.head: συναποστέλλω
div1.sense: to despatch together with another, c. dat., Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: συναποστερέω
div1.sense: to help to strip or cheat, τινά τινος one of a thing, Dem.

div1.head: συναποφαίνω
div1.sense: Mid. to assert likewise or together, to agree in asserting, Isocr., etc.

div1.head: συνάπτω
div1.sense: to tie or bind together, to join together, unite, σ. χέρα, in sign of friendship, Eur.; ἰδού, ξύναψον (sc. τὴν χέρα) Eur.; but, σ. χεῖρά τινος ἐν βρόχοις to bind it fast, Eur.:— σ. πόδα or ἴχνος τινί to meet him, Eur.; σ. κῶλον τάφῳ to approach the grave, Eur.; so, φόνος σ. τινὰ γᾷ Eur.:— ξ. βλέφαρα to close the eyes, Eur.; σ. στόμα to kiss one, Eur.:— σ. κακὰ κακοῖς to link misery with misery, Eur.; but, σ. κακόν τινι to link him with misery, Eur.: σ. τινὶ δαῖτα to give one a meal, Eur.: proverb., σ. λίνον λίνῳ to join thread to thread, i. e. to compare things of the same sort, Plat.

to connect in thought, to combine, Plat.: σ. μηχανήν to frame a plan, Aesch.; σ. ὄναρ εἴς τινα to connect it with him, refer it to him, Eur.; ξυνῆψε πάντας ἐς μίαν βλάβην involved them in one loss, Eur.
in hostile sense, σ. εἰς μάχην to bring into action, Hdt.; ἐλπὶς πόλεις ξυνῆψε engaged them in conflict, Eur.
σ. μάχην to join battle, Hdt.; τινί with one, Aesch.; πρός τινα Thuc.: also (without μάχην) to engage, Hdt., Ar.:—Pass., νεῖκος συνῆπταί τινι πρός τινα Hdt.
in friendly sense, to unite, Xen.: —Pass., συνάπτεσθαί τινι to have intercourse with, Anth.
c. acc. rei, σ. μῦθον, ὅρκους Eur.; σ. τινὶ γάμους, λέκτρα, κῆδος to form an alliance by marriage, Eur.: ξυνάπτεσθαι κῆδος τῆς θυγατρός to get oneʼs daughter married, Thuc.
intr.:
in local sense, to border on, lie next to, Hdt.; Τήνῳ συνάπτει Ἄνδρος Aesch.
of Time, to be nigh at hand, Pind.; so of events, λύπη σ. τινί Eur.
metaph. of thoughts, to meet together, Arist.:— to be connected with, πρός τι Arist.
of persons, σ. λόγοισι to enter into conversation, Soph.; so, ἐς λόγους ξ. τινί Eur.; also, σ. εἰς χορεύματα to join in the dance, Eur.; σ. ἐς χεῖρα γῇ, i. e. to come close to land, Eur.
τύχα ποδὸς ξυνάπτει μοι, i. e. I have come in good time, Eur.
Mid. to be next to, connected with, τινι Xen.
to take part with one, to assist, τινι Eur.; absol., Aesch.
to bring upon oneself, πληγάς Dem.

div1.head: συναπωθέω
div1.sense: to push away together, Luc.

div1.head: συναραρίσκω
div1.sense: intr. in perf. συνάρηρα, to hang together, Hhymn.

div1.head: συναράσσω
div1.sense: to dash together, dash in pieces, shiver, shatter, Hom.; σ. οἶκον, πόλιν Eur.: —Pass. to be shattered, Od., Hdt.; συναράσσεσθαι κεφαλάς to have their heads dashed together, Hdt.

div1.head: συναρέσκω
div1.sense: to please or satisfy together, c. dat., Dem.
impers., like Lat. placet, συναρέσκει μοι I am content also, Xen.

div1.head: σύναρθρος
div1.sense: linked together with, Aesch.

div1.head: συναριθμέω
div1.sense: to reckon in, to take into the account, enumerate, Isae.; so in Mid., Aeschin.:—Pass. to be counted with others, to be taken into account, Arist.

div1.head: συναριστάω
div1.sense: to take breakfast or luncheon with, τινί Ar., Aeschin.

div1.head: συναριστεύω
div1.sense: to do brave deeds together, Eur.

div1.head: συναρκέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to acquiesce along with, τινι Theophr.

div1.head: συναρμόζω
div1.sense: in physical sense, to fit together, Thuc.; συναρμόζειν βλέφαρα to close them, Eur.:—Pass., λίθοι εὖ συνηρμοσμένοι Hdt.
to put together, so as to make a whole, σκάφος, ἵππον Eur.:—Pass., οὐ καλῶς συνηρμοσμένα Dem.
to combine in act or thought, Solon., Plat.
metaph. to adapt one thing to another, εὐχερείᾳ σ. βροτούς, i. e. to make them indifferent to crime, Aesch.:—Pass., πρὸς παρόντα συνηρμοσμένος Xen.
intr. to fit together, agree, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: συναρμολογέω
div1.sense: Pass. to be fitted or framed together, NTest.

div1.head: συναρμοστής
div1.sense: one who fits together, λίθων Luc.
a joint-governor, Luc.

div1.head: συναρπάζω
div1.sense: to seize and carry clean away, Trag., etc.:— Pass., Soph.
ξ. χεῖρας to seize and pin them together, Eur.
metaph., σ. φρενί to seize with the mind, grasp, Soph., Ar.

div1.head: συναρτάω
div1.sense: to knit or join together, Eur., Luc.:—Pass. to be closely engaged or entangled, Thuc.: to be attached to, combined with, τινί Arist.: to hang close on an enemyʼs rear, Plut.

div1.head: συναρχία
div1.sense: joint administration, Strab.
in pl., αἱ συναρχίαι, the collective magistracy, Arist.

div1.head: σύναρχος
div1.sense: a partner in office, colleague, Arist.

div1.head: συνάρχω
div1.sense: to rule jointly with, τινί Hdt.
absol. to be a colleague in office, Thuc.: ὁ συνάρχων a colleague, Thuc.

div1.head: συνασκέω
div1.sense: to join in practising, Isocr., Dem.

div1.head: συνασπιδόω
div1.sense: to keep the shields close together, stand in close order, Xen.

div1.head: συνασπίζω
div1.sense: to be a shield-fellow or comrade, Eur.
= συνασπιδόω, Luc.

div1.head: συνασπιστής
div1.sense: a shield-fellow, comrade, Soph.

div1.head: συνασχαλάω
div1.sense: to sympathise indignantly with a thing, c. dat., Aesch.

div1.head: συνασχολέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to do business with, τινι Plut.

div1.head: συνατιμάζω
div1.sense: Pass. to be disgraced with, τινι Plut.

div1.head: συναυαίνω
div1.sense: to dry quite up, Eur.:—Pass. to be dried up also, Plat.

div1.head: συναυδάω
div1.sense: to speak together: to agree, confess, allow, Soph.

div1.head: συναυλέω
div1.sense: to accompany on the flute, Luc.

div1.head: συναυλία
div1.sense: a concert of flutes, Ar.
metaph., δύσορνις ἅδε ξ. δορός this ill-omened concert of battle. of the single combat of the brothers, Aesch.
(from αὐλή) a dwelling together, Arist.

div1.head: συναυλίζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to congregate, Babr.

div1.head: σύναυλος
div1.sense: dwelling with, living in the folds with (sc. ταῖς ποίμναις) , Soph.: metaph., θείᾳ μανίᾳ ξ., i. e. afflicted with madness, Soph.

div1.head: συναυξάνω
div1.sense: to increase or enlarge along with or together, Xen.:—Pass. to increase or wax larger together with a thing, c. dat., Hdt., Eur.
to join or assist in increasing, Xen., Arist.

div1.head: σύναυλος
div1.sense: in concert with the flute: generally, sounding in unison, Ar.: generally, in harmony with, τινι Eur.

div1.head: συναύξησις
div1.sense: common growth, Polyb.

div1.head: συναφαιρέω
div1.sense: to take away together:—Mid. to assist in rescuing, Thuc.

div1.head: συναφανίζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to perish with, τινι Strab.

div1.head: συναφίστημι
div1.sense: to draw into revolt together, Thuc.:—Pass., Ionic συναπίσταμαι, with aor2 and perf. act., to fall off or revolt along with others, c. dat., or absol., Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: συνάχθομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to be grieved with or together, to condole with, τινι Hdt., Dem., etc.; c. dat. rei, at a thing, Xen.

div1.head: συνδαΐζω
div1.sense: to kill with the rest, kill also, Soph.

div1.head: συνδαίνυμι
div1.sense: to entertain together, σ. γάμους τινί to share a marriage feast with one, Eur.

div1.head: συνδαίτωρ
div1.sense: a companion at table, Aesch.

div1.head: συνδάκνω
div1.sense: to bite together, συνδ. τὸ στόμιον of a horse, to take the bit in his teeth, Xen.

div1.head: συνδακρύω
div1.sense: to weep with or together, Eur.
c. acc. to lament together, Plut.

div1.head: συνδανείζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to collect by borrowing, Plut.

div1.head: συνδειπνέω
div1.sense: to dine or sup with another, c. dat., Xen.; μετά τινων Dem.:—absol. to dine or sup with others, Xen., etc.; οἱ ξυνδειπνοῦντες the members of a picnic party, Xen.

div1.head: σύνδειπνον
div1.sense: a common meal or banquet, Lat. convivium, Plat.

div1.head: σύνδειπνος
div1.sense: a companion at table, Lat. conviva, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: συνδεκάζω
div1.sense: to bribe all together, Xen., Aeschin.

div1.head: σύνδενδρος
div1.sense: thickly-wooded, Babr.

div1.head: συνδέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to join in begging, τί τινος something of a person, Dem.

div1.head: σύνδεσμος
div1.sense: heterog. pl. σύνδεσμα, a bond of union, bond, fastening, Eur., Thuc.: metaph., good men are called ὁ ξ. τῆς πόλεως the bond that keeps the state together, Plat.
in Grammar, a conjunction, Arist.

div1.head: συνδεσμώτης
div1.sense: a fellow-prisoner, Thuc., Plat.

div1.head: σύνδετος
div1.sense: bound hand and foot, Soph.
as Subst. σύνδετον, ου, a band, Eur.

div1.head: συνδέω
div1.sense: to bind or tie together, of two or more things, συνέδησα πόδας Od.; τοὺς πόδας καὶ τὰς χεῖρας Plat.; δέλτον σ. to fasten up the tablets, Eur.:—Pass., ἰσχία μὴ συνδεδεμένα flanks not drawn up, of dogs, Xen.
of persons, to bind hand and foot, Il., Hdt., etc.
to bind up a wound, Il.
generally, to bind together, unite, Eur., Plat.
Mid., σύνδησαι πέπλους gird up thy robes, Eur.

div1.head: σύνδηλος
div1.sense: quite clear or manifest, Arist.

div1.head: συνδηλόω
div1.sense: to make altogether clear, Arist.

div1.head: συνδημαγωγέω
div1.sense: to join in seeking popularity, Plut.

div1.head: συνδιαβαίνω
div1.sense: to go through or cross over together, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: συνδιαβάλλω
div1.sense: to convey over together: absol., Lat. una trajicere, συνδ. τὸν κόλπον to cross the gulf together, Thuc.
to accuse along with, Dem.:—Pass. to be accused together, Thuc.

div1.head: συνδιαβιβάζω
div1.sense: to carry through or over together, Xen.

div1.head: συνδιαγιγνώσκω
div1.sense: to join with others in determining or decreeing, Thuc.

div1.head: συνδιάγω
div1.sense: to go through together: absol. (sc. τὸν βίον) to live together, Arist.

div1.head: συνδιαιτάομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to dwell with or together, Thuc., Isocr.

div1.head: συνδιαίτησις
div1.sense: a living together, intercourse, Plut.

div1.head: συνδιαιτητής
div1.sense: a joint arbitrator, Dem.
one who lives with another, a companion, Luc.

div1.head: συνδιακινδυνεύω
div1.sense: to share in danger, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: συνδιακομίζω
div1.sense: Mid.Pass. to cross over together, Plut.

div1.head: συνδιακοσμέω
div1.sense: to set in order together, Plat., Plut.

div1.head: συνδιάκτορος
div1.sense: a fellow -διάκτορος, i. e. a mate of Hermes, Luc.

div1.head: συνδιαλλάσσω
div1.sense: to help in reconciling, τινὰ πρός τινα Dem.

div1.head: συνδιαλύω
div1.sense: to help in putting an end to, Isocr.
to help in reconciling, Dem.
Mid. to help to pay, Luc.

div1.head: συνδιαμένω
div1.sense: to stand oneʼs ground with others, Xen.

div1.head: συνδιαμνημονεύω
div1.sense: to call to remembrance along with or together, Dem., Aeschin.

div1.head: συνδιανεύω
div1.sense: to turn every way together, Polyb.

div1.head: συνδιανοέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to deliberate with, τινι Polyb.

div1.head: συνδιαπλέω
div1.sense: to sail through together, Luc.

div1.head: συνδιαπολεμέω
div1.sense: to carry on a war along with, νῆες αἱ ξυνδιαπολεμήσασαι ships which remained with him throughout the war, Thuc.

div1.head: συνδιαπορέω
div1.sense: to start doubts or questions together, Plut.

div1.head: συνδιαπράσσω
div1.sense: to accomplish together, or besides, Isocr., Luc., etc.
Mid. to negotiate at the same time, Xen.

div1.head: συνδιασκοπέω
div1.sense: to look through or examine along with, τί τινι or μετά τινος Plat.:—so in pres. mid., Plat.

div1.head: συνδιαστρέφω
div1.sense: to distort together:—Pass. to be twisted together with, τινί Plut.

div1.head: συνδιασῴζω
div1.sense: to assist in preserving, Thuc., Dem.

div1.head: συνδιαταλαιπωρέω
div1.sense: to endure hardship with or together, Plat.

div1.head: συνδιατελέω
div1.sense: to continue with to the end, Plat.

div1.head: συνδιατηρέω
div1.sense: to assist in maintaining, Polyb.

div1.head: συνδιατρίβω
div1.sense: to pass or spend time with or together, Aeschin.
absol. (sub. βίον) to live constantly with, οἱ τῷ Σωκράτει συνδιατρίβοντες his disciples, Xen.
to occupy oneself with a thing, c. dat., Isocr.

div1.head: συνδιαφέρω
div1.sense: to bear along with one, Luc.
to bear to the end along with, help in maintaining, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: συνδιαφθείρω
div1.sense: Mid. Pass. to perish along with, τινι Isocr.

div1.head: συνδιαχειμάζω
div1.sense: to be in winter quarters along with or together, Plut.

div1.head: συνδιαχειρίζω
div1.sense: to assist in accomplishing, Hdt.

div1.head: συνδιεκπίπτω
div1.sense: to rush out through together, Plut.

div1.head: συνδιέξειμι
div1.sense: to go through together with, Xen.

div1.head: συνδιημερεύω
div1.sense: to spend the day with, τινί Xen.

div1.head: συνδικάζω
div1.sense: to be assessor to a judge, Lys.

div1.head: συνδικαστής
div1.sense: a fellow-dicast or juryman, Ar.

div1.head: συνδικέω
div1.sense: to act as oneʼs advocate, Aesch., Xen., etc.; σ. τινί Plat.; Ζεύς σοι τόδε συνδικήσει Zeus will be thy advocate herein, Eur.
to be one of the public advocates, Dem.

div1.head: σύνδικος
div1.sense: one who helps in a court of justice, an advocate, Lat. patronus, Aesch., Dem.
at Athens, the σύνδικοι were public advocates appointed to represent the state, Dem.
after the 30 Tyrants, the σύνδικοι were judges to determine disputes about confiscated property, Lys.
belonging jointly to, σ. Ἀπόλλωνος καὶ Μοισᾶν κτέανον their joint possession, Pind.:—adv. συνδίκως, with joint sentence, jointly, Aesch.

div1.head: συνδιοικέω
div1.sense: to administer together with another, c. dat., Dem.

div1.head: συνδιοράω
div1.sense: to examine together, Isocr.

div1.head: συνδιορίζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be determined also, Strab.

div1.head: συνδισκεύω
div1.sense: to play at quoits with, τινί Luc.

div1.head: συνδιώκω
div1.sense: to chase away together, join in the chase, Thuc.
as law-term, to join in the prosecution, Lex ap. Dem.

div1.head: συνδοκέω
div1.sense: to seem good also, ταῦτα κἀμοὶ συνδοκεῖ Ar.; ταῦτα ξυνέδοξε τοῖς ἄλλοις Thuc.:—absol., in answers, ξυνεδόκει ἡμῖν ταῦτα; were we agreed on these points? i. e. we were agreed, Plat.
impers. it seems good also, Eur., Ar., etc.:—so, absol., in part., συνδοκοῦν ἅπασιν ὑμῖν since you all agree, Xen.; συνδόξαν τῷ πατρί since the father approved, Xen.
so in perf. pass. part., λόγος τοῖς ἐπιεικεστάτοις συνδεδογμένος in which they also agree, Plat.

div1.head: συνδοκιμάζω
div1.sense: to examine together, Isocr.

div1.head: συνδοξάζω
div1.sense: to join in approving, Arist.
to agree with, τῷ σώματι Porph. in Stob.
Pass. to be glorified together, NTest.

div1.head: συνδουλεύω
div1.sense: to be a fellow-slave with, τινί Eur.

div1.head: σύνδουλος
div1.sense: a fellow-slave, Hdt., Eur., etc.: a special fem. συνδούλη in Babr.

div1.head: συνδράω
div1.sense: to do together, help in doing, Soph., Thuc.; σ. τί τινι Eur.; ξ. αἷμα καὶ φόνον to help in bloodshed and murder, Eur.; τὸ συνδρῶν χρέος the joint necessity, Eur.

div1.head: συνδρομάς
div1.sense: αἱ σ. πέτραι, συμπληγάδες, Eur.; σ. Κυάνεαι Theocr.

div1.head: συνδρομή
div1.sense: a tumultuous concourse of people, ap. Arist.
of things, ἡ σ. τοῦ λόγου its conclusion, moral, Anth.

div1.head: σύνδρομος
div1.sense: running together, meeting, σ. πέτραι, = συνδρομάδες, Pind.
as Subst. a place where several roads meet, Strab.
running along with, close-following, Anth.:—adv. συνδρόμως Aesch.

div1.head: συνδυάζω
div1.sense: to join two and two, couple, Arist.: —Pass. to be coupled with something else, Arist.
in Pass. to be coupled, to pair, Xen.

div1.head: συνδυασμός
div1.sense: a being taken two together, Arist.
a coupling, pairing, Arist.

div1.head: συνδυάς
div1.sense: paired, σ. ἄλοχος oneʼs wedded wife, Eur.

div1.head: συνδυαστικός
div1.sense: disposed to live in pairs, Arist.

div1.head: σύνδυο
div1.sense: two together, two and two, in pairs, Lat. bini, Hhymn., Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: συνδυστυχέω
div1.sense: to share in misfortune, Eur.

div1.head: συνδώδεκα
div1.sense: twelve in all, Eur.

div1.head: συνεγγίζω
div1.sense: to draw near together, Polyb.

div1.head: συνεγγισμός
div1.sense: a drawing near together, of constellations, Strab.

div1.head: συνεγγυάω
div1.sense: to join in betrothing, Plut.

div1.head: σύνεγγυς
div1.sense: of Place, near together, Thuc., etc.; σ. ἀλλήλων or ἀλλήλοις Arist.:— τὸ σ. nearness, proximity, Arist.
of Time, Arist.
of Quality, οἱ σ. persons of similar rank, Arist.; ἡ σ. αἰτία the proximate cause, Arist.

div1.head: συνεγείρω
div1.sense: to help in raising, NTest.:—Pass. to rise together, NTest.

div1.head: συνεδρεύω
div1.sense: to sit together, sit in council, Aeschin.; οἱ συνεδρεύοντες members of council, Dem.
to hold a council, deliberate, Dem.

div1.head: συνεδρία
div1.sense: a sitting together, a circle of friends, Xen.:— gregariousness, which in birds was a favourable omen, Aesch.
a council, Aeschin.

div1.head: συνέδριον
div1.sense: a body of men assembled in council, a council-board, council, Xen., etc.; of the Roman Senate, Polyb.; the Jewish Sanhedrim, NTest.:—esp. of a congress of Allies or Confederates, Hdt., Dem., etc.
a council-chamber, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: σύνεδρος
div1.sense: sitting with in council, of persons, Hdt.; ἐκ ξυνέδρου καὶ τυραννικοῦ κύκλου, ἐκ κύκλου τῶν συνεδρευόντων τυράννων, Soph.
as Subst. one who sits with others, a councillor, Soph.; σύνεδροι select commissioners, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: συνεείκοσι
div1.sense: twenty together, by twenties, Lat. viceni, Od.

div1.head: συνεθέλω
div1.sense: to have the same wish, to consent, Xen.: —in Poets συνθέλω, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: συνεθίζω
div1.sense: to accustom, σ. τινὰ ποιεῖν τι to accustom him to do . . , Dem., Aeschin.:—Pass. to become used or habituated, and in aor1 and perf. to have become so, be so, Thuc., Plat.; c. inf., συνειθίσθην ποιεῖν τι Xen.:—also impers., συνειθισμένον ἦν it had become the custom, Lys.

div1.head: συνεθιστέος
div1.sense: one must accustom oneself, Plat.

div1.head: συνείδησις
div1.sense: self-consciousness: conscience, NTest.

div1.head: συνειλέω
div1.sense: to crowd together, Hdt.; of things, to bind tight together, Hdt.:—Pass. to be crowded or pressed together, Xen., etc.

div1.head: σύνειμι
div1.sense: to be with, be joined or linked with a thing, c. dat., Od.; periphr. for a simple Verb, σ. ὀνείρασιν to dream, Aesch.; σ. νόσῳ νοσεῖν, Soph.; κακοῖς πολλοῖς ξ. to be acquainted with miseries, Soph.; σ. πράγμασι to be engaged in business, Ar.; σ. ἡδοναῖς, λύπαις, δείμασι Plat.;—reversely, ἐμοὶ ξύνεστιν ἐλπίς Eur.; and absol., ἆται ἀεὶ ξυνοῦσαι Soph.; ὁ χρόνος ξυνὼν μακρός Soph.
to have intercourse with a person, live with, τινι Soph., Eur., etc.; μετά τινος Ar.
to live with a husband, = συνοικέω, Hdt.
to attend, as to a pupil attends a master, Xen., etc.; of the teacher, Xen.:— οἱ συνόντες associates, disciples, partisans, Plat.
to have dealings with, τινι Thuc.; σ. ἵπποις to have to do with them, Plat.
to take part with, τινι Aesch., etc.

div1.head: σύνειμι
div1.sense: to go or come together, to assemble, Il., Hdt., Thuc.
in hostile sense, to meet in battle, Il., etc.: of states, to engage in war, Thuc.
in peaceable sense, to come together, meet to deliberate, Thuc.
of revenue, to come in, Hdt.

div1.head: συνεῖπον
div1.sense: to speak with any one, confirm what another says, Isocr.: to agree with, τινί Xen.
to advocate anotherʼs cause, Dem.; generally, to help, further, Isocr.
to help to tell, Eur.

div1.head: συνείρω
div1.sense: to string together, Lat. connectere, Ar., Plat.
to string words together, Dem., etc.: then, seemingly intr. (sub. λόγους) to speak on and on, go on without pausing, Xen.

div1.head: συνεισάγω
div1.sense: to bring in together, Xen.

div1.head: συνεισβαίνω
div1.sense: to embark in a ship with others, σ. πλοῖον ναύταισι Aesch.; σ. ταὐτὸν σκάφος Eur.

div1.head: συνεισβάλλω
div1.sense: intr. to make an inroad into a country together, join in an inroad, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: συνεισέρχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to enter along with or together, δόμους Eur.; ἐς οἴκους Eur., etc.

div1.head: συνεισπίπτω
div1.sense: to fall or be thrown into with others, Xen.
to rush in together, of soldiers pursuing the besieged to the gates and getting in with them, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: συνεισπλέω
div1.sense: to sail into together, Xen.

div1.head: συνεισπράσσω
div1.sense: to help one (τινί) in exacting money from another (τινά) , Dem.

div1.head: συνεισφέρω
div1.sense: to join in paying the war-tax (εἰσφορά) , Xen.

div1.head: συνεκβαίνω
div1.sense: to go out together, Xen.

div1.head: συνεκβάλλω
div1.sense: to cast out along with, τί τινι Hdt.
to assist in casting out or expelling, Xen.

div1.head: συνεκβιβάζω
div1.sense: to help in bringing out, Xen.

div1.head: συνεκδημέω
div1.sense: to be abroad with, τινί Plut.

div1.head: συνέκδημος
div1.sense: a fellow-traveller, NTest.

div1.head: συνεκδίδωμι

sense.trans: to give out or give up together

div1.sense: to help a poor man in portioning out his daughter, Dem.

div1.head: συνεκδύομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to put off at the same time, Hdt.

div1.head: συνεκθνῄσκω
div1.sense: to faint along with, σ. τῷ πώματι, i. e. to drink till wine and drinker fail together, Eur.

div1.head: συνεκκαίδεκα
div1.sense: sixteen together, by sixteens, Dem.

div1.head: συνεκκαίω
div1.sense: to set on fire together, Plut.

div1.head: συνεκκλέπτω
div1.sense: to help to steal away, Eur.; σ. γάμους to help in concealing the marriage, Eur.

div1.head: συνεκκλησιάζω
div1.sense: to frequent the ἐκκλησία together, Plut.

div1.head: συνεκκομίζω
div1.sense: to carry out along with, Plut.
to help in carrying out, help in achieving, Eur.; σ. τινὶ κακά to help one in bearing evils, Eur.

div1.head: συνεκκόπτω
div1.sense: to help to cut away, Xen.

div1.head: συνεκκρούομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be driven from oneʼs purpose together, Plut.

div1.head: συνεκλεκτός
div1.sense: chosen along with, τισί NTest.

div1.head: συνεκλύω
div1.sense: Pass. to be dissolved together, Anth.

div1.head: συνεκπέμπω
div1.sense: to send out together, Xen.

div1.head: συνεκπεράω
div1.sense: to come out together, Xen.

div1.head: συνεκπίνω
div1.sense: to drink off together, Xen.

div1.head: συνεκπίπτω
div1.sense: to rush out together with others, c. dat., Plut.
to be driven out or banished together, Plut.
to disappear together, Luc.

of voting tablets, to come out in agreement, to happen to agree, Hdt.; αἱ πλεῖσται γνῶμαι συνέπιπτον ναυσιμαχέειν agreed in advising to fight, Hdt.; then of persons, οἱ πολλοὶ σ. Θεμιστοκλέα κρίνοντες agreed in choosing, Hdt.
c. dat. to come out equal to another, run a dead heat with him, συνεξέπιπτε τῷ πρώτῳ Hdt.
to be thrown out together, to be rejected, Luc.

div1.head: συνεκπλέω
div1.sense: to sail out along with, τινί Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: συνεκπνέω
div1.sense: to breathe oneʼs last along with another, c. dat., Eur.

div1.head: συνεκπονέω
div1.sense: to help in working out, Eur.: to help in achieving or effecting, Eur.
without acc., σ. τινί to assist to the utmost, Eur.
to assist in supporting, συνεκπονοῦσα κῶλον Eur.

div1.head: συνεκπορίζω
div1.sense: to help in procuring or supplying, τί τινι Xen.

div1.head: συνεκποτέα
div1.sense: one must drink off at the same time, Ar.

div1.head: συνεκπράσσομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to assist in avenging, Hdt.

div1.head: συνεκσῴζω
div1.sense: to help in delivering, Soph.

div1.head: συνεκτάσσω
div1.sense: to arrange in line with, Xen.

div1.head: συνεκτέος
div1.sense: one must keep together, Xen.

div1.head: συνεκτίκτω
div1.sense: to bring forth together, Arist.

div1.head: συνεκτίνω
div1.sense: to pay along with or together, to help in paying, Dem.

div1.head: συνεκτραχύνομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be furious together, Plut.

div1.head: συνεκτρέφω
div1.sense: to rear up along with or together, Plat.:—Pass. to grow up with, τινί Eur.

div1.head: συνεκτρέχω
div1.sense: to sally out together, Xen.

div1.head: συνεκφέρω
div1.sense: to carry out together, esp. to burial, to attend a funeral, Thuc.

div1.head: συνεκχέω
div1.sense: to pour out together, Anth.

div1.head: συνελαύνω
div1.sense: to drive together, Il., Xen.; σὺν δʼ ἤλασʼ ὀδόντας gnashed his teeth together, Od.
to match in combat, set to fight, Hom.:—intr., ἔριδι ξυνελαυνέμεν to meet in quarrel, Il.

div1.head: συνελευθερόω
div1.sense: to join in freeing from another, c. gen., Hdt.:—absol. to join in freeing, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: συνελίσσω
div1.sense: to roll together:—Pass. to involve oneself in a thing, c. dat., Soph.
intr. to coil itself up, of a serpent, Eur.

div1.head: συνελκυστέος
div1.sense: one must draw together, Xen.

div1.head: συνέλκω
div1.sense: to draw together, to draw up, contract, Ar.
to draw out along with, to help to draw out, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: συνεμβαίνω
div1.sense: to embark together, τινί with one, Luc.

div1.head: συνεμβάλλω
div1.sense: to help in applying, Ar.
intr. to fall upon also, to join in attacking, Xen.; to make a joint inroad, Dem.

div1.head: συνεμβολή
div1.sense: a throwing in together, σ. κώπης the regular dip of all the oars together, to the sound of the κέλευσμα, Aesch.
a junction, fastening, Aesch.

div1.head: συνεμπίπρημι
div1.sense: to burn together, Eur.

div1.head: συνεμπίπτω
div1.sense: to fall in or upon together, Luc.
to fall on or attack together, Plut.

div1.head: συνέμπορος
div1.sense: a fellow-traveller, companion, attendant, Trag., Plat.:—metaph., λύπη δʼ ἄμισθος ἐστί σοι ξ. Aesch.; c. gen. rei, σ. χορείας partner in the dance, Ar.

div1.head: συνενδίδωμι
div1.sense: to give in together, Plut.

div1.head: συνενείκομαι
div1.sense: to strike or dash against a thing, c. dat., Hes.

div1.head: συνεξάγω
div1.sense: to lead out together, Hdt.: Pass. to be carried away together, Anth.

div1.head: συνεξαιρέω
div1.sense: to take out together, to help in removing, Hdt.:— Mid., Eur.: to take away also, Xen.
to help in taking, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: συνεξαίρω
div1.sense: to assist in raising: Pass., aor1 part. συνεξαρθείς being lifted up at once, Plut.; being excited at the same time, Luc.

div1.head: συνεξακολουθέω
div1.sense: to follow constantly, to attend everywhere, Polyb.

div1.head: συνεξακούω
div1.sense: to hear all together, Soph.

div1.head: συνεξαλείφω
div1.sense: to abolish together, Plut.

div1.head: συνεξαμαρτάνω
div1.sense: to have part in a fault, Thuc., etc.; τινί with one, Dem., etc.

div1.head: συνεξαμείβω
div1.sense: to remove together, Babr.

div1.head: συνεξανίστημι
div1.sense: to stir up together, Plut.
Pass., with aor2 and perf. act., to rise up at the same time, rise and come forth with, Plut.
to rise in rebellion, revolt together, Plut.

div1.head: συνεξαπατάω
div1.sense: to cheat together or also, Dem.

div1.head: συνέξειμι
div1.sense: to go out along with or together, Thuc.; c. dat., Xen.

div1.head: συνεξελαύνω
div1.sense: to drive out along with or together, Aesch.

div1.head: συνεξερύω
div1.sense: to draw out together, Anth.

div1.head: συνεξέρχομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to go or come out with, τινι Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: συνεξετάζω
div1.sense: to search out and examine along with or together, Plat.:—Pass., οἱ συνεξεταζόμενοι μετά τινος or τινι his party or adherents, Dem.

div1.head: συνεξευρίσκω
div1.sense: to assist in finding out, Eur., Isocr.

div1.head: συνεξημερόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be civilised together, Plut.

div1.head: συνεξιχνεύω
div1.sense: to trace out along with, τί τινι Plut.

div1.head: συνεξορμάω
div1.sense: to help to urge on, Isocr.
intr. to rush forth or sally out together, Xen.

div1.head: συνεξωθέω
div1.sense: to thrust out together, Strab.

div1.head: συνεοχμός
div1.sense: a joining, joint, Il.

div1.head: συνεπάγω
div1.sense: to lead together against, Thuc.
to join in bringing in a foreign force to aid, Thuc.

div1.head: συνεπαγωνίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to join in stirring up a contest besides, Polyb.

div1.head: συνεπᾴδω
div1.sense: to join in celebrating, Eur.

div1.head: συνεπαινέω
div1.sense: to approve, together, give joint assent, consent, Aesch., Xen.;—c. inf., σ. μάχεσθαι to join in the recommendation to fight, Thuc.;— σ. τι to consent or agree to, Thuc.
to join in praising, τινα Xen., Plat.

div1.head: συνέπαινος
div1.sense: joining in approbation of a thing, συν. εἶναι to give oneʼs consent to a thing, τινι or absol., Hdt.; c. acc. et inf. to consent that . . , Hdt.

div1.head: συνεπαίρω
div1.sense: to raise or lift at the same time, Xen.:—Pass. to be elevated together with, τινί Luc.
to urge on together or also, Xen.:— Pass. to rise together with others, c. dat., Plut.

div1.head: συνεπαιτιάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to accuse also of a thing, τινά τινος Thuc.

div1.head: συνεπαιωρέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to continue soaring over, Plut.

div1.head: συνεπακολουθέω
div1.sense: to follow closely, Plat.

div1.head: συνεπαμύνω
div1.sense: to join in repelling, τινά Thuc.

div1.head: συνεπανίσταμαι
div1.sense: [Act.to make to rise up against together]
Pass., with aor2 act., to join in a revolt, Hdt., Thuc.; τινι or ἅμα τινι Hdt.

div1.head: συνεπανορθόω
div1.sense: to join in reestablishing, Dem.

div1.head: συνέπειμι
div1.sense: to join in attacking, τινι Thuc.

div1.head: συνεπεισπίπτω
div1.sense: to rush in upon together, Plut.

div1.head: συνεπεισφέρω
div1.sense: Mid. to help to bring in, Xen.

div1.head: συνεπεκπίνω
div1.sense: to drink off together, Anth.

div1.head: συνεπελαφρύνω
div1.sense: to help to make light, i. e. to assist in bearing, Hdt.

div1.head: συνεπερείδω
div1.sense: to help in inflicting, πληγήν Plut.; σ. ὑπόνοιάν τινι to help to fix a suspicion on him, Plut.
c. acc. pers. to transfix, συνεπερείσας τῇ ῥύμῃ τοῦ ἵππου charging him with all the force of his horse, Plut.

div1.head: συνεπερίζω
div1.sense: to contend also with, τινί Anth.

div1.head: συνεπευθύνω
div1.sense: to help to direct or guide, τι Plut.

div1.head: συνεπεύχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to join in prayer, Thuc.; but c. inf. fut. to make a vow also to do a thing, Xen.

div1.head: συνεπηχέω
div1.sense: to join in a chant or chorus, Xen.
to resound with a thing, Luc.

div1.head: συνεπιβαίνω
div1.sense: to mount together, τοῦ τείχους on the wall, Plut.

div1.head: συνεπιβάλλω
div1.sense: to apply oneʼs mind also, to consider a thing together, Polyb.
to coincide with, καιροῖς Polyb.

div1.head: συνεπιβλάπτομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be damaged together with, τινι Arist.

div1.head: συνεπιβουλεύω
div1.sense: to join in plotting against another, Xen.

div1.head: συνεπιγραφεύς
div1.sense: a fellow-registrar, fellow-clerk, Isocr.

div1.head: συνεπιδείκνυμι
div1.sense: to point out together, Polyb.

div1.head: συνεπιθειάζω
div1.sense: to ascribe to divine interposition, Plut.

div1.head: συνεπιθυμέω
div1.sense: to desire along with, τινί τινος Xen.

div1.head: συνεπίκειμαι
div1.sense: Pass. to join in attacking, Ar.

div1.head: συνεπικλάω
div1.sense: to break down at once, Plut.

div1.head: συνεπικοσμέω
div1.sense: to help to adorn, Xen., Arist.

div1.head: συνεπικουρέω
div1.sense: to join as an ally, help to relieve, Xen.

div1.head: συνεπικουφίζω
div1.sense: to lighten at the same time, Plut.
to help in relieving, Plut.

div1.head: συνεπικραδαίνω
div1.sense: to move backwards and forwards together with, Xen.

div1.head: συνεπικρύπτω
div1.sense: to help to conceal, Plut.

div1.head: συνεπιλαμβάνω
div1.sense: Mid. to take part in together, have a share in, partake in, c. gen. rei, Hdt., Thuc.: σ. τινί τινος to take part with or assist one in a thing, Luc.; σ. τινι τοῦ φόβου to contribute towards increasing their fear, Thuc.
c. gen. pers. to take the part of, Plut.
Act. in same sense, λόγῳ καὶ ἔργῳ συνεπιλαμβάνειν τινί to take part with him in word and deed, Thuc.

div1.head: συνεπιμελέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to join in taking care of or attending to, τινος Thuc., Xen.; σ. τῆς στρατιᾶς to have joint charge of the army, Xen.; absol., Xen.

div1.head: συνεπιμελητής
div1.sense: a coadjutor, Xen.

div1.head: συνεπιρρέπω
div1.sense: to incline towards together, Plut.

div1.head: συνεπιρρώννυμι
div1.sense: to help to strengthen, Plut.

div1.head: συνεπισκοπέω
div1.sense: to examine together with, τί τινι Xen.

div1.head: συνεπισπάω
div1.sense: to draw on together, Plut.
Mid. to draw on along with one, esp. to ruin, Plat., Dem., etc.

div1.head: συνεπισπεύδω
div1.sense: to join in forcing onward, Xen.

div1.head: συνεπίσταμαι
div1.sense: Dep. to be privy to, Xen., Luc.

div1.head: συνεπιστατέω
div1.sense: to act as a common patron, Plat.

div1.head: συνεπιστέλλω
div1.sense: to send with or together, Luc.

div1.head: συνεπιστρατεύω
div1.sense: to join in making war, τινί with another, Thuc., Dem.

div1.head: συνεπιστρέφω
div1.sense: to turn at the same time, Plat.
to help to make attentive, Plut.

div1.head: συνεπισχύω
div1.sense: to join in supporting, Xen.

div1.head: συνεπιτείνω
div1.sense: to help to aggravate, Polyb.

div1.head: συνεπιτελέω
div1.sense: to help to accomplish, Plut.
to join in performing, παιᾶνα θεῷ Xen.

div1.head: συνεπιτίθημι
div1.sense: to help in putting on, Plut.
Mid. to join in attacking, τινι Thuc.; ξ. τῷ ἔργῳ το fall to the work together, Thuc.

div1.head: συνεπιτιμάω
div1.sense: to join in chiding, Plut.

div1.head: συνεπιτρίβω
div1.sense: to destroy at once, Xen.

div1.head: συνεπίτροπος
div1.sense: a joint guardian, Dem.

div1.head: συνεπιφέρω
div1.sense: to join in applying, Plut.

div1.head: συνεπιχειρέω
div1.sense: to attack together, Polyb.

div1.head: συνεπιψεύδομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to join in lying, Luc.

div1.head: συνεπιψηφίζω
div1.sense: to join in ratifying a law, Arist.

div1.head: συνέπομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to follow along with, follow closely, absol., Od., Thuc., etc.; c. dat., Hdt., etc.; οὔ σοι τῷ βίῳ ξυνέσπετο (thy fortunes) remained not constant to thy life, Soph.
σ. τῷ λόγῳ to follow the argument to its consequences, Plat.: —absol., ξυνέπομαι I follow, i. e. understand, Plat.

div1.head: συνεπόμνυμι
div1.sense: to swear besides, Xen.

div1.head: συνερανίζω
div1.sense: to join in contributing, to collect, Luc.:—Mid. to receive contributions, Plut.

div1.head: συνεραστής
div1.sense: a joint lover, Xen.

div1.head: συνεράω
div1.sense: to pour together, gather together, συνερᾶσαι τοὺς λόγους Isocr.

div1.head: συνεράω
div1.sense: to love together with, τινί Eur.; so in Epic mid. inf. συνέρασθαι, Bion.

div1.head: συνεργάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to work with, cooperate, Soph.; σ. πρός τι to contribute towards or to a thing, Xen.
aor1 -ειργάσθην, perf. -είργασμαι in pass. sense, λίθοι ξυνειργασμένοι stones wrought so as to fit together, i. e. in ashlar-work, Thuc.; συνειργάσθη ἔργον it was wrought, Anth.

div1.head: συνεργάτης
div1.sense: a fellow-workman, helpmate, coadjutor, Soph., Eur.; c. gen. an accomplice or assistant in a thing, Eur.

div1.head: συνεργέω
div1.sense: to work together with, help in work, cooperate, Eur., Xen., etc.;— generally, to cooperate with, assist, τινί Dem.

div1.head: συνέργημα
div1.sense: assistance, support, Polyb.

div1.head: συνεργία
div1.sense: joint working, cooperation, Arist.; in bad sense, conspiracy, collusion, Dem.

div1.head: συνεργός
div1.sense: working together, joining or helping in work, and as Subst. a fellow-workman, helpmate, coadjutor, accomplice, Eur., Thuc., etc.; c. dat. pers., Eur., Thuc.:—c. gen. rei, σ. τείχεος helping to make it, Pind.; σ. ἀδίκων ἔργων, ἀρετᾶς helping towards them, Eur.; σ. τινί τινος helping a person in a thing, Xen.; εἴς or πρός τι Xen.
of the same trade as another, a fellow-workman, colleague, Dem.

div1.head: συνέργω
div1.sense: to shut up or enclose together, Hom., Soph.
to fasten together, Od.:— to unite, Plat.

div1.head: συνέρδω
div1.sense: to join in a work, help, τινί Soph.

div1.head: συνερείδω
div1.sense: to set firmly together, Od.: to bind together, bind fast, Eur.:—Pass., συνερεισθεὶς χέρας δεσμοῖς with oneʼs hands tight bound, Eur.
σ. τὸν λογισμόν to reason closely, Plut.
intr. to meet in close conflict, Plut.

div1.head: συνερέω
div1.sense: to speak with or together, advocate, support in a speech, c. dat., Xen., Dem.

div1.head: συνέριθος
div1.sense: a helpmate, Od., Ar.; σ. τέχναι assistant arts, Plat.; σ. ἄτρακτος Anth.

div1.head: συνερκτικός
div1.sense: of a speaker, driving his opponent into a corner, cogent, Ar.

div1.head: σύνερξις
div1.sense: close union, wedlock, Plat.

div1.head: συνέρχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. with aor2 and perf. act.:— to go together or in company, Il.
to come together, assemble, Hdt., Eur., etc.; σ. ἐς τωὐτό Hdt.; σ. ἐς λόγους τινί Hdt.; simply, σ. τινι to have dealings or intercourse with, Soph.
in hostile sense, to meet in battle, Hdt.; also of the battle, μάχη ὑπό τινων ξυνελθοῦσα engaged in, contested by them, Thuc.
to come together, be bonded together, Eur., Plat.: to form a league, Dem.
c. acc. cogn., ταύτην τὴν στρατείαν ξυνῆλθον joined in this expedition, Thuc.; so, τὸ σὸν λέχος ξυνῆλθον shared thy bed, Soph.
of things, to be joined in one, Soph., Eur.; of numbers, to make up a sum, Hdt.
of events, to concur, happen together, Hdt.

div1.head: συνερωτάω
div1.sense: to ask with or at the same time, Luc.
to establish a point by means of question and answer, Luc.

div1.head: σύνεσις
div1.sense: (εἶμι ibo) a coming together, union, ξύνεσις δύω ποταμῶν Od.
(συνίημι) quick comprehension, mother-wit, intelligence, sagacity, Thuc.; of animals, Plat.
c. gen. rei, intelligence in a thing, sagacity in respect to it, Plat.; περί τινος Thuc.
conscience, = συνείδησις, Eur.
a branch of art or science, Arist.

div1.head: συνεστέος
div1.sense: one must associate with, τινί Plat.

div1.head: συνεστηκότως
div1.sense: steadfastly, gravely, Arist.

div1.head: συνεστιάω
div1.sense: to entertain in oneʼs house, Anth.:—Pass. to feast along with or together, Dem.

div1.head: συνέστιος
div1.sense: sharing oneʼs hearth or house, a fellow-lodger, guest, Lat. contubernalis, Soph., Eur.; —ξυνέστιοι πόλεος his fellow- citizens, Aesch.:—c. dat. pers., σ. σοι καὶ ὁμοτράπεζος Plat.; c. dat. rei, ξ. ἐμοὶ θοίνῃ associates with me in the feast, Eur.
of Zeus, guardian of the hearth, Aesch.

div1.head: συνεστραμμένως
div1.sense: in a close packed manner, tersely, Arist.

div1.head: συνεστώ
div1.sense: a party, banquet, Hdt.

div1.head: συνέταιρος
div1.sense: a companion, partner, comrade, Hdt.

div1.head: συνετός
div1.sense: intelligent, sagacious, wise, Lat. prudens, Hdt., Pind., etc.; τὸ συνετόν σύνεσις, Eur., Thuc.:—c. gen. rei, intelligent in a thing, ξυνετὸς πολέμου Eur.; also c. acc., τὰ οἰκτρὰ ξ. Eur.
pass. intelligible, Theogn., Hdt., etc; act. and pass. senses conjoined, εὐξύνετος ξυνετοῖσι βοά Eur.
adv. -τῶς, intelligently, Eur.
intelligibly, Plut.

div1.head: συνευδαιμονέω
div1.sense: to share in happiness, Xen.

div1.head: συνευδοκέω
div1.sense: to consent to a thing, c. dat., NTest.
to sympathise with, τινί NTest.

div1.head: συνεύδω
div1.sense: to sleep with, Hdt., Soph.
τοῦ ξυνεύδοντος χρόνου in the time coincident with sleep, Aesch.

div1.head: συνευημερέω
div1.sense: to enjoy the day or be happy together, Plut.

div1.head: συνευνάζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to lie with, Pind., Soph.

div1.head: συνευνέτης
div1.sense: a bed-fellow, husband, consort, Eur.

div1.head: συνευνέτις
div1.sense: a wife or concubine, Eur.

div1.head: σύνευνος
div1.sense: a consort, Pind., Trag.

div1.head: συνευπάσχω
div1.sense: to derive profit together, Dem.

div1.head: συνευπορέω
div1.sense: to help to contribute, Dem.
c. gen. rei, to assist by contributing towards, Dem.
to help in contriving, Plut.

div1.head: συνευτυχέω
div1.sense: to be fortunate together, Eur.

div1.head: συνεύχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to pray with or together, Eur.; ταὐτὰ δὴ ξ. I join in the same prayer, Eur.

div1.head: συνευωχέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to fare sumptuously or feast together, τινι with one, Luc.

div1.head: συνεφάπτομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:
c. gen. rei, to take part in, ἔργου Pind.; τοὺς συνεφαπτομένους those who take part in [the war], Aeschin.
c. gen. pers. to join one in attacking, Hdt.

div1.head: συνεφεδρεύω
div1.sense: to wait to fight the conqueror, Polyb.:— σ. τινί to watch closely, Polyb.

div1.head: συνεφέλκω
div1.sense: to draw after or along with one together, Plat.

div1.head: συνεφέπομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to follow together, Hdt.; τινι with one, Xen.

div1.head: συνέφηβος
div1.sense: at the age of youth together, a young comrade, Aeschin.

div1.head: συνεφίστημι
div1.sense: to set on the watch together, make attentive, Polyb.:—then (sub. τὸν νοῦν) , to attend to, observe along with, Polyb.
Pass. συνεφίσταμαι, with aor2 act. to stand over, superintend along with or together, Thuc.
to rise up together, κατά τινος against one, NTest.

div1.head: συνέχεια
div1.sense: continuity, Arist.
connexion or sequence of words or arguments, Luc.
continued attention, perseverance, Dem.

div1.head: συνεχής
div1.sense: holding together:
of space, continuous, contiguous, Thuc., Plat.:—c. dat. continuous with or contiguous to, in a line with, Hdt., Eur.
of Time, continuous, unintermitting, Xen.; τὸ ξυνεχές συνέχεια, Thuc.
of persons, constant, persevering, Xen.
adv. σῠνεχῶς, Ionic -έως:
of Time, continually, Hes.; Sup. -έστατα Xen.
with Numbers, continuously, Ar., Thuc.
in Epic συνεχές as adv., Il.; συνεχὲς αἰεί unceasing ever, Od.
div1.etym: σῡνεχές Hom., and σῡνεχέως Hes., the first syll. being lengthd.

div1.head: συνεχθαίρω
div1.sense: to join in hating, Anth.

div1.head: συνέχω
div1.etym: fut. mid. in pass. sense, Dem.
div1.sense: to hold or keep together, Il.: to enclose, encompass, embrace, Hes., Plat.

to keep together, keep from dispersing, of soldiers, Xen., Dem.: —then, σ. πόλιν to keep the state together, keep it from falling to pieces, Eur.; καὶ θεοὺς καὶ ἀνθρώπους ἡ κοινωνία ξ. Plat.; σ. τὴν πολιτείαν Dem.; so, ξ.τὴν εἰρεσίαν to keep the rowers together, make them pull in time, Thuc.
to constrain or force one to a thing, NTest.
to compress, oppress, NTest.: Pass. to be constrained, oppressed, afflicted, Hdt., Attic
intr. to meet, εἰς ἕν Arist.

div1.head: συνηβολέω
div1.sense: to fall in with, c. dat., Babr.

div1.head: σύνηβος
div1.sense: a young friend, Eur.

div1.head: συνηγορέω
div1.sense: to be an advocate, σ. τινί to be his advocate, plead his cause, Ar., Aeschin.; also σ. ὑπέρ τινος Dem.; περί τινος Arist.
σ. τῷ κατηγόρῳ to second the accuser, Soph.

div1.head: συνηγορία
div1.sense: advocacy of anotherʼs cause, a speech in his behalf, Aeschin.

div1.head: συνηγορικός
div1.sense: of or for a συνήγορος:—τὸ συνηγορικόν the advocateʼs fee, being a drachma per diem paid to the public συνήγοροι, Ar.

div1.head: συνήγορος
div1.sense: speaking with, of the same tenor with, Soph.
as Subst. one who speaks with another, an advocate, Aesch.:—at Athens the συνήγοροι were of two kinds,
public advocates, ten being appointed annually to represent the state, Ar., Dem., etc.
private advocates, counsel, who were not allowed to take a fee, Dem.

div1.head: συνήδομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to rejoice together, Plat., Xen., etc.: —s. tini to rejoice with, sympathise with, Hdt., Attic
c. dat. rei, to rejoice at a thing, be pleased, gratified, Arist.; ἐπί τινι Xen.
c. dat. pers. et rei, Soph.

div1.head: συνηδύνω
div1.sense: to make pleasant to the taste:— generally, to help in cheering, Arist.

div1.head: συνήθεια
div1.sense: habitual intercourse, acquaintance, society, intimacy, Lat. consuetudo, Aeschin., etc.
habit, custom, habituation, Hhymn., Plat.: c. gen., ἔργου habituation to a thing, Dem.
the customary use of a phrase, Aeschin.

div1.head: συνήθης
div1.sense: dwelling or living together, accustomed or used to each other, Hes.: like each other in habits, Thuc., Plat.:— σ. τινί intimate with one, Plat.
habituated, accustomed, τινί to a thing, Plat.
of things, habitual, customary, usual, ordinary, Soph., Thuc.; τὸ ξύνηθες ἥσυχον your habitual quietness, Thuc.; τὸ σύνηθες custom, Xen.
adv. -θως, habitually, as is usual, Aeschin.

div1.head: συνήκω
div1.sense: to have come together, to be assembled, to meet, Thuc.
σ. εἰς ἕν to meet in a point, Xen.

div1.head: συνῆλιξ
div1.sense: of like or equal age, Lat. aequalis, a playmate, comrade, Aesch., Anth.

div1.head: συνηλυσίη
div1.etym: from same root as ἤλυθον, aor2 of ἔρχομαι
div1.sense: a meeting, assembly, Anth.

div1.head: συνημερευτής
div1.sense: a daily companion, Arist.

div1.head: συνημερεύω
div1.sense: to pass the day together or with, τινί Xen., etc.

div1.head: συνημοσύνη
div1.sense: used in pl., like συνθῆκαι, agreements, covenants, solemn promises, Il.

div1.head: συνήορος
div1.note: συνήορος, Doric and Attic συνάορος, ον,
div1.sense: linked with, accompanying, c. dat., Od., Pind.
absol. joined in wedlock, and as Subst. a consort, Eur.

div1.head: συνηρετέω
div1.sense: to assist in rowing: generally, to assist, befriend, τινί Soph.

div1.head: συνηρεφής
div1.sense: thickly covered, Hdt., Plut.:— metaph., ξυνηρεφὲς πρόσωπον her clouded face, Eur.

div1.head: συνησσάομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be conquered together, Xen.

div1.head: συνηχέω
div1.sense: to sound together or in unison, Plut.
to ring with, echo to, c. dat., Theophr.

div1.head: συνθακέω
div1.sense: to sit with, σ. νυκτί to take counsel with the night, Eur.

div1.head: σύνθακος
div1.sense: sitting with or together with, Ζηνὶ σύνθακος θρόνων partner with Zeus of his throne, Soph.:— generally, a partner, Eur.

div1.head: συνθάλπω
div1.sense: to warm together:—metaph. to warm or soothe by flattery besides, Aesch.

div1.head: συνθάπτω
div1.sense: to bury together, join in burying, Aesch., Trag., Plat., etc.; τινά τινι one with another, Eur.:—Pass. to be buried with, τινί Hdt., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: συνθεάομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to view together, of spectators at games, Plat., Xen.
to examine together, Xen.

div1.head: συνθεατής
div1.sense: a fellow-spectator, Plat.

div1.head: συνθερίζω
div1.sense: to reap together, Ar.

div1.head: συνθεσία
div1.sense: mostly in pl., like συνθῆκαι, a covenant, treaty, Il.; Epic gen. pl. συνθεσιάων Il.

div1.head: σύνθεσις
div1.sense: a putting together, composition, combination, Plat.; γραμμάτων συνθέσεις, i. e. syllables and words, Aesch.:—also, of an authorʼs composition, Isocr.
metaph., like συνθεσία, an agreement, treaty, Pind., Plut.
Lat. synthesis was a suit of clothes, Mart.; esp. a loose gown, worn at dinner-parties, Mart.

div1.head: συνθετέος
div1.sense: one must compound, Plat.

div1.head: συνθετικός
div1.sense: skilled in putting together, constructive, Plat., Luc.

div1.head: σύνθετος
div1.sense: put together, composite, compound, Plat., Xen.: complex, Arist.
put together, fictitious, Aesch.
metaph. agreed upon, ἐκ συνθέτου by agreement, Lat. ex composito, Hdt.

div1.head: συνθέω
div1.sense: to run together with: metaph., οὐχ ἡμῖν συνθεύσεται ἥδε γε βουλή this counsel will not run smoothly, will not succeed, for us, Od.
to run together, meet in one point, Xen.

div1.head: συνθεωρέω
div1.sense: to act as θεωρός or go to a festival together, Lys.; τινί with one, Ar.

div1.head: συνθήκη
div1.sense: a composition, of words and sentences, Luc.
a conventional agreement, convention, compact, Plat., Arist.; ἐκ συνθήκης, ex composito, by agreement, Plat.; κατὰ συνθήκην conventionally, Arist.

the article of a compact or treaty, Thuc.:—mostly in pl. the articles of agreement, and collectively, a contract, compact, covenant, treaty, Hdt., Attic; συνθήκας ποιέεσθαί τινι Hdt., Ar.; ἐκ τῶν συνθηκῶν according to the covenant, Isocr.; κατὰ τὰς σ. Thuc.

div1.head: σύνθημα
div1.sense: anything agreed upon, a preconcerted signal, Hdt., Thuc.; so, δέλτον ἐγγεγραμμένην ξυνθήματα having symbols inscribed upon it, Soph.
a watchword, Hdt., Thuc., etc.; σ. παρέρχεται the word is passed round, Xen.; σ. παραδιδόναι, παραγγέλλειν to pass it, Xen.
any token or sign, Soph.
= συνθῆκαι, an agreement, covenant, Plat.; σ. ποιεῖσθαι Xen.; ἀπὸ συνθήματος by agreement, Lat. ex composito, Hdt., Thuc.; so, ἐκ σ. Hdt.

div1.head: συνθηρατής
div1.sense: one who joins in quest of, τινός Xen.

div1.head: συνθηράω
div1.sense: to hunt together, join in the chase, Xen.; τινί with one, Xen.
to catch or find together, in Mid., Soph.:—Pass., χεῖρες συνθηρώμεναι hands caught and bound together, Soph.

div1.head: σύνθηρος
div1.sense: hunting with, τινι Xen.: absol. hunting in company, Anth.
c. gen. joining in quest of, Xen.

div1.head: συνθιασώτης
div1.sense: a partner in the θίασος: generally, a fellow, comrade, Ar.

div1.head: συνθλάω
div1.sense: to crush together:—Pass. to be broken in pieces, NTest.

div1.head: συνθλίβω
div1.sense: to press together, compress, Arist.

div1.head: συνθνῄσκω
div1.sense: to die with or together, Aesch., Soph., etc.; c. dat., θανόντι συνθανεῖν Soph.:—of things, συνθνήσκουσα σποδός embers expiring with (the flames), Aesch.; ἡ γὰρ εὐσέβεια σ. βροτοῖς accompanies them even in death, Soph.

div1.head: συνθοινάτωρ
div1.sense: a partaker in a feast, Eur.

div1.head: συνθρανόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be broken in pieces, shivered, Eur.

div1.head: συνθραύω
div1.sense: to break in pieces, shiver, Eur.

div1.head: σύνθρηνος
div1.sense: mourning with, τινι Anth.: a partner in mourning, Arist.

div1.head: συνθριαμβεύω
div1.sense: to share in a triumph, Plut.

div1.head: σύνθρονος
div1.sense: enthroned with, τινι Anth.

div1.head: σύνθροος
div1.sense: sounding together with, accompanying, c. dat., Anth.

div1.head: συνθρύπτω
div1.sense: to break in pieces: to crush, NTest.

div1.head: συνθύω
div1.sense: to offer sacrifice together, join in sacrifice, Aeschin.; τινί with one, Eur.

div1.head: συνιερεύς
div1.sense: a fellow-priest, Plut.

div1.head: συνιζάνω
div1.sense: to sink in, collapse, Theocr., Plut.
to sink, of the wind, Luc.

div1.head: συνίζησις
div1.sense: a settlement, collapse, Plut.

div1.head: συνίζω
div1.sense: to sit together, to hold a sitting, Hdt.

div1.head: συνίημι
div1.sense: to bring or set together, in hostile sense, like Lat. committere, ἔριδι ξυνέηκε μάχεσθαι Il.
Mid. to come together, come to an agreement, Il.
metaph. to perceive, hear, c. acc. rei, Hom., etc.; c. gen. pers., Il.; rarely c. gen. rei, Il.
to understand, ξ. ἀλλήλων to understand one anotherʼs language, Hdt.; mostly c. acc. rei, Hdt., Attic:—absol., τοῖς ξυνιεῖσι to the intelligent, Theogn.

div1.head: συνικνέομαι
div1.sense: to pertain to, interest, Arist.

div1.head: συνίππαρχος
div1.sense: a joint commander of horse, Hdt.

div1.head: συνιππεύς
div1.sense: a comrade in cavalry service, Dem.

div1.head: συνίστημι
div1.sense: to set together, combine, associate, unite, band together, Hdt., Thuc.; μαντικὴν ἑαυτῷ συστῆσαι to bring prophetic art into union with himself, i. e. to win, acquire it, Hdt.
to put together, organise, frame, Thuc., Dem.:— to contrive, σ. θάνατον ἐπί τινι Hdt.; σ. τιμάς to settle prices, Dem.; so in aor1 mid., Isocr.
to bring together as friends, introduce or recommend one to another, τινά τινι Plat., etc.: Pass., συνεστάθη Κύρῳ Xen.
of a debtor, to offer another as a guarantee, τινά τινι Isocr.
Pass., with aor2 act. συνεστάθη Κύρῳ Xen.
of part. συνεστηκώς, contr. συνεστώς, ῶσα, ώς or ός, Ionic συνεστεώς, εῶσα, εώς· also fut. mid. συστήσομαι:— to stand together, Hdt., Xen.; of soldiers, to form in order of battle, Xen.

in hostile sense, πολέμοιο συνεσταότος when battle is joined, Il.:—so, of persons, συνίστασθαί τινι to meet him in fight, be engaged with, Hdt., Attic:—absol., συνεστηκότων τῶν στρατηγῶν when the generals were at issue, Hdt.
to be involved in a thing, λιμῷ καὶ καμάτῳ Hdt.; συνεστῶτες ἀγῶνι Thuc.
to form a league or union, Thuc.; τὸ ξυνιστάμενον the conspirators, Ar.; so, οἱ ξυνεστῶτες, τὸ συνεστηκός Thuc., Aeschin.
generally, to be connected or allied, as by marriage, c. acc. cogn., λέχος Ἡρακλεῖ ξυστᾶσα Soph.
to be put together, organised, framed, Xen.
to arise, become, take place, Dem.
to hold together, endure, continue, Hdt.: in military sense, ξυνεστὼς στρατός a well-disciplined army, Eur.; στράτευμα συνεστηκός a standing army, Dem.
to be compact, solid, firm, Xen.
to be contracted, ξυνεστὸς φρενῶν σύστασις B. II. 2, Eur.

div1.head: συνίστωρ
div1.sense: knowing along with another, conscious, ὡς θεοὶ ξυνίστορες as the gods are witnesses, Soph., etc.
c. acc. (with the verbal constr.), πολλὰ συνίστορα κακά conscious of many evils, Aesch.

div1.head: συνισχναίνω
div1.sense: to help to dry up:—metaph. to join with in reducing, Eur.

div1.head: συνισχυρίζω
div1.sense: to help to strengthen, Xen.

div1.head: συνίσχω
div1.sense: to be afflicted, Plat.

div1.head: συνναίω
div1.sense: to dwell with others, c. dat., Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: συννάσσω
div1.sense: to pack tight together, Hdt.

div1.head: συνναυβάτης
div1.sense: a shipmate, Soph.

div1.head: συνναυμαχέω
div1.sense: to engage in a sea-fight along with others, c. dat., Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: συνναύτης
div1.sense: a shipmate, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: συννέμω
div1.sense: to tend together, of the shepherd: generally, to make oneʼs associate, Plut.

div1.head: συννεύω
div1.sense: to incline to a point, converge, Plut.
to consent, agree, Soph.

div1.head: συννέφελος
div1.sense: cloudy, overcast, Thuc.

div0.div1: συννέφω perf. -νένοφα to collect clouds, Ar.:—impers. συννέφει it is cloudy (cf. ὕει) , Arist. metaph. of persons, συννέφουσα ὄμματα wearing a clouded look, Eur. from συννεφής[older edd. print -έω forms, see LSJ]

div1.head: συννεφής
div1.sense: clouded over, cloudy:—of persons, gloomy, Eur.

div1.head: συννέω
div1.sense: to pile or heap together, heap up, Hdt.:—Pass., perf. part. ξυννενημένος Thuc.; Ionic 3rd pl. perf. pass. συννενέαται Hdt.

div1.head: συννέω
div1.sense: to swim together or with, Luc.

div1.head: συννήχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to swim with, τινι Luc.

div1.head: συννικάω
div1.sense: to have part in a victory with, τινί Eur.

div1.head: συννοέω
div1.sense: to meditate or reflect upon a thing, Soph., Plat.:—so in Mid., Eur.
to perceive by thinking, comprehend, understand, Plat., etc.:— so in Mid., Ar.

div1.head: σύννοια
div1.sense: meditation, deep thought, Soph., etc.; συννοίῃ ἐχόμενος wrapt in thought, Hdt.
anxious thought, anxiety, Aesch., Eur.; συννοίᾳ οἷον δέδρακε by remorse for the deed, Eur.

div1.head: σύννομος
div1.sense: feeding together, gregarious, Ar., etc.: metaph., ἄταισι σύννομοι associated with miseries, Aesch.
σ. τινί τινος partner with one in a thing, λέκτρων ξύννομε partner of the bed, Aesch.: metaph., θαλάσσης σύννομοι πέτραι, of the Symplegades which lie between two seas, Eur.
absol. as Subst., σύννομος, a partner, mate, of soldiers, Aesch., Soph.; of a wife, Soph.

div1.head: σύννοος
div1.sense: in deep thought, thoughtful, Isocr.
thoughtful, circumspect, Arist.

div1.head: συννοσέω
div1.sense: to be sick or ill together, Eur.; τινί with one, Eur.

div1.head: συννυμφοκόμος
div1.sense: helping to deck a bride, Eur.

div1.head: συνοδεύω
div1.sense: to travel in company, Plut.
