div1.head: συνοδία
div1.sense: a journey in company, Cic.
a party of travellers, caravan, Strab., NTest.

div1.head: συνοδίτης
div1.sense: the member of a σύνοδος, Anth.

div1.head: συνοδοιπορέω
div1.sense: to travel together, τινί with one, Luc.

div1.head: συνοδοιπορία
div1.sense: a travelling together, Babr.

div1.head: συνοδοιπόρος
div1.sense: a fellow-traveller, Xen., Luc.

div1.head: σύνοδος2
div1.sense: an assembly, meeting, Hdt., Attic; ξύνοδοι political unions, Ar., Thuc.
a national meeting, like πανήγυρις, Thuc., Arist.
in hostile sense, a meeting of two armies, Ar., Thuc., etc.
of things, a coming together, in-coming, χρημάτων σύνοδοι Hdt.
a meeting, junction, κυάνεαι σύνοδοι θαλάσσης, of the straits of the Hellespont, Eur.; ἡ ξ. τοῦ πλησίον ἀλλήλων τεθῆναι the junction resulting from approximation, Plat.

div1.head: σύνοιδα
div1.etym: perf. with pres. sense, there being no pres. συνείδω
div1.sense: to share in knowledge, be cognisant of a thing, be privy to it, Lat. conscius esse, Hdt., Attic
ἑαυτῷ συνειδέναι τι to be conscious of a thing, Ar., Plat., etc.:—with part., which may be
in nom., ξ. ἐμαυτῷ οὐδʼ ὁτιοῦν σοφὸς ὤν Plat.; without the reflex. Pron. to be conscious that, ξύνοισθά γʼ εἰς ἔμʼ οὐκ εὔορκος ὤν Eur.
in dat., ξ. ἐμαυτῷ οὐδὲν ἐπισταμένῳ I am conscious that I know nothing, Plat.
in acc., ξύνοιδʼ Ὀρέστην σε ἐκπαγλουμένην I know well that thou admirest him, Aesch.
absol. ξυνειδώς, an accomplice, ξ. τις Thuc.; also, ὁ ξ. τινι Thuc.
neut. τὸ συνειδός συνείδησις, joint knowledge, consciousness, Dem.

div1.head: συνοικειόω
div1.sense: to bind together as friends or kinsmen, to associate or combine with, τινά τινι Plut., etc.: Pass. to be closely united, Arist.

div1.head: συνοικέω
div1.sense: to dwell together, Plat., etc.; σ. τινί to live with, Aesch., etc.
to live together in wedlock, cohabit, Hdt., Eur., etc.; τούτων συνοικησάντων γίνεται Κλεισθένης from their marriage sprang Cleisthenes, Hdt.
metaph., ἄχθος ᾧ ξυνοικεῖ the grief with which he is associated, Soph.; so, σ. φόβῳ Eur.; ἡδοναῖς, ἀμαθίᾳ Plat.; ἱππικοῖς ἐν ἤθεσι ξ. being versed in the ways of horses, Eur.
reversely, with the thing as subject, γῆρας ἵνα πάντα κακὰ κακῶν ξυνοικεῖ old age with which all evils are associated, Soph.; of the poisoned robe of Hercules, to cling closely, Soph.
c. acc. loci, to colonise jointly with, Κυρηναίοισι σ. Λιβύην Hdt.:—Pass., of a country, to be thickly peopled, Xen.

div1.head: συνοίκημα
div1.sense: that with which one lives, a housefellow, Hdt.

div1.head: συνοίκησις
div1.sense: cohabitation, πωλέεσθαι ἐπὶ συνοικήσι (Ionic for -ήσει) , Hdt.

div1.head: συνοικήτωρ
div1.sense: a house-fellow, Aesch.

div1.head: συνοικία
div1.sense: = συνοίκησις, Παλλάδος δέξομαι ξυνοικίαν will accept the offer of living with her, Aesch.
a body of people living together, a settlement, community, Plat.
a house in which several families live, a house divided into flats, Lat. insula, opp. to οἰκία (a dwelling occupied by one family), Thuc., Xen., etc.
a back-room, outhouse, Ar.

div1.head: συνοικίζω
div1.sense: to make to live with, Isocr.; σ. τινὶ τὴν θυγατέρα to give him oneʼs daughter in marriage, Hdt.

to combine in one city, unite under a capital or metropolis, ξ. πάντας (sc. ἐς τὰς Ἀθήνας) Thuc.:—Pass., ξυνοικισθείσης πόλεως the city having been regularly formed, opp. to κατὰ κώμας οἰκίζεσθαι, Thuc.
to join in peopling or colonising a country, Eur., Thuc.
generally to unite, associate, Plut.

div1.head: συνοίκια
div1.sense: (only in Petron. as synoecium) a joint lodging: pl. συνοίκια (sc. ἱερά), τά, a public feast in memory of Theseusʼ uniting all Attica under Athens, celebrated on the 17th Boedromion, Thuc.

div1.head: συνοίκισις
div1.sense: union with the capital, Thuc.

div1.head: συνοικισμός
div1.sense: a living together, marriage, Plut.
= συνοίκισις, Plut.

div1.head: συνοικιστήρ
div1.sense: a fellow-colonist, Pind.

div1.head: συνοικοδομέω
div1.sense: to build together, Plut.:— metaph. in Pass. to be edified together, of believers, NTest.
Pass. to be built in with other materials, λίθοι ξυνῳκοδομημέναι Thuc.

div1.head: σύνοικος
div1.sense: dwelling in the same house with others, c. dat., Aesch.; ξ. εἰσιέναι to enter the house as an inmate, Soph.:—of persons living in the same country, a fellow-inhabitant, denizen, Hdt., Thuc., etc.
metaph. associated with, wedded to, used to, of persons, ξ. ἀλλαγᾷ βίου Soph.; κακῷ Plat.:—of things, associated with, σκότῳ λιμὸς ξύνοικος Aesch., etc.

div1.head: συνοίκουρος
div1.sense: living at home together: c. gen., σ. κακῶν a partner in mischief, Eur.

div1.head: συνοικτίζω
div1.sense: to have compassion on, τινά Xen.

div1.head: συνοίομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to hold the same opinion with others, to assent, Plat.

div1.head: συνολισθάνω
div1.sense: to slip and fall together, Plut., etc.

div1.head: συνόλλυμι
div1.sense: to destroy together, Bion.:—Mid., aor2 -ωλόμην, to perish along with, τινι Eur.

div1.head: συνολολύζω
div1.sense: to raise a loud cry together, Xen.

div1.head: σύνολος
div1.sense: all together, Plat., etc.
τὸ σύνολον, as adv. on the whole, in general, altogether, Plat., etc.:—reg. adv. συνόλως, Isocr.

div1.head: συνομαίμων
div1.sense: one of the same blood, a brother or sister, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: συνομαλύνω
div1.sense: to make quite level, Plut.

div1.head: συνομαρτέω
div1.sense: to follow along with, attend on, τινί Solon.; absol., Eur.

div1.head: συνομῆλιξ
div1.sense: a comrade, Theocr.

div1.head: συνομιλέω
div1.sense: to converse with, τινί NTest.

div1.head: συνόμνυμι
div1.sense: to swear together, Xen., Plut.
to promise by oath, τί τινι Soph.; ξυνώμοσαν θάνατον πατρί joined in swearing death against him, Aesch.
to join in a league or confederacy, Aesch., Thuc.
to form a confederacy with others, c. dat., Thuc.: in bad sense, to conspire, Hdt., Ar., etc.

div1.head: συνομοιοπαθέω
div1.sense: to be similarly affected with, τινί Arist.

div1.head: συνομολογέω
div1.sense: to say the same thing with, to agree with, τινί Hdt., Xen., etc.:— to confess together, confess, concede, αὐτὰ ταῦτα Thuc.:—of disputants, to agree upon certain points, c. acc., Xen., Plat.;— so in Mid., Plat.:—Pass., τὰ ἄλλα συνωμολόγηται Xen., etc.
to agree to do, promise, τί τινι Xen.
to come to terms with, make a covenant with, Xen.

div1.head: συνομορέω
div1.sense: to abut upon a place, c. dat., NTest.

div1.head: συνομώνυμος
div1.sense: having the same name with, c. gen., Anth.

div1.head: συνοπαδός
div1.sense: a companion, Plat.

div1.head: σύνοπλος
div1.sense: under arms together, allied, Eur.

div1.head: συνοπτικός
div1.sense: seeing the whole together, taking a comprehensive view, Plat.

div1.head: σύνοπτος
div1.sense: that can be seen at a glance, in full view, Arist.

div1.head: συνοράω
div1.sense: to see together or at the same time, Xen.
to see in one view, see at a glance, whether with the eyes or mind, Plat., Dem.:—in speaking, to take a general view, Isocr., etc.

div1.head: συνοργίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to be angry together with, τινι Isocr., Dem., etc.

div1.head: συνορέω
div1.sense: to be conterminous, Polyb.

div1.head: σύνορθρος
div1.sense: dawning along with, σύνορθρον αὐγαῖς dawning with the first beams of day, Aesch.

div1.head: συνορίνω
div1.sense: to rouse or stir up together, Il.:—Pass., συνορινόμεναι φάλαγγες the lines with one impulse, Il.

div1.head: σύνορκος
div1.sense: bound together by oath, Xen.

div1.head: συνορμίζω
div1.sense: to bring to anchor together, Xen.

div1.head: συνόρνυμαι
div1.sense: Pass. to start or set forth together, (in poet. aor2 part. συνόρμενος) , Aesch.

div1.head: σύνορος
div1.sense: conterminous with, τῇ Ἀττίκῃ or τῆς Ἀττίκης Plut.: metaph., κόνις πηλοῦ κάσις ξύνουρος dust twin-sister of mud, Aesch.

div1.head: συνουσία
div1.sense: a being with, social intercourse, society, conversation, communion, Hdt., Attic; ἡ τοῦ θείου σ. communion with the divinity, Plat.; so, τῆς νόσου ξυνουσίᾳ by long intercourse with the disease, Soph.; ἡ πρὸς Σωκράτην σ. αὐτοῖν their intercourse with him, Xen.; in pl., ξυνουσίαι θηρῶν, οἱ ξυνόντες θῆρες, Soph.
intercourse with a teacher, attendance on his lectures, Xen.
cohabitation, Plat., Xen.
a society, company, party, Hdt., Plat., etc.

div1.head: συνουσιαστής
div1.sense: a companion, disciple, Xen.

div1.head: συνουσιαστικός
div1.sense: suited for society, sociable, Ar.

div1.head: συνοφρυόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to have the brow knitted, ξυνωφρυωμένη with knitted brow, Soph.; ξυνωφρυωμένῳ προσώπῳ with frowning countenance, Eur.

div1.head: σύνοφρυς
div1.sense: with meeting eyebrows, Theocr.

div1.head: συνοχέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to travel together in a chariot, Plut.

div1.head: συνοχηδόν
div1.sense: holding together, Anth.

div1.head: συνοχή
div1.sense: a being held together, ἐν ξυνοχῇσιν ὁδοῦ at a narrow part of the road, Il.
constraint, affliction, anguish, NTest.

div1.head: σύνοχος
div1.sense: joined together: metaph. agreeing with, suiting, Eur.

div1.head: συνόχωκα
div1.etym: Epic intr. perf. of συνέχω, for συνόκωχα
div1.sense: to be held together, ὤμω ἐπὶ στῆθος συνοχωκότε shoulders contracted upon the chest, Il.

div1.head: σύνοψις
div1.sense: a general view, Plat.

div1.head: σύν
div1.sense: prep. with dat., Lat. cum
along with, in company with, together with, δεῦρʼ ἤλυθε σὺν Μενελάῳ Il.

with collat. notion of help, σὺν θεῷ with Godʼs help or blessing, (the God being conceived as standing with one), Hom., etc.; σὺν θεῷ εἰρημένον spoken as by inspiration, Hdt.: so, σὺν δαίμονι, σὺν Διί, σὺν Ἀθήνῃ Il.; so also, σύν τινι εἶναι or γίγνεσθαι to be with another, i. e. on his side, of his party, Xen.; οἱ σύν τινι any oneʼs friends, followers, Xen.

endued with, ἄκοιτις σὺν μεγάλῃ ἀρετῇ Od.: of things that belong or are attached to a person, στῆ σὺν δουρί Il.; σκῆπτρον, σὺν τῷ ἔβη Il.; αὐτῇ σὺν φόρμιγγι Il. (here, in Attic, the σύν is often omitted).
of two or more things taken together, θύελλαι σὺν βορέῃ, ἄνεμος σὺν λαίλαπι Il.; also of coincidence in point of time, ἄκρᾳ σὺν ἑσπέρᾳ Pind.

of connexion or consequence, σὺν μεγάλῳ ἀποτῖσαι to pay with a great loss, i. e. suffer greatly, Il.; σὺν τῷ σῷ ἀγαθῷ to your advantage, Lat. tuo cum commodo, Xen.; σὺν μιάσματι attended with pollution, Soph.:— and, generally, in accordance with; σὺν δίκᾳ Pind., σὺν κόσμῳ, σὺν τάχει, etc., nearly = Advs. δικαίως, κοσμίως, ταχέως, Attic.
with, by means of, σὺν νεφέεσσι κάλυψεν γαῖαν Od., Pind.; πλοῦτον ἐκτήσω σὺν αἰχμῇ Aesch.
with Ordin. Numerals, ἐμοὶ σὺν ἑβδόμῳ, i. e. myself with six others, Aesch.
σύν AS ADV. together, Aesch., Soph.
besides, also, likewise, Od., Trag.
IN COMPOS.
with, along with, together, Lat. con-:—in Compos. with a trans. Verb, as κτείνω, σύν may refer to two things, to kill one person as well as another, or, to join with another in killing.
of the completion of an action, altogether, completely, as in συμπληρόω, συντέμνω.
joined with numerals, σύνδυο two together or by twos, two and two; so σύντρεις, σύμπεντε, etc., like Lat. bini, terni, etc.
συν- before β μ π φ ψ, becomes συμ-; before γ κ ξ χ, συγ-; before λ, συλ-; before ς, συσ-, but before στ, συ-, as συστῆναι.

div1.head: συναγανακτέω
div1.sense: to be vexed along with, τινί Polyb.

div1.head: συναγαπάω
div1.sense: to love along with, τινί Polyb.

div1.head: σύνταγμα
div1.sense: that which is put together in order:
a body of troops, squadron, contingent, Xen.
the constitution of a state, σ. πολιτείας a form of constitution, Isocr.
an arrangement of musical notes, Arist.
a regular collection of writings, a work, book, doctrine, Plut.
= σύνταξις II. 3, Aeschin.

div1.head: συνταγματάρχης
div1.sense: the leader of a σύνταγμα (I), Luc.

div1.head: συνταλαιπωρέω
div1.sense: to endure hardships together, share in misery, Soph.

div1.head: συντανύω
div1.sense: to stretch together, πολλῶν πείρατα συντανύσαις (Doric for -ύσας) bringing together the issues of many events, Pind.

div1.head: σύνταξις
div1.sense: a putting together, arranging, arrangement, organisation, order, Thuc., Xen.: rule, Dem.
a systematic treatise, Arist.: a narrative, Polyb.
grammatical construction, syntax, Luc.
a body of troops, ἡ εἰς μυρίους σ. their contingent towards 10, 000, Xen.
a covenant, contract, Dem.
an assigned impost, contribution, Dem., Aeschin.
a payment, allowance, pension, Dem.

div1.head: συνταράσσω
div1.sense: to throw all together into confusion, to confound, disturb, trouble, Lat. conturbare, Il., Hdt., Attic:—Pass., αἰθὴρ πόντῳ ξυντετάρακται air is confounded with sea, Aesch.: to be thrown into confusion, of soldiers, Thuc.; of social order, Soph., Thuc.; metaph. of persons, to be confounded, greatly troubled, much distressed, Hdt.

div1.head: συντάσσω
div1.sense: to put in order together, esp. of soldiers, to draw up, put in array, Hdt., Thuc., etc.; σ. πεζοὺς τῷ ἱππικῷ to draw up the foot in line with the horse, Xen.:—Pass. to be drawn up in line, Eur., etc.; μάλιστα ξυντεταγμένοι παντὸς τοῦ στρατοῦ in the best order of all the army, Thuc.: —so in Mid. to form in line, συνταξάμενοι τισι or μετά τινων with others, Xen.;—but the Mid. is also trans., συνταξάμενος τὴν φάλαγγα having drawn up his phalanx, Xen.
in Pass., of single persons, to be collected, resolute, steady, Thuc., Xen.
to arrange, organise, Plat.:—in bad sense, to concoct, Aeschin.:—Pass. to be organised, Arist.; οἱ συντεταγμένοι the conspirators, Xen.
of taxation, to fix or assess a payment, Aeschin.:—Pass. to be organised for paying contributions, Dem.:—Mid. to agree to such assessment, Dem.
c. inf. to ordain, prescribe, τινὰ ποιεῖν τι Xen., Aeschin.; of a physician, θεραπείαν σ. τινί Plut.:—Pass. to be prescribed, ταῦτα τῷ ναυάρχῳ συνετάχθη Dem.
Mid. to agree together, Dem.
Mid. also, σ. τινι to take leave of one, bid him farewell, Anth.

div1.head: συνταχύνω
div1.sense: to hurry on, τι Hdt.
intr., ὁ βίος συνταχύνει life hastens to an end, Hdt.

div1.head: συντείνω
div1.sense: to stretch together, strain, draw tight, brace up, Eur., Plat.
to strain to the uttermost, urge on, exert, Eur.; γνώμῃ συντεταμένῃ with earnest purpose, Xen.
intr. in Act. to exert oneself, strive, hasten, Lat. contendere, Plat., Plut.
to direct earnestly to one point, Plat.
intr. to direct all oneʼs powers to one object, to be bent upon doing a thing, c. inf., Eur.; σ. εἴς τι Dem.; πρός τι Isocr., etc.

div1.head: συντειχίζω
div1.sense: to help to build a wall or fortification, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: συντεκμαίρομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to conjecture from signs or symptoms, to calculate, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: συντεκνοποιέω
div1.sense: to breed children with, ἀνδρί Xen.

div1.head: συντελέθω
div1.sense: to belong to, Pind.

div1.head: συντέλεια
div1.sense: a joint payment, joint contribution for public burdens, Dem.; εἰς σ. ἄγειν τὰς χορηγίας, i. e. to leave the choregia to be defrayed by subscription, Dem.
at Athens, a partnership for bearing public burdens, Decret. ap. Dem.
generally, a company, of the gods, who separately were called τέλειοι, Aesch.
combination of efforts, the consummation of a scheme, Polyb.

div1.head: συντελέω
div1.sense: to bring quite to an end, complete, accomplish, σ. τὴν δαπάνην to make up the whole expense, Dem.; σ. εἰς τὰ ἑκατὸν ἅρματα to make up the number of 100 chariots, Xen.:—so in Mid., Polyb.
to pay towards common expenses, contribute, Aeschin., Dem.

since at Athens all citizens were classed acc. to the contributions to which they were liable, σ. εἰς . . meant to belong to a class, be counted in it, σ. εἰς ἄνδρας Isocr.; εἰς τοὺς νόθους Dem.:—hence σ. εἰς Ἀθήνας, εἰς τὸ Ἀρκαδικόν, used of a number of small states tributary or subject to a larger, Thuc.; c. dat., σ. Θηβαίοις Isocr.

div1.head: συντελής
div1.sense: joining in payment, a contributor, Dem.
belonging to the same συντέλεια (II) or company, Dem.:—metaph., οὔτε Πάρις, οὔτε σ. πόλις neither Paris nor his associate city, Aesch.
tributary, Dem.

div1.head: συντέμνω
div1.sense: to cut in pieces: to cut down, cut short, Lat. conci_dere, Thuc.:—metaph. to curtail, abridge, Aesch., Ar.:—esp. of expenses, Thuc., Xen.: of persons, to cut off, Soph.
σ. χιτῶνας to cut out, shape them, Xen.
seemingly intr. (sub. ὁδόν) to cut the road short, cut across, Hdt.:—so, of speech, to cut the matter short, speak briefly, Eur.
really intr., τοῦ χρόνου συντάμνοντος as the time became short, Hdt.

div1.head: συντερετίζω
div1.sense: to whistle an accompaniment, Theophr.

div1.head: συντερμονέω
div1.sense: to border on, τινί Polyb.

div1.head: συντέρμων
div1.sense: bordering on, close together, Anth.

div1.head: συντεταγμένως
div1.etym: adverb from part. perf. pass. of συντάσσω
div1.sense: in set terms, Plat.

div1.head: συντεταμένως
div1.etym: adverb from part. perf. pass. of συντείνω
div1.sense: earnestly, eagerly, vigorously, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: συντετραίνω
div1.sense: to bore through so as to meet, σ. τοὺς μυχοὺς ἀλλήλοις carrying their creeks through so as to meet one another, Hdt.; ἕτερον μέταλλον συντρῆσαι εἰς τὰ τῶν πλησίον to run another gallery into oneʼs neighbourʼs mines, Dem.:—Pass. to be carried by a connecting channel or duct, Plat., Arist.
metaph., διʼ ὤτων συντέτραινε μῦθον let the word pierce through thy ears, Aesch.

div1.head: συντεχνάζω
div1.sense: to join in plots with, τινί Plut.

div1.head: σύντεχνος
div1.sense: practising the same art, c. gen. oneʼs mate or fellow-workman, Ar.

div1.head: συντήκω
div1.sense: to fuse into one mass, to weld together, Lat. conflare, Plat.
to melt down, dissolve: metaph. to make to waste or pine away, Eur.

Pass. συντήκομαι, aor1 -ετήχθην, aor2 -ετάκην [ᾰ]: and in same sense intr. perf. act. συντέτηκα:— to be fused into one mass: metaph., σ. τινι to become absolutely one with another, c. dat., Eur., Plat.
to melt away, disappear, Xen.:— metaph. to waste or fall away, Eur.

div1.head: συντηρέω
div1.sense: to preserve together: Pass., NTest.
to watch oneʼs opportunity, Plut.

div1.head: συντίθημι
div1.sense: to put together, Hdt., Xen., etc.; σ. ἄρθρα στόματος to close the lips, Eur.
in Arithm. to add together, Hdt., Eur., etc.: also συντιθεὶς γέλων adding laughter, Soph.
to put together, of builders, Thuc., Xen.
to construct, frame, build, Hdt.:— σ. τι ἀπό or ἔκ τινος to compose or make one thing of another, Hdt.
to construct or frame a story, Eur., Ar., etc.:—of an author, to compose, Thuc.
to frame, devise, contrive, ὁ συνθεὶς τάδε the framer of this plot, Soph.; σ. ψευδεῖς αἰτίας Dem.
to put together, take in, comprise, Eur.; ἐν βραχεῖ ξυνθεὶς λόγῳ putting things shortly together, Soph.
Mid. συντίθεμαι, to put together for oneself, i. e. to observe, take heed to, σύνθετο βουλήν, ἀοιδήν Hom.; and, simply, to perceive, hear, ὅπα σύνθετο Od.: absol., σύνθεο take heed, Hom.
to set in order, organise, Xen.
to conclude, form, ἄνδρεσσι κακοῖς συνθέμενοι φιλίην Theogn.; συντίθεσθαι συμμαχίην Hdt.; σ. ναῦλον to agree upon the fare, Xen.:—Pass., τοῦ συντεθέντος χρόνου at the time agreed upon, Plat.
c. inf. to covenant or agree to do, Hdt., Thuc.
absol. to make a covenant, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: συντιμάω
div1.sense: to honour together or alike, Lys.
to estimate together:—Mid., συνετιμήσαντο ὑπὲρ ἐμοῦ ταύτην τὴν εἰσφοράν they fixed this as the estimate of my contribution, Dem.

div1.head: συντινάσσω
div1.sense: to shake to the foundations, σὺν δὲ μάχαν ἐτίναξε, i. e. closed with him, Theocr.

div1.head: συντιτρώσκω
div1.sense: to wound in many places, Xen.

div1.head: συντολμάω
div1.sense: to venture together:—Doric 2nd sg. aor2 συν-έτλας, Eur.

div1.head: συντομία
div1.sense: conciseness, Plat., Arist.

div1.head: σύντομος
div1.sense: Lat. concisus, cut short, abridged, shortened, esp. of a road, σ. ἀτραπός a short cut, Ar.; συντομώτατον the shortest cut, Hdt.; τὰ ξυντομώτατα Thuc.; ἡ σύντομος (sub. ὁδός) Hdt.
of language, concise, brief, curt, short, Aesch., Eur., etc.
of Time, ξυντομωτάτη διαπολέμησις Thuc.
adv. -μως, concisely, shortly, briefly, Aesch., etc.:—so also neut. pl. σύντομα Soph.: comp. and Sup. -ώτερον, -ώτατα, Isocr.; also -ωτάτως, Soph.
of Time, shortly, immediately, Soph., Xen., etc.

div1.head: συντονία
div1.sense: intense application or exertion, Arist.

div1.head: σύντονος
div1.sense: strained tight, ἔχειν τὸ σ. to be strained tight, Xen.
intense, impetuous, violent, Soph.
of persons, earnest, serious, severe, vehement, Plat., etc.: so of Music, severe, Arist.:—adv. -νῶς, intensely, eagerly, severely, Plat.; so neut. pl., σύντονα Eur.:—comp. -ώτερον, Arist.

div1.head: συντραγῳδέω
div1.sense: to act tragedy together, Luc.

div1.head: συντράπεζος
div1.sense: a messmate, Xen.; βίον σ. ἔχειν to live with one, Eur.

div1.head: σύντρεις
div1.sense: three together, by threes, Od.

div1.head: συντρέφω
div1.sense: to feed together or besides, Xen.
Pass. to grow up together, Xen.; τινι with one, Eur.
of feelings or sentiments, to grow up with, Arist., Plut.: to be organised, of bodies, Plat.

div1.head: συντρέχω
div1.sense: to run together so as to meet, to encounter, Il.:—metaph., εἰπὲ τῷ μόρῳ συντρέχει say with what death she has met, Soph.
to assemble, gather together, Hdt.; of clouds, to gather, Hdt.; of liquids, to be mingled with, c. dat., Soph.
to come together, concur, agree, Hdt., Xen.
to concur, coincide, of time, Eur., Dem.; σ. τινί to concur or coincide with, Soph.
to run alongside, Xen.

div1.head: συντριαινόω
div1.sense: to shatter as with a trident, Eur.

div1.head: συντρίβω
div1.sense: to rub together, σ. τὰ πυρεῖα to rub dry sticks together to procure a light, Luc.
to shiver to atoms, Ar., etc.; σ. τὰς ναῦς to stave them in, by running them aground, Thuc.
of persons, to beat to a jelly, crush, Lat. contundere, Eur.:—c. gen. partis, συντρίβειν τῆς κεφαλῆς Isocr.; and in Pass., συντριβῆναι τῆς κεφαλῆς to have oneʼs head broken, Ar.

div1.head: συντριήραρχος
div1.sense: a partner in the equipment of a trireme, Dem.

div1.head: συντριηραρχέω
div1.sense: to be a συντριήραρχος, Lys.

div1.head: συντροφία
div1.sense: a being reared together, common nurture, Plut.
a brood, Anth.

div1.head: σύντροφος
div1.sense: brought up together with another, c. dat., Hdt., Ar.:—often of domestic animals, Hdt., Xen.:—absol., τὸ σ. γένος the people bred up with me, Soph.
generally, living with, Soph.; σ. ὄμμα the eye or presence of a companion, Soph.; σ. ὢν (sc. ἀνάγκαις) being born to difficulties, Eur.
of things, having grown up with one, congenital, natural, Soph.; τὰ ξύντροφα every-day evils, Thuc.:— σ. τινι natural or habitual to, τῇ Ἑλλάδι πενίη σύντροφος Hdt.
act. a helping in the preservation, τινος of a thing, Xen.

div1.head: συντροχάζω
div1.sense: to run together, Plut.

div1.head: συντυγχάνω
div1.sense: to meet with, fall in with, τινί Hdt., Soph., etc.: οἱ συντυχόντες, of two persons meeting, Hdt.; but, ὁ συντυχών, like ὁ τυχών, the first that meets one, any one, Eur.; ὁ ἀεὶ ξυντυχών Eur.; so of things, τὸ συντυχόν what first comes to hand, anything common, mean, bad, Hdt., Xen.
rarely, like τυγχάνω, c. gen., which is governed by σύν, συντυχὼν κακῶν ἀνδρῶν having like others met with evil men, Soph.

of accidents, to happen to, befall, τὰ συντυχόντα σφι Hdt.:—absol. to happen, fall out, εὖ ξυντυχόντων if things go well, Aesch.; ὁ ξ. κίνδυνος Thuc.:—impers., συνετύγχανε, συνέτυχε it happened that . . , c. inf., Thuc.

div1.head: συντυραννοκτονέω
div1.sense: to join in slaying tyrants, Luc.

div1.head: συντυρόω
div1.sense: to make into cheese together: hence, comically, τἀκ Βοιωτῶν συντυρούμενα the troubles that are being concocted on the part of the Boeotians, Ar.

div1.head: συντυχία
div1.sense: an occurrence, a hap, chance, event, incident, Solon., Hdt., Attic; ὡς ἑκάστοις τῆς ξυντυχίας ἔσχεν according to the circumstances of each party, Thuc.; κατὰ συντυχίην by chance, Hdt.:—in pl. the chances of life, circumstances, Thuc.
sometimes a happy chance, success, Pind., Hdt.;—or a mishap, misfortune, Eur.

div1.head: συνυποδείκνυμι
div1.sense: to indicate together, τί τινι Polyb.

div1.head: συνυποδύομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to undergo together, Plut.

div1.head: συνυποκρίνομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to play a part along with others: to help another in maintaining a thing, Plut.

div1.head: συνυποτίθεμαι
div1.sense: Mid. to help in composing, Plut.

div1.head: συνυπουργέω
div1.sense: to cooperate with, τινί NTest., Luc.

div1.head: συνυφαίνω
div1.sense: to weave together: metaph. to frame with art, devise cunningly, Od., Luc.:—Pass., ὥστε ταῦτα συνυφανθῆναι so that this web was woven, i. e. this business undertaken, Hdt.

div1.head: συνωδίνω
div1.sense: to be in travail together, Eur.

div1.head: συνῳδός
div1.sense: singing or sounding in unison with, responsive, Eur.
absol. in harmony, accordant, Plat.
metaph. according with, in harmony with, τινί Hdt., Eur., etc.

div1.head: συνωθέω
div1.sense: to force together, compress forcibly, Xen.

div1.head: συνωμοσία
div1.sense: a being leagued by oath, conspiracy, Ar., Thuc., etc.; ξ. δήμου καταλύσεως for putting down the democracy, Thuc.
a confederacy, Thuc.
a body of men leagued by oath, a political union or club, Thuc., Plat.

div1.head: συνωμότης
div1.sense: a fellow-conspirator, confederate, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: συνώμοτος
div1.sense: leagued by oath: ξυνώμοτον, τό, a confederacy, Thuc.

div1.head: συνωνέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to collect by offering money, σ. ἵππον to hire a body of cavalry, Hdt.
to buy up, Lat. coemere, Xen., etc.:—the perf. συνεώνημαι is pass., ὁ συνεωνημένος σῖτος corn bought up Lys.; but act. in Dem.

div1.head: συνωνυμία
div1.sense: a synonym, Arist.

div1.head: συνώνυμος
div1.sense: of like name, Eur., Arist.

div1.head: συνωριαστής
div1.sense: one who drives a συνωρίς, Luc.

div1.head: συνωρίζω
div1.sense: to yoke together:—Mid., ξυνωρίζου χέρα join thy hand with mine, Eur.

div1.head: συνωρικεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to drive a pair, Ar.

div1.head: συνωρίς
div1.sense: a pair of horses, Lat. biga, Eur., Ar.
generally, a pair or couple of anything, Trag.; ποδοῖν ξυνωρίς a coupling fetter for the feet, Aesch.

div1.head: συνωφελέω
div1.sense: to join in aiding or relieving, τινά Xen.; rarely τινί, Soph.

div1.head: συνωχαδόν
div1.sense: of Time, perpetually, continually, Hes.

div1.head: συοκτασία
div1.sense: slaughter of swine, Anth.

div1.head: συοφόντης
div1.sense: swine-slayer; fem. συοφόντις, Anth.

div1.head: σύ
div1.sense: subst. Pron. of the second pers., thou, you.
strengthd. by compos. with the enclit. γε, σύγε, (like ἔγωγε) thou at least, for thy part, in Hom., etc., Doric τύγα Theocr.
Dual nom. and acc. σφῶι, you two, both of you, Hom.
Pl. ye, you, Hom., etc.,

div1.head: Συρακοσία
div1.sense: χώρα the territory of Syracuse, Thuc.

div1.head: Συρακόσιος
div1.sense: Syracusan, and as Subst. a Syracusan.

div1.head: Συράκουσαι
div1.sense: Ionic Συρήκουσαι, Doric Συράκοσαι, and Συράκοσσαι, Syracuse, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: Σύρα
div1.sense: a Syrian woman, Ar.

div1.head: σύργαστρος
div1.sense: properly συρόγαστρος, trailing the belly, as a worm, Anth.

div1.head: σύρδην
div1.sense: dragging, in a long line, Aesch.

div1.head: Συρία
div1.sense: (sc. γῆ) Syria, Hdt., etc.: Σ. ἡ Παλαιστίνη Palestine, Hdt.: Κοίλη Σ. the district between Libanus and Anti-libanus, Strab.

div1.head: σύριγμα
div1.sense: the sound of a pipe, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: συριγμός
div1.sense: a whistling, hissing, Xen.

div1.head: σῦριγξ
div1.sense: a pipe:
a musical pipe, a shepherdʼs pipe, Panspipe, Il., Hes., Attic
anything like a pipe:
a spear-case, = δορατοθήκη, Il.
the hole in the nave of a wheel, Trag.
a duct or channel in the body, in pl. the nostrils, Soph.

div1.head: συρίζω
div1.sense: to play the σῦριγξ, to pipe, Eur., Theocr.; c. acc. cogn., συρίζων ὑμεναίους Eur.
to whistle, hiss, Aesch., Ar.:—c. acc. cogn., συρίζων φόνον hissing forth murder, Aesch.
to hiss an actor, Lat. explodere, Dem.

div1.head: Συρίζω
div1.sense: to speak like a Syrian, Luc.

div1.head: Συριηγενής
div1.sense: Syrian-born, Orac. ap. Hdt.

div1.head: Σύριος
div1.sense: of or from Syria, Hdt., Aesch., etc.

div1.head: συριστής
div1.sense: a piper, Luc.

div1.head: Συριστί
div1.sense: adv. in the Syrian language, Σ. ἐπίστασθαι to understand Syrian, Xen.

div1.head: συρμαία
div1.sense: purge-plant, a name given to the radish, as used by the Egyptians (v. μελανοσυρμαῖος) , Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: συρμαΐζω
div1.sense: to take a purge, Hdt.

div1.head: σύρμα
div1.sense: anything trailed or dragged:
a theatric robe with a long train, syrma in Juven.:— periphr., σ. τερηδόνος a long woodworm, Anth.
sweepings, refuse, litter, Heraclit. ap. Arist.

div1.head: συρμός
div1.sense: any lengthened sweeping motion, Lat. tractus, the track of meteors, Plat.; of storms, Anth.; the trail of a serpent, Plut.

div1.head: Σύρος
div1.sense: a Syrian, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: Σῦρος
div1.sense: Syros, one of the Cyclades, Strab.; called Συριή, in Od.

div1.head: Συροφοῖνιξ
div1.sense: a Syro-phoenician, Luc.: fem. Συροφοίνισσα, NTest.

div1.head: σύρραξις
div1.sense: a dashing together, Plut.

div1.head: συρράπτω
div1.sense: to sew or stitch together, sew up, Lat. consuo, Hes., Hdt.

div1.head: συρρέζω
div1.sense: to do sacrifice together, Anth.

div1.head: συρρέω
div1.sense: to flow together or in one stream, Plat.:—metaph. of men, to flow or stream together, Hdt., Xen.
to float together with, Luc.

div1.head: συρρήγνυμι
div1.sense: to break in pieces, Plut.:—Pass., κακοῖσι συνέρρηκται he is broken down by sufferings, Od.
to dash together: Pass., of war, to break out, Plut.

intr. to break out together, break forth, of rivers, συρρήγνυσι ἐς τὸν Ἕρμον break into the Hermus, join it, Hdt.: so perf. συνέρρωγα (in pres. signf.) and plup. (in imperf.), ὁ πόλεμος ξυνερρώγει the war broke out, Thuc.
like συρράσσω, to meet in battle, engage, Plut.

div1.head: συρριζόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to have the roots united, Luc.

div1.head: Σύρτις
div1.sense: the Syrtis, name of two large sand-banks (Major and Minor) on the coast of Libya, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: συρφετός
div1.sense: anything swept together, sweepings, refuse, rubbish, litter, Lat. quisquiliae, Hes.
metaph. a mixed crowd, mob, rabble, Plat.: of a single person, one of the mob (cf. Hor. plebs eris), Plat.

div1.head: συρφετώδης
div1.sense: jumbled together, promiscuous, Luc.

div1.head: συσκεδάννυμι
div1.sense: to help in scattering, to toss about, Ar.

div1.head: συσκευάζω
div1.sense: to make ready by putting together, to pack up baggage for another, Xen.
to help in preparing, τὸ δεῖπνόν τινι Ar.:—in bad sense, to contrive, concert, get up, Dem.

Mid., with perf. pass. συσκεύασθαι, to pack up oneʼs baggage, to pack up, Lat. convasare, vasa colligere, Thuc., Xen., etc.: part. aor1 mid. and perf. pass. all packed up, in marching order, ready for a start, Xen.; also c. acc., συνεσκευασμένος τὰ ἑαυτοῦ ἐνθάδε with all his goods packed up and brought hither, Lys.
to contrive, get up, organise, Dem.
to bring together, scrape up for oneʼs own use or advantage, σ. χρήματα Lycurg.
to arrange for oneʼs own interests, band together, Dem.

div1.head: σύρω
div1.sense: to draw, drag, or trail along, Theocr.:—Pass. to trail along, Anth.
to drag by force, hale, Theocr.:—of rivers, to sweep or carry down with them, Anth.:—Pass. to be swept away, Plut.

div1.head: συσκευασία
div1.sense: a packing up, getting ready, for a journey or march, Xen.

div1.head: συσκευωρέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to contrive, organise, Dem.

div1.head: συσκηνέω
div1.sense: to live in the same tent with another, to mess together, Xen.; τινί with one, Xen.

div1.head: συσκηνία
div1.sense: a dwelling in one tent: of soldiers, a messing together, Xen.

div1.head: σύσκηνος
div1.sense: one who lives in the same tent, a messmate, Lat. contubernalis, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: συσκιάζω
div1.sense: to shade quite over, throw a shade over, shade closely or thickly, Hes.; γένυν σ., i. e.to get a beard, Eur.: metaph., συσκηνῶσαι τὰς ἁμαρτίας Dem.
intr. to be thick-shaded, Eur.

div1.head: σύσκιος
div1.sense: closely shaded, thickly shaded, Xen.; σύσκιόν τι a closely-shaded place, Luc.

div1.head: συσκοπέω
div1.sense: to contemplate along with or together, Plat.

div1.head: συσκοτάζω
div1.sense: to grow quite dark: impers., συσκοτάζει it grows dark, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: συσκυθρωπάζω
div1.sense: to look gloomy together, Xen.

div1.head: συσπαράσσω
div1.sense: to tear in pieces, NTest.

div1.head: σύσπαστος
div1.sense: drawn together, closed by drawing together, Plat.

div1.head: συσπάω
div1.sense: to draw together, draw up, contract, Plat., Luc.
to draw together by stitching, sew together, Xen.
in Mid. to draw along with one, Plut.

div1.head: συσπειράω
div1.sense: Pass., of soldiers, to be formed in close order (v. σπεῖρα II), Xen.; σ. ἐπὶ τόπον to march in such order to a place, Xen.
to be coiled up, Luc.

div1.head: συσπείρω
div1.sense: to sow together, Luc.

div1.head: συσπένδω
div1.sense: to join in making a libation, Dem., Aeschin.

div1.head: συσπεύδω
div1.sense: to assist zealously, τινὶ ποιεῖν τι Hdt.

div1.head: συσπλαγχνεύω
div1.sense: to join in eating the sacrificial meat (τὰ σπλάγχνα) , Ar.

div1.head: συσπουδάζω
div1.sense: to make haste together, to join in zealous exertion, Ar., Xen.: c. acc. rei, to pursue or execute zealously together with, τί τινι Xen.

div1.head: συσσαίνομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to feel flattered by a thing, Polyb.

div1.head: συσσεβίζω
div1.sense: to join in celebrating, θυσίας θεῷ Eur.[now reading οὐ σεβίζ.]

div1.head: συσσεύω
div1.sense: to urge on together, βοῶν κάρηνα Hhymn.

div1.head: συσσημαίνω
div1.sense: Mid. to join in signing, Dem.

div1.head: σύσσημον
div1.sense: a fixed sign or signal, NTest.
a pledge, Anth.

div1.head: συσσιτέω
div1.sense: to mess with, τινί Ar.:—absol. in pl. to mess together, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: συσσίτησις
div1.sense: a messing together, a public mess, Xen.

div1.head: συσσίτιον
div1.sense: a common meal, public mess, such as were used in Crete and Lacedaemon, Hdt., Plat., etc.
a messroom, common-hall, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: σύσσιτος
div1.sense: one who eats together, a messmate, Theogn., Hdt., Attic

div1.head: συσσῴζω
div1.sense: to help to save or preserve, Eur., Thuc.

div1.head: σύσσωμος
div1.sense: united in one body, NTest.

div1.head: συσσωφρονέω
div1.sense: to be a partner in temperance, Eur.

div1.head: συσταδόν
div1.sense: standing close together, hand to hand, Thuc.

div1.head: συστασιαστής
div1.sense: a fellow-rioter, NTest.

div1.head: σύστασις
div1.sense: a putting together, composition, Arist.; σ. προσώπου a studied expression of countenance, of Pericles, Plut.
a bringing together, introduction, recommendation, Polyb., Plut.
(συνίσταμαι) a standing together, meeting: in hostile sense, close combat, conflict, Hdt.; metaph., σ. γνώμης a conflict of mind, intense anxiety, Thuc.
a meeting, a knot of men, Eur.; κατὰ ξυστάσεις γιγνόμενοι forming into knots, Thuc.: a political union, Dem.
friendship or alliance, Polyb.: a conspiracy, Plut.
construction, structure, constitution, Plat., Arist.: absol. a political constitution, Plat.
metaph. of the mind, σ. φρενῶν contraction, sternness, sullenness, Eur.

div1.head: συστασιώτης
div1.sense: a member of the same faction, a partisan, Hdt.

div1.head: συστάς
div1.sense: standing together, planted closely, Arist.

div1.head: συστασιάζω
div1.sense: to join in faction or sedition, take part therein, Thuc.

div1.head: συστατικός
div1.sense: introductory, σ. ἐπιστολή a letter of introduction, NTest.

div1.head: συσταυρόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be crucified with, τινι NTest.

div1.head: συστεγάζω
div1.sense: to cover entirely, τινί with a thing, Plat.:—Pass., Xen.

div1.head: συστέλλω
div1.sense: to draw together, draw in: to shorten sail (sub. τά ἱστία) , Ar.: to draw soldiers into a fort, Plut.
to contract, reduce, Plat., Dem.:—Pass. to cower together, Eur.; ξυστέλλεσθαι ἐς εὐτέλειαν to retrench, Thuc.
metaph. to lower, humble, abase, Isocr.:—Pass., Eur.
Pass., also, to be wrapped up, shrouded, Eur.; aor2 part. συσταλείς, tucked up, ready for action, Ar.

div1.head: συστενάζω
div1.sense: to lament with, τινί Eur.; absol., NTest.

div1.head: συστεφανόω
div1.sense: to crown together with, τινι Dem.

div1.head: σύστημα
div1.sense: a whole compounded of parts, a system, Plat.:— a composition, Arist.
an organised government, constitution, Arist.
a body of soldiers, a corps, Polyb.
of the Roman Senate, Plut.

div1.head: συστοιχέω
div1.sense: to correspond to, τινί NTest.

div1.head: συστοιχία
div1.sense: a coordinate series, Arist.

div1.head: σύστοιχος
div1.sense: standing in the same row, coordinate, correspondent, opp. to ἀντίστοιχος (standing in opposite rows), Arist.

div1.head: συστολή
div1.sense: a drawing together, contraction, limitation, Plut.

div1.head: συστολίζω
div1.sense: to put together, fabricate, Eur.
to unite, τινά τινι Anth.

div1.head: συστρατεία
div1.sense: a common campaign, Xen.

div1.head: συστρατεύω
div1.sense: act. and Dep. to make a campaign or serve together, to join or share in an expedition, absol., Hdt., Thuc., etc.; τινί with another, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: συστρατηγέω
div1.sense: to be the fellow-general of, τινός Dem.

div1.head: συστράτηγος
div1.sense: a joint-commander, Eur., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: συστρατιώτης
div1.sense: a fellow-soldier, Lat. commilito, Xen., etc.

div1.head: συστρατοπεδεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to encamp along with, τινι or σύν τινι Xen.

div1.head: σύστρεμμα
div1.sense: anything twisted up together: a body of men, a crowd, concourse, Polyb.

div1.head: συστρέφω
div1.sense: to twist up into a ball, Lat. conglobare: of animals, to gather themselves together, in preparing to spring, Plat.: of soldiers, σ. ἑωυτούς to collect themselves, rally, Hdt.: Pass., συστραφέντες in a body, Hdt.; ἐπὶ πεντήκοντα ἀσπίδων συνεστραμμένοι ἦσαν they were formed in a mass 50 deep, Xen.
of soldiers, also, συστρέφειν ἐπὶ δόρυ to wheel them to the right, Xen.; σ. τὸν ἵππον to turn him sharply, Plut.
to form into an organised whole, unite, Hdt.:—Pass. to unite, club together, conspire, Thuc., Aeschin.
of sentences, narratives, and the like, to compress, Arist.: absol., συστρέψας γράφει writes briefly, curtly, Aeschin.:—Pass., ῥῆμα βραχὺ καὶ συνεστραμμένον a short and pithy saying, Plat.

div1.head: συστροφή
div1.sense: a dense mass of men, a gathering of people, Hdt.
a sudden storm, Polyb.

div1.head: συσφάζω
div1.sense: to slay along with: Pass., aor2 inf. συσφαγῆναι to be slain with another, τινι Eur.

div1.head: συσφίγγω
div1.sense: to condense:—Pass., Anth.

div1.head: συσχηματίζω
div1.sense: to conform one thing to another, τι πρός τι Arist.:—Pass. to form oneself after another, to be conformed to his example, NTest.

div1.head: συσχολάζω
div1.sense: to be a fellow-pupil or companion in philosophy, to pass oneʼs time with or together, Plut.

div1.head: συφεός
div1.sense: a hog-sty, Od.; συφεόνδε to the sty, Od.

div1.head: συφόρβιον
div1.sense: a herd of swine, Anth.

div1.head: συφορβός
div1.sense: a swineherd, Hom.

div1.head: συχνός
div1.sense: of Time, long, Hdt., etc.; σ. λόγος a long speech, Plat.

of Number, many, Hdt., Ar., etc.; many days together, Ar.:—c. gen., συχναὶ τῶν νήσων Hdt.:—absol., συχνοί many people together, Ar., etc.:—with sg. nouns, much, great, Ar., Plat., etc.; τὸ πολίχνιον συχνὸν ποιεῖν to make the small town large, Plat.:—c. gen., τῆς μαρίλης συχνήν Ar.
the adv. συχνῶς (Antipho.) is rare, the neut. συχνόν, συχνά being used instead, often, much, Plat.: far, Xen.
dat. συχνῷ with comp. adj., νεώτερος ἐμοῦ καὶ συχνῷ younger by a good deal, Dem.

div1.head: σφαγεῖον
div1.sense: a bowl for catching the blood of the victim in sacrifices, Eur.
= σφάγιον, the victim, Eur.

div1.head: σφαγεύς
div1.sense: a slayer, butcher, Eur.: a murderer, cut-throat, Dem.:—in Soph., ὁ σφαγεὺς ἕστηκε the slayer is set, i. e. the sword on which Ajax is about to throw himself:— a sacrificial knife, Eur.

div1.head: σφαγή
div1.sense: slaughter, butchery, in sg. and pl., Trag., Plat., etc.; αἵματος σφαγή the blood gushing from the wound, Aesch.; καθάρμοσον σφαγάς close the gaping wound, Eur.
the throat, the spot where the victim is struck (cf. Lat. jugulum, jugulari), in pl., Eur., Thuc.

div1.head: σφαγιάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to slay a victim, sacrifice, Hdt., Xen.
in Act. Ar., Plut.:—hence aor1 pass. part. σφαγιασθείς, slain, sacrificed, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: σφαγιασμός
div1.sense: a slaying, sacrificing, Eur., Plut.

div1.head: σφάγιον
div1.sense: a victim, offering, Soph., Eur.: —mostly in pl., Hdt., Aesch., etc.
slaughter, sacrifice, in pl., Eur.

div1.head: σφάγιος
div1.sense: slaying, slaughtering, σφ. μόρος slaughter, Soph.

div1.head: σφαγίς
div1.sense: a sacrificial knife, Eur.

div1.head: σφαδᾴζω
div1.sense: only in pres. and imperf. to struggle, plunge, of horses, Aesch., Xen.; cf. ἀσφάδαστος.
to struggle, shew impatience, Plut.

div1.head: σφαδᾳσμός
div1.sense: a spasm, convulsion, Plat.

div1.head: σφάζω
div1.sense: to slay, slaughter, properly by cutting the throat (v. σφαγή II), Hom.
esp. to slaughter victims for sacrifice, Il., Eur.
generally to slay, kill, first applied to human victims, Pind., Trag.; σφ. τινὰ ἐς τὸν κρητῆρα so that the blood run into the bowl, Hdt.

div1.head: σφαῖρα
div1.sense: a ball, playing-ball, Od., Plat.
any ball: the terrestrial globe, the earth, Strab.

div1.head: σφαιρηδόν
div1.sense: like a globe or ball, ἧκε δέ μιν σφαιρηδὸν ἑλιξάμενος Il.

div1.head: σφαιρίζω
div1.sense: to play at ball, Plat.

div1.head: σφαιρικός
div1.sense: globular, spherical: τὰ σφαιρικά the doctrine of the spheres, astronomy, Anth.

div1.head: σφαίρισις
div1.sense: a playing at ball, Arist.

div1.head: σφαιριστήριον
div1.sense: a ball-court, Theophr.

div1.head: σφαιροειδής
div1.sense: ball-like, spherical, Plat.; σφαιροειδές, τό, a rounded end (cf. σφαιρόω II), Xen.

div1.head: σφαιροποιέω
div1.sense: to make spherical, Strab.

div1.head: σφαιρόω
div1.sense: to make spherical:—Pass. to be rounded, στήθεα ἐσφαίρωτο his chest was round and arched, Theocr.
Pass., also, ἀκόντια ἐσφαιρωμένα spears with buttons at the point, like our foils, Xen., Arist.

div1.head: σφαιρωτός
div1.sense: with a button at the end, Xen.

div1.head: σφακελίζω
div1.sense: to be gangrened, ἐσφακέλισε τὸ ὀστέον Hdt.

div1.head: σφάκελος
div1.sense: gangrene:—generally, a spasm, convulsion, Aesch., Eur.: metaph., σφ. ἀνέμων the convulsive fury of winds, Aesch.

div1.head: σφαλερός
div1.sense: likely to make one stumble or trip: metaph. slippery, perilous, dangerous, Lat. lubricus, Hdt., Eur., etc.:— σφαλερόν ἐστι, c. inf., it is dangerous to . . , Plat., etc.
(σφάλλομαι) ready to fall, tottering, reeling, staggering, Aesch., Soph.; σφ. σύμμαχοι Dem.

div1.head: σφάλλω
div1.sense: Lat. fall-o (the sigma being lost):—to make to fall, throw down, overthrow, properly by tripping up, to trip up in wrestling, Hom., Pind., Eur., etc.; σφ. ναῦς to throw her on her beam-ends, Plut.; ἵππος σφ. τὸν ἀναβάτην throws him, Xen.:—Pass. to be tripped up, Ar.; of a drunken man, σφαλλόμενος reeling, staggering, Ar.

generally, to cause to fall, overthrow, defeat, Hdt., Soph., Thuc.:—Pass. to be overthrown, to fall, fail, be undone, become helpless, Hdt., Attic; τόδʼ ἐσφάλη this mishap took place, Soph.; οὔ τι μὴ σφαλῶ γʼ ἐν σοί I shall not fail in thy business, Soph.
to baffle, foil, balk, disappoint, Hdt., Soph.:—Pass. to err, go wrong, be mistaken, Hdt., Soph.
the Pass. is also used c. gen. rei, to be balked of or foiled in a thing, ἦ καὶ πατήρ τι σφάλλεται βουλευμάτων; Aesch.; σφάλλεσθαι γάμου Eur.; τῆς δόξης Thuc.

div1.head: σφαραγέομαι
div1.sense: Dep., to burst with a noise, to crackle, sputter, ῥίζαι σφαραγεῦντο the roots of his eye crackled or hissed (when Ulysses burnt them with the hot stake), Od.
to be full even to bursting, Od.

div1.head: σφαραγίζω
div1.sense: to stir up with noise and bustle, Hes.

div1.head: σφεδανός
div1.sense: furious, Anth.
in Hom. only as adv. vehemently, eagerly.

div1.head: σφεῖς
div1.etym: the use of σφι, σφιν as dat. sg. for οἱ is rare, Hhymn., Aesch., Soph.
Acc. σφέας, mostly enclit. pronounced as a long syllable, Hom., Hdt.
div1.sense: masc. and fem. pl. of the Pron. of 3rd person, they, = αὐτοί, Hdt., Attic
in Hom. this Pron. is always personal, and therefore he uses no neut.; but Hdt. has neut. pl. σφέα.

this Pron. is used both for the demonstr. αὐτοί, they, and for the reflex. αὑτῶν, etc., themselves;— in the latter case often strengthd. σφῶν αὐτῶν, σφέας αὐτούς, σφᾶς αὐτούς, Hes.; sometimes for ἀλλήλους, Hes.
rarely for 2nd pers. pl., μετὰ σφίσιν for μεθʼ ὑμῖν, Il.; σφέας for ὑμᾶς, Hdt.

div1.head: σφέλας
div1.sense: a footstool, Od.: Epic pl. σφέλα Od.

div1.head: σφενδάμνινος
div1.sense: of maple wood: metaph. of persons, "hearts of oak, " Ar.

div1.head: σφένδαμνος
div1.sense: the maple, Lat. acer, Theophr.

div1.head: σφενδονάω
div1.sense: to sling, to use the sling, Thuc., Xen.
to strike by slinging, Babr.
to throw as from a sling:—Pass., Eur.
to move like a swing, to swing to and fro, Eur.

div1.head: σφενδόνη
div1.sense: Lat. funda (the ς being lost), a sling, Il.: metaph., σφενδόνας ἀπʼ εὐμέτρου with well-measured throw, as from a sling, Aesch.
the hoop of a ring in which the stone was set as in a sling, esp. the broader part round the stone, as in Lat. funda for pala annuli, Eur., Plat.
the stone or bullet of the sling, Xen.; τοιαύταις σφ., of hailstones, Ar.

div1.head: σφενδονήτης
div1.sense: a slinger, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: σφενδονητικός
div1.sense: of or for slinging.:— ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη) , the art of slinging, Plat.

div1.head: σφετερίζω
div1.sense: to make oneʼs own, appropriate, usurp, Plat.:—so, as Dep. σφετερίζομαι, Xen., Dem.

div1.head: σφετερισμός
div1.sense: appropriation, ἐπὶ σφετερισμῷ ἑαυτοῦ for oneʼs own use and advantage, Arist.

div1.head: σφετεριστής
div1.sense: an appropriator, Arist.

div1.head: σφέτερος
div1.etym: possessive adj. of 3rd pers. pl. σφείς
div1.sense: their own, their, Lat. suus, Hom., etc; strengthd., αὐτῶν σφετέρῃσιν ἀτασθαλίῃσιν Od.;—in Prose, the gen. ἑαυτῶν is more common, but σφέτερος occurs in Thuc., etc.; τὸ σφέτερον their own feelings, their own business, Thuc., Plat.; οἱ σφέτεροι their own people, Thuc.
also of 3rd sg., his or her own, his, her, for ἑός, ὅς, Hes., Pind., Aesch.
in Poets sometimes of other persons:
of 2nd pl., = ὑμέτερος, your own, your, Lat. vester, Il., Hes.
of 2nd sg., = σός, thine own, tuus, Theocr.
of 1st sg., = ἐμός, mine own, meus, Theocr.
of the 1st pl., = ἡμέτερος, our own, noster, Xen.

div1.head: σφηκιά
div1.sense: a waspsʼ nest, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: σφηκίσκος
div1.sense: a piece of wood pointed like a waspʼs tail, a pointed stick or stake, Ar.

div1.head: σφηκόω
div1.sense: to make like a wasp, i. e. to pinch in at the waist: generally, to bind tightly, Anth.
Pass., πλοχμοί, οἳ χρυσῷ τε καὶ ἀργύρῳ ἐσφήκωντο (3rd pl. plup.) braids of hair, which were bound tightly with gold and silver, Il.

div1.head: σφηκώδης
div1.sense: wasp-like, pinched in at the waist like a wasp, Ar.

div1.head: σφήκωμα
div1.sense: the point of a helmet where the plume is fixed in, Ar.

div1.head: σφηνοκέφαλος
div1.sense: with peaked head, Strab.

div1.head: σφηνοπώγων
div1.sense: with peaked beard, Luc.

div1.head: σφήν
div1.sense: a wedge, Ar., etc.;—used as an instrument of torture, Aesch.

div1.head: σφήξ
div1.note: .σφήξ, σφηκός, Doric σφάξ, σφᾱκός, οῦ, ὁ,
div1.sense: a wasp, Lat. vespa, Il., Hdt., Attic

div1.head: Σφήττιος
div1.sense: a Sphettian, Ar. Aeschin.

div1.head: Σφηττοῖ
div1.sense: in or at Sphettos, Aeschin.; Σφηττόθεν from Sphettos, Plut.

div1.head: Σφηττός
div1.sense: a deme of the Acamantian φυλή in Attica, Strab.

div1.head: σφιγγίον
div1.sense: a bracelet, necklace, Luc.

div1.head: σφίγγω
div1.sense: to bind tight, bind fast, Aesch., Theocr.:—Pass., Theocr.

div1.head: σφιγκτήρ
div1.sense: a band, lace, Anth.

div1.head: σφιγκτός
div1.sense: tight-bound: neut. pl. σφιγκτά as adv., Anth.

div1.head: Σφίγξ
div1.sense: Sphinx, a she-monster, Hes.; in Trag. represented as proposing a riddle to the Thebans, and murdering all who failed to guess it; Oedipus guessed it, and she thereupon killed herself. (Prob. form σφίγγω, the throttler.)

div1.head: σφόδρα
div1.sense: very, very much, exceedingly, violently, Hdt., Soph., etc.: with Adjs., σφ. ὑπέρτεροι far superior, Pind.; σφ. ἄδικος Plat.:—with a Subst., τὴν σφόδρα φιλίαν Plat.
σφόδρα γε, καὶ σφ. γε, in answers, most certainly, Plat.

div1.head: σφοδρός
div1.sense: vehement, violent, excessive, Thuc., etc.
of men, violent, impetuous, Plat.: also strong, robust, Xen.

div1.head: σφοδρότης
div1.sense: vehemence, violence, Xen.

div1.head: σφοδρύνω
div1.sense: Mid.-Pass. to be or become vehement, σφοδρύνεσθαι τινι to put unbounded trust in a thing, Aesch.

div1.head: σφονδύλη
div1.sense: a kind of beetle, Ar.

div1.head: σφονδύλιος
div1.sense: like σφόνδυλος, a vertebra, Il.

div1.head: σφονδυλοδίνητος
div1.sense: twirled on a spindle, Anth.

div1.head: σφόνδυλος
div1.sense: a vertebra, Ar.:—in pl. the backbone, spine, or the neck, Eur.
Lat. verticillus, the round weight attached to a spindle, Plat.

div1.head: σφός
div1.sense: their, their own, belonging to them, Il., etc.
in sg. his or her, his own or her own, Theogn.

div1.head: σφραγιδονυχαργοκομήτης
div1.sense: Comic name for a coxcomb, a long-haired fop with rings and natty nails, Ar.

div1.head: σφραγίζω
div1.sense: to seal, Eur.:—Mid. to seal for oneself, have sealed, Plut.: —Pass., perf. part. ἐσφραγισμένος sealed up, kept under seal, Aesch.
to mark as with a seal, to mark, Anth.; δεινοῖς σημάντροισιν ἐσφραγισμένοι, of wounded persons, Eur.
metaph. to set a seal on, confirm, stamp with approval, NTest., Anth.: Mid. to assure of a thing, c. acc. rei, NTest.: to limit, Anth.
to seal or accredit as a faithful servant, as a believer, τινά NTest.

div1.head: σφράγισμα
div1.sense: an impression of a signet-ring, a seal, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: σφραγίς
div1.sense: a seal, signet, seal-ring, Hdt., Ar., etc.
the gem or stone for a ring, Hdt., Luc.
the impression of a signet-ring, a seal, Soph., Thuc.:—metaph., σφρηγὶς ἐπικείσθω τοῖσδε, as a warrant, Theogn.; γλώσσῃ σφρ. ἐπικείσθω Anth.

div1.head: σφριγάω
div1.sense: to be full to bursting: of young persons, high-fed horses, etc., to be plump, fresh, vigorous, to be in full health and strength, Lat. vigere, Eur., Ar., etc.
metaph., σφριγῶν μῦθος a vigorous, violent speech, Eur.

div1.head: σφυγμός
div1.sense: a throbbing of parts, pulsation, vibration, Plut.

div1.head: σφυγμώδης
div1.sense: like the pulse, Arist.

div1.head: σφυδάω
div1.sense: metaph. to be in full vigour, Aesch.

div1.head: σφύζω
div1.sense: to throb, beat, of the pulse, Plat.: to be feverish, Theocr.

div1.head: σφῦρα
div1.sense: a hammer, Od., Hdt.
a beetle, mallet, for breaking clods of earth, Hes., Ar.

div1.head: σφυρήλατος
div1.sense: wrought with the hammer, beaten out, as opp. to cast metal (χωνευτός) , Hdt., Aesch., etc.
metaph. wrought as of iron, rigid, Luc.

div1.head: σφυρόν
div1.sense: the ankle, Il., Attic
metaph, the foot of a mountain, Pind., Anth.; also, Λιβύας ἄκρον σφυρόν the very furthest part of Libya, Theocr.

div1.head: σφωΐτερος
div1.etym: possess. adj. of σφῶι, Pron. of 2nd pers. dual
div1.sense: of you two, σφωίτερον ἔπος the word of you two, Il.; for 2nd pers. sg., thine own, thine, thy, Theocr.
of 3rd pers. sg., his or her own, Lat. suus, Theocr.

div1.head: σχαδών
div1.sense: a honey-cell, and in pl. a honeycomb, Lat. favus, Ar., Theocr.

div1.head: σχάζω
div1.sense: properly to let loose: hence to slit, open, Ar.; σχ. φλέβα to open a vein, Xen., etc.:—of flowers, σχ. κάλυκας Anth.
to let fall, drop, Xen.
to let go, σχάσας τὴν φροντίδα having let the mind go, given it play, Ar.; σχ. τὰς μηχανάς to let off the engines, Plut.

to check, stop, stay, Lat. inhibere, κώπαν σχάσον, i. e. cease rowing, Pind.; σχάσον ὄμμα lower thine eyes, Eur.:—Mid., σχασάμενος τὴν ἱππικήν having dropt oneʼs horsemanship, "given up the turf," Ar.

div1.head: σχαλίς
div1.sense: a forked stick used to prop nets, Xen.

div1.head: σχέδην
div1.sense: gently, thoughtfully, Xen.

div1.head: σχεδιάζω
div1.sense: to do a thing off-hand, Plat.

div1.head: σχεδία
div1.sense: a raft, float (such as was made off-hand, cf. σχέδιος II), Od., Thuc.; generally, a boat, ship, Eur., Theocr.
a bridge of boats, of the bridge of Xerxes, Hdt., Aesch.

div1.head: σχεδίην
div1.sense: of Place, near, close at hand, Lat. cominus, Il.
of Time, straightway, at once, Babr.

div1.head: σχέδιος
div1.sense: of Place, hand to hand, in or for close combat, Aesch.
of Time, on the spur of the moment, off-hand, Anth.

div1.head: σχεδόθεν
div1.sense: properly, from nigh at hand, nigh at hand, near, Lat. cominus, Hom.; c. gen., Od.

div1.head: σχεδόν
div1.sense: of Place, close, near, hard by, nigh, Lat. cominus, Hom., Hes.; σχεδὸν οὔτασε Il.; c. gen., γαίης σχ. Od.; c. dat., νῆσοι σχεδὸν ἀλλήλῃσι Il.
with Verbs of motion, σχ. ἐλθεῖν, ἰέναι Hom.
metaph. of relationship, Od.
of Time, θάνατος δή τοι σχ. ἐστιν Il.; σοὶ δὲ γάμος σχ. ἐστι Od.
of Degree, nearly, all but, almost, just, σχ. ταὐτά Hdt.; σχ. πάντες Hdt., etc.
with Verbs, esp. of saying or knowing, σχ. ἐπίσταμαι satis scio, Soph.; σχ. οἶδα Eur.

div1.head: σχέθω
div1.sense: to hold, Hom.
simply to have, Pind., Aesch.
to hold back, keep away or off, Hom.; αἷμα ἔσχεθον staunched the blood, Il.

div1.head: σχελίς
div1.sense: ribs of beef, Ar.

div1.head: σχένδυλα
div1.sense: a pair of pincers or tongs, Anth.

div1.head: Σχερία
div1.sense: Scheria, the island of the Phaeacians, Od.: supposed to be the same as Corcyra, Corfu.

div1.head: σχερός
div1.sense: found only in dat., ἐν σχερῷ in a line, one after another, uninterruptedly, successively, Pind.; cf. ἐπισχερώ.

div1.head: σχέσις
div1.sense: a state, condition, Luc.
generally, the nature quality, fashion of a thing, Aesch., Xen., etc.

div1.head: σχετήριον
div1.sense: a check, remedy, λιμοῦ against hunger, Eur.

div1.head: σχετλιάζω
div1.sense: to complain of hardship, to complain angrily, inveigh bitterly, Ar., Oratt.

div1.head: σχετλιασμός
div1.sense: passionate complaint, Thuc., Arist.

div1.head: σχέτλιος
div1.sense: of persons, properly, unwearying, σχέτλιος ἐσσι Il.
in bad sense, unflinching, cruel, merciless, Hom.: —so in Attic, wicked, Dem., etc.:—of beasts, savage, Hdt.

like τλήμων, miserable, wretched, unhappy, Aesch., Eur.; often with a notion of contempt, ὦ σχετλιώτατε ἀνδρῶν O most wretched fool! Hdt.; ὦ σχέτλιε Soph.; c. gen., ὦ σχετλία τῶν πόνων O wretched for thy sufferings, Eur.

of things, σχ. ὕπνος cruel sleep, during which Odysseus was abandoned by his companions, Od.; σχέτλια ἔργα cruel, shocking doings, Od.; σχέτλια παθεῖν Eur., etc.; σχ. καὶ δεινά Ar.: also, σχέτλια ἐστί, c. acc. et inf., Soph.
adv. -ίως, Isocr.

div1.head: σχῆμα
div1.sense: like Lat. habitus, form, shape, figure, Eur., Ar., etc.; as a periphr., σχῆμα πέτρας πέτρα, Soph.; σχ. δόμων Eur.
form, figure, appearance, as opp. to the reality: a show, pretence, Thuc.; ἔχει τι σχῆμα Eur.
the bearing, look, air, mien of a person, Hdt., Soph.: in pl. gestures, Xen.
the fashion, manner, way of a thing, σχ. στολῆς fashion of dress, Soph.; σχ. βίου, μάχης Eur.: absol. dress, equipment, Ar., Plat.
the form, character, characteristic property of a thing, Thuc.; βασιλείας σχ. the form of monarchy, Arist.
a figure in dancing, Ar.: in pl. pantomimic gestures, postures, Ar., etc.

div1.head: σχηματίζω
div1.etym: Pass., perf. ἐσχημάτισμαι Arist., v. infr. II.; but in sense of Mid., v. I. 2
div1.sense: intr. to assume a certain form, figure, posture or position, Plat.: absol. to gesticulate, dance figures, Ar.:—Mid., προστάσεως ἣν σχηματίζονται of the pompous appearance which they assume, Plat.

in Mid. also, to demean oneself in a certain way, make a show of being or doing, ὡς εἰδὼς ἐσχημάτισται he made as if he knew him, Plat.; c. inf., σχηματίζονται ἀμαθεῖς εἶναι they pretend to be ignorant, Plat.

trans. to give a certain form to a thing, to form, fashion, Plut.:—Mid., σχηματίζεσθαι κόμην to arrange oneʼs hair, Eur.:—Pass. to be fashioned, Aesch.; also to deck out, dress up, embellish, Luc.; to gesticulate, Xen.

div1.head: σχημάτιον
div1.sense: the figures of a dance, Hdt.

div1.head: σχηματισμός
div1.sense: the assumption of a certain form or appearance, deportment, Plat.
in bad sense, assumption of manner, pretence, Plat.

div1.head: σχηματοποιέω
div1.sense: to bring into a certain form: Pass. to take a certain shape or posture, Xen.

div1.head: σχίζα
div1.sense: a piece of wood cleft off, a lath, splinter, Lat. scindula, Od., Ar.: in pl. cleft wood, fire-wood, Hom.
an arrow, Anth.

div1.head: σχίζω
div1.sense: to split, cleave, Hes.; ἔσχισε δώδεκα μοίρας, i. e. divided them into twelve parts, Hhymn.; σχ. κάρα πελέκει Soph.

generally, to part, separate, Νεῖλος μέσην Αἴγυπτον σχίζων Hdt.:—Pass., ἐσχίσθη ὁ ποταμός Soph.; Νεῖλος σχίζεται τριφασίας ὁδούς branches into three channels, Soph.; ἐσχίζοντό σφεων αἱ γνῶμαι their opinions were divided, Soph.

div1.head: σχινοκέφαλος
div1.sense: with a squill-shaped (i. e. peaked) head, epith. of Pericles, Plut.

div1.head: σχῖνος
div1.sense: the mastich-tree, Lat. lentiscus, Theocr.
its fruit, Hdt.
a squill, = σκίλλα, Ar.

div1.head: σχίσις
div1.sense: a cleaving, cleavage, parting, division, Plat.

div1.head: σχίσμα
div1.sense: a cleft, a rent in a garment, NTest.
division of opinion, schism, NTest.

div1.head: σχισμός
div1.sense: a cleaving, Aesch.

div1.head: σχιστός
div1.sense: parted, divided, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: σχοίνινος
div1.sense: made of rushes, Eur.

div1.head: σχοινίον
div1.sense: a cord, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: σχοινισμός
div1.sense: a fencing with ropes: in pl. roping, rope-fences, Plut.

div1.head: σχοινῖτις
div1.sense: made of rushes, Anth.

div1.head: σχοινίων
div1.sense: the sedge-bird, Arist.
an effeminate air on the flute, Plut.

div1.head: σχοινοβάτης
div1.sense: a rope-dancer, schoenobates in Juven.

div1.head: σχοῖνος
div1.sense: a rush, Lat. juncus, scirpus, Hdt., Ar., etc.
a reed, used as an arrow or javelin, Batr., Ar.
a place where rushes grow, a rushbed, Od., Pind.
a rush-rope, and generally, a rope, cord, Orac. ap. Hdt.
a fence round a garden, Anth.
a land-measure, = 2 Persian parasangs, = 60 stades, Hdt.

div1.head: σχοινοτενής
div1.sense: stretched outlike a measuring line, drawn in a straight line, Hdt.; σχοινοτενὲς ποιήσασθαι to draw a straight line, Hdt.

div1.head: σχολάζω
div1.sense: to have leisure or spare time, to be at leisure, Thuc., etc.:—c. inf. to have leisure or time to do a thing, Xen.
to loiter, linger, delay, Eur., Dem.
σχ. ἀπό τινος, Lat. vacare a re, to have rest or respite from a thing, cease from doing, Xen.
σχολάζειν τινί, Lat. vacare rei, to have leisure or opportunity for a thing, to devote oneʼs time to it, Dem.; πρός τι Xen.
also c. dat. pers. to devote himself to, τοῖς φίλοις Xen.: esp. of scholars, σχ. τινί to devote oneself to a master, attend his lectures, Xen.; and absol. to give lectures, Plut.
of a place, to be vacant or unoccupied, Plut.

div1.head: σχολαῖος
div1.sense: at oneʼs leisure, leisurely, tardy, Thuc., Xen.:—adv. -ως, Xen.; comp. σχολαίτερα Hdt.; or -αίτερον, Thuc.; Sup. -αίτατα, Xen.

div1.head: σχολαιότης
div1.sense: leisureliness, laziness, Thuc.

div1.head: σχολαστήριον
div1.sense: a place for passing leisure in, Plut.

div1.head: σχολαστής
div1.sense: one who lives at ease, Plut.
as adj. leisurely, idle, βίος Plut.

div1.head: σχολαστικός
div1.sense: enjoying leisure, Lat. otiosus, Arist.; τὸ σχολαστικόν leisure, Arist.
devoting oneʼs leisure to learning, a scholar, Plut.: —in bad sense, a pedant, simpleton, Luc.

div1.head: σχολή
div1.sense: spare time, leisure, rest, ease, Lat. otium, Hdt., etc.; σχολὴν ἄγειν and ἔχειν to be at leisure, keep quiet, Eur., etc.; σχ. ποιεῖσθαι to find leisure, Xen.; σχ. λαβεῖν Eur.; σχολή ἐστί μοι I have time, Ar., etc.:—with a prep., ἐπὶ σχολῆς at leisure, at a fit time, Eur.; κατὰ σχολήν Eur.
c. gen. rest from a thing, σχολῇ κακοῦ Soph.; so, σχ. ἀπό τινος Plat.
idleness, Eur.
that in which leisure is employed, esp. a learned discussion, lecture, Plat., etc.
a place for lectures, a school, Arist., etc.
σχολῇ as adv. in a leisurely way, tardily, like σχολαίως, Soph., Thuc., etc.

at oneʼs leisure, i. e. scarcely, hardly, not at all, Soph., etc.; σχολῇ γε Soph.:—to introduce an a fortiori argument, εἰ αὗται μὴ ἀκριβεῖς εἰσί, σχολῇ αἱ ἄλλαι if these are not exact, hardly can the rest be so, Plat.

div1.head: σχόλιον
div1.sense: a short note, scholium, Luc.

div1.head: σῴζω
div1.sense: to save, keep:
of persons, to save from death, keep alive, preserve, Hom., Attic
of things, to keep safe, preserve, Hom.:—Mid. to keep or preserve for oneself, Soph., etc.
to keep, observe, maintain laws, etc., Trag.:—Pass., Thuc.
to keep in mind, remember, Eur., Plat.:—so in Mid., Soph., Plat.

with a sense of motion to a place, to bring one safe to, τὸν δʼ ἐσάωσεν ἐς ποταμοῦ προχοάς Od.; σω. τινὰ πρὸς ἤπειρον Aesch.:—in Pass. to come safe, escape to a place, ἐς οἶκον Hdt.; ἐπὶ θάλατταν Xen.
to carry off safe, rescue from danger, ἐκ πολέμου Il.; ἐκ θανάτοιο Od.; ἀπὸ στρατείας Aesch.:—c. gen., ἐχθρῶν σῶσαι χθόνα to rescue the land from enemies, Soph.; Pass., σωθῆναι κακῶν Eur.
c. inf., αἵ σε σώζουσιν θανεῖν who save thee from dying, Eur.
absol., τὰ σώσοντα what is likely to save, Dem.

div1.head: σωκέω
div1.sense: to have strength, Aesch.
c. inf. to be in a condition to do, Soph.

div1.head: σῶκος
div1.sense: the stout, strong one, of Hermes, Il.

div1.head: Σωκρατέω
div1.sense: to do like Socrates, to Socratize, Ar.

div1.head: Σωκράτης
div1.sense: Socrates: gen. Σωκράτους: acc. Σωκράτην Xen., but also (as if of 3rd decl.) Σωκράτη Ar., Plat.

div1.head: Σωκρατίδιον
div1.sense: dear little Socrates, Ar.

div1.head: Σωκρατικός
div1.sense: Socratic, of Socrates, Arist., etc.; οἱ Σωκρ. the philosophers of his school, Luc. adv. -κῶς, more Socratico, Cic.

div1.head: σωλήν
div1.sense: a channel, gutter, pipe, Hdt.

div1.head: σῶμα
div1.sense: the body of a man: in Hom. always the dead body, corpse, carcase, whereas the living body is δέμας.
the living body, Hes., Hdt., Attic; τὸ σ. σώζειν or -εσθαι to save oneʼs life, Dem., Thuc.; ἔχειν τὸ σ. κακῶς, ὡς βέλτιστα, to be in a bad, a good state of body, Xen.
body, as opp. to the soul (ψυχή) , Plat., etc.; τὰ τοῦ σ. ἔργα bodily labours, Xen.; τὰ εἰς τὸ σ. τιμήματα bodily punishments, Aeschin.
periphr., ἀνθρώπου σῶμα ἄνθρωπος, Hdt.; esp. in Trag., σῶμα θηρός ὁ θήρ, Soph., etc.:—often of slaves, σ. αἰχμάλωτα Dem., etc
generally, a body, i. e. any material substance, Plat., etc.
the whole body or mass of a thing, ὑπὸ σώματι γῆς Aesch.; τὸ σ. τῆς πίστεως the body of the proof, Arist.

div1.head: σωμασκέω
div1.sense: to exercise the body, Xen.:— metaph., σ. τὸν πόλεμον to train oneself for war, Plut.

div1.head: σωμασκία
div1.sense: bodily exercise, training of the body, esp. of an athletic kind, Xen., etc.

div1.head: σωματικός
div1.sense: of or for the body, bodily, Lat. corporeus, Arist.:—adv. -κῶς, NTest.
bodily, corporeal, material, Arist.

div1.head: σωμάτιον
div1.sense: a poor body, Isocr.

div1.head: σωματοειδής
div1.sense: of the nature of a body, bodily, material, Plat.

div1.head: σωματοποιέω
div1.sense: to make into a body, to consolidate, organise, Polyb.
to provide with bodily strength, to recruit, Polyb.

div1.head: σωματοφθορέω
div1.sense: to corrupt the body, Aesch.

div1.head: σωματοφυλάκιον
div1.sense: a place where a body is kept, a sepulchre, Luc.

div1.head: σώρακος
div1.sense: a basket or box, Babr.

div1.head: σωρείτης
div1.sense: masc. adj. heaped up: ὁ σωρείτης συλλογισμός a sorites or heap of syllogisms, the conclusion of one forming the premiss of the next, Luc.

div1.head: σώρευμα
div1.sense: a heap, pile, Xen.

div1.head: σωρεύω
div1.sense: to heap one thing on another, Lat. coacervare, Arist., NTest.
to heap with something, c. dat., Anth.

div1.head: σωρηδόν
div1.sense: by heaps, in heaps, Anth.

div1.head: σωρός
div1.sense: a heap, Lat. acervus, Hes., etc.
generally, a heap, quantity, Ar.

div1.head: σωσίπολις
div1.sense: saving the city, Ar.

div1.head: σῶς
div1.etym: the Ionic σόος, is used by Hom. in all cases except the nom. sg. σῶς.
σῶος, used by Attic writers only in pl. σῶοι, σῶαι, σῶα.
the radic. form σάος, occurs in the comp. σαώτερος, v. sub σάος.
div1.sense: radic. sense safe and sound, alive and well, in good case, Lat. salvus, Hom., Hdt., Thuc.
of things, sound, whole, safe, Hom.
of events, safe, sure, certain, νῦν σῶς αἰπὺς ὄλεθρος Il.

div1.head: σωστέος
div1.sense: one must save, Eur.

div1.head: σῶστρα
div1.sense: a reward for saving oneʼs life, a thankoffering for deliverance, σῶστρα τοῦ παιδὸς θύειν Hdt.; σ. τίνειν Luc.
a reward for bringing back lost cattle or slaves, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: σώτειρα
div1.sense: fem. of σωτήρ, Hdt., Eur., etc.
epith. of goddesses (cf. Juno Sospita), Pind., Ar.

div1.head: σωτηρία
div1.sense: a saving, deliverance, preservation, safety, Lat. salus, Hdt., Attic; σ. τινὶ διδόναι, φέρειν Eur.; σωτηρίαν ἔχειν Soph., etc.
a way or means of safety, Aesch., Eur., etc.
a safe return, ἡ ἐς τὴν πατρίδα σ. Thuc.; ἡ οἴκαδε σωτηρία Dem.; also, νόστιμος σ. Aesch.
of things, a keeping safe, preservation, τινός of anything, Hdt., Aesch., etc.
security, guarantee for safety, σ. ἔστω τινός guarantee for the safe keeping of a thing, ap. Dem.; σωτηρίαι τῆς πολιτείας ways of preserving it, Arist.
security, safety, Thuc.

div1.head: σωτήριος
div1.sense: saving, delivering, Thuc., Plat., etc.; ἐλπὶς σπέρματος σωτηρίου hope of seed to preserve the race, Aesch.:—c. dat. bringing safety or deliverance to one, Aesch., Eur.:—comp. -ιώτερος, η, ον, more likely to bring safety, Xen.
of persons, much like σωτήρ, Soph., Eur.
as Subst., σωτήρια, ων, τά, like σωτηρία, deliverance, safety, Aesch., Soph.; so in sg., πόλεως σ. Aesch.
σωτήρια (sc. ἱερά), τά, a thankoffering for deliverance, Xen.

div1.head: σωτήρ
div1.sense: a saviour, deliverer, preserver, c. gen. subjecti, τῆς Ἑλλάδος saviour of Greece, Hdt.; also c. gen. objecti, σ. νόσου, κακῶν a preserver from disease, ills, Soph., Eur.

epith. of protecting gods, esp. of Ζεὺς Σωτήρ, Pind., Trag.: to him the third cup of wine was dedicated, τρίτον Σωτῆρι σπένδειν Pind., etc.; proverb., τὸ τρίτον τῷ σωτῆρι the third (i. e. the lucky) time, Plat.; of other gods, as of Apollo, Hermes, Aesch.; even with fem. deities, Τύχη σωτήρ, for σώτειρα, Aesch.
in NTest. the Saviour.
in Poets, as an adj., saving, Aesch.; with fem. Subst., σωτῆρες τιμαί the office or prerogative of saving, of the Dioscuri, Eur.

div1.head: σωφρονέω
div1.sense: to be sound of mind, Hdt.
to be temperate, discreet, shew self-control, Aesch., Ar., etc.; σ. περὶ τοὺς θεούς Xen.
to come to oneʼs senses, learn self-control, Hdt., etc.
Pass., τὰ σεσωφρονημένα μοι things I had done with discretion, Aeschin.

div1.head: σωφρόνημα
div1.sense: an instance of temperance, Xen.

div1.head: σωφρονητέον
div1.sense: one must be temperate, Luc.

div1.head: σωφρονίζω
div1.sense: to recal a person to his senses, to chasten, Eur., Xen., etc.:—Pass. to be chastened, to learn self-control, Thuc., etc.
of passions, to correct, moderate, Xen.; so, σ. ἀμπνοάς to pant less violently, Eur.; ἐς εὐτέλειαν σ. to reduce expenses, Thuc.

div1.head: σωφρονικός
div1.sense: naturally temperate, moderate, sober, Xen., etc.:—adv. -κῶς, Ar.

div1.head: σωφρονιστής
div1.sense: one that makes temperate, a chastener, chastiser, Thuc., Plat., etc.

div1.head: σωφροσύνη
div1.sense: soundness of mind, moderation, discretion, Od., Theogn., Attic
moderation in desires, self-control, temperance, chastity, sobriety, Lat. temperantia, modestia, Ar., Plat., etc.

div1.head: σώφρων
div1.note: σώ-φρων, Epic σᾰό-φρων, ονος, ὁ, ἡ,
div1.sense: of sound mind, Lat. sanae mentis:— hence sensible, discreet, wise, Hom., Hdt., Xen.
of things, σώφρονα εἰπεῖν Eur.; ἄλλο τι σωφρονέστερον γιγνώσκειν Thuc.:— σῶφρόν ἐστι, c. inf., Thuc.
having control over the sensual desires, temperate, self-controlled, moderate, chaste, sober, Trag., Plat., etc.:—so, σ. γνώμη Aesch.; σ. ἀριστοκρατία Thuc.
τὸ σῶφρον σωφροσύνη, Eur., Thuc., etc.
adv. -όνως, Hdt.—comp. σωφρονέστερον, Thuc.; so, ἐπὶ τὸ σωφρονέστερον Hdt.:—but -εστέρως, Eur.:—Sup. -έστατα, Isocr.
